loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en: Norn, originally from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is 48 years old and married. She is the mother of six children, but now only three kids are dependent on her as those kids are in school. Rice farming and paid-working jobs are the sources of income for her family. This is the first loan for Norn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen de 51 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su tenacidad y con el apoyo de su compañero de vida ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos ya mayores de edad, y actualmente se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace 7 años. Carmen desea reparar el techo de su vivienda, dado que se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, capotes y pines para reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Carmen is 51 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and her family unit.  She is a woman who was able to get her now-adult children ahead thanks to her determination and her life partner's support, and she currently earns her living offering home cleaning services, which she has been doing for seven years now.  Carmen wants to repair the roof of her home because it has deteriorated, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheet metal, tarps, and beams to repair the roof on her home.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, tarps, and means to repair the roof on her home.

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en:
Vannak is a 28-year-old  mother with a young child. They live in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, 

She earns an income growing rice and working as a paid worker.  She has  earned money to support her living for seven years. This is the first loan for Vannak with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a  2-member group  and will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farm.

She really hopes that this loan can help her land to produce a better yield than in previous years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Dina Abigail

texts.es: Dina tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 5 años y un años de edad. Dina trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Dina desea construir una pila y un baño pero no cuenta con el efectivo necesario para hacer la inversión. Por lo anterior Dina solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: arena, ladrillo, hierro, cemento, etc. para la construcción de una pila y baño.
texts.en: Dina is 26 and lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children, 5 and 1 years of age. Dina has worked as a domestic employee since a long time ago and this is how, along with her life partner, they maintain the economy of the home. Dina wishes to construct a water cistern and a bathroom but doesn't have the necessary cash to make the investment. Because of the aforementioned, Dina is applying for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of the necessary materials like: sand, bricks, iron, cement, etc. for the construction of a water cistern and bathroom.

loans.use: to buy: sand, bricks, iron, cement, etc. for the construction of a water cistern and bathroom.

loans.name: Soeurt's Group

texts.en:
Soeurt is 35 years old and resides in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a mother of four children, two attend school and two are not school age. 

To support her whole family, she grows rice to earn about 45,000 KHR per day. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her previous loan. She leads a 2-member group and  will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. 

She hopes to triple her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Socheat is a 31-year-old mother with four children. She earns a living growing cassava and raising pigs. Her husband works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns about 15,000 KHR per day to feed the family. 

Socheat is a first cycled client with VisionFund. She requests a loan to buy more piglets and feed. 

She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Serb's Group

texts.en:
Serb is a 32-year-old married woman with three children. They live in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district,

Serb and her husband are farmers who grow rice and sometimes work for others for a fee. They have been in the business for 10 years and earn 40,000 KHR daily and save about 18,000KHR each day. 

This is the fourth loan for Serb with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She leads her group to request a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm. She hopes that this loan will enable her to extend her rice plantation and  produce healthy crops to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: Mariana de 39 años de edad  es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que todos los días sale a ganarse la vida elaborando diversidad  de artesanías en barro como: comales, vasijas, floreros, etc. Ella cuenta con una gran experiencia en su trabajo ya que realiza dicha actividad desde hace más de 20 años por lo que cuenta con una extensa cartera de clientes, y cada día son más los que solicitan sus productos por ser de excelente calidad. Mariana siempre se ha esforzado el doble ya que ha tenido que sacar adelante a su hijo ella sola. La vivienda de Mariana no cuenta con un corredor por lo que cuando llueve el agua ingresa a la vivienda lo que está causando que sus pertenencias se deterioren, además las paredes de la vivienda se encuentran deterioradas, por lo que desea repararlas, al no contar con los fondos necesarios Mariana decidió solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines, pines, cemento y arena para construir un corredor y reparar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mariana, 39, is a single mother and lives in her own home with her son. She is a hardworking woman who, every day, goes out to earn a living making a diversity of artisanal products from clay like: comales [for cooking tortillas], pots, vases, etc. She has great experience in her work since she has been carrying out said activity for more than 20 years. Therefore, she has an extensive customer base, and every day there are more who order her products for their excellent quality. Mariana has always pushed herself doubly since she's had to get her son ahead alone.

Mariana's home doesn't have a hallway, so when it rains water enters the home which is causing her belongings to deteriorate. Additionally, the walls of the home are deteriorated, which is why she wishes to repair them. Upon not having the necessary funds, Mariana decided to apply for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: laminate roofing, supports, fasteners, cement and sand to construct a hallway and to repair the walls of her home.

loans.use: to invest in: laminate roofing, supports, fasteners, cement and sand to construct a hallway and repair the walls of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furnishings for his home and clothing

loans.name: Morena Del Carmen

texts.es: Morena de 39 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa de un familiar junto a sus dos hijos, es muy conocida como una persona honrada y trabajadora, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Morena solicita un crédito para la compra de azúcar, granos básicos, aceite, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para darles un mejor nivel de vida  a su  familia.
texts.en:
Morena, 39, is a single mother who lives in the home of a relative with her two children.  She is known as an honorable and hardworking person.  She has a small store that is located in her house, and with the earnings from her sales she manages to pay for the household necessities.  

Morena is requesting a loan to buy sugar, staple consumer products, cooking oil, snacks, drinks, etc., so that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, consumer staples, cooking oil, snacks, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reinforce the walls of his home.

loans.name: Tau's Group

texts.en:
Tau is a 36-year-old mother with  five children and a farmer from Kampong Cham province. 

She earns money growing rice  and working a job. She earns about 30,600 KHR per day. This is first time for Tau with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is a leader of a 4-member group and will used the loan portion to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and rice seed. 

She hopes that she can gradually improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and rice seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Maria Teresa Martel

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, azúcar, huevos, detergentes, jabón, etc. y asi obtener mejores ingresos para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria lives in her own house with her family group. She has had a store located in her residence for a number of years. She has many customers because of the variety of products that she sells. Maria is applying for a loan to purchase basic grains, sugar, eggs, detergents, soap, etc., and thus obtain better income in order to have a better quality of life along with her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, eggs, detergents, soap, etc.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan, 45, is a farmer from Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four children. 

She earns a living growing rice and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. This is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the leader of a 5-member group. She will spend her entire loan portion to build a new house. 

She hopes on this loan can improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to build a new house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Juan Edgardo

texts.es: Juan de 29 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 3 años de edad. Él es un hombre reconocido en su cantón como responsable y trabajador, que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios en una finca cercana a su cantón, además su compañera de vida lo apoya con la economía del hogar. Juan se encuentra preocupado ya que en su vivienda no se cuenta con uno de los servicios más básicos de un hogar como es el agua potable y desea instalarlo lo antes posible, pero al no contar con los recursos económicos necesarios solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tubos, grifos y codos para instalar agua potable en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan, aged 29, lives in his own home with his common-law wife and their three-year-old daughter.

In his hamlet, he is known for being a responsible and hard-working man who makes a living working in a farm close to his hamlet. Moreover, his wife helps him to keep the household afloat.

Juan is worried because his home doesn't have access to one of the most basic services, which is drinking water, and he wishes to install this service as soon as possible. However, since he can't afford to do so, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase pipes, taps, and elbows to install a drinking water system in his home.

loans.use: to purchase pipes, taps, and elbows to install a drinking water system in his home.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La socia Georgina se sigue dedicando al negocio de preparacion de bocaditos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de bocaditos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar harina,huevos y mantequilla.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Georgina is continuing with her business making snacks.  She works from 8am until 6pm.  She already has a number of years of experience with this business, and it is doing very well.  Georgina's dream is to expand her business selling snacks.  She is requesting a loan to buy flour, eggs, and butter.

Georgina is happy to be getting this loan, and she promises to make the required payments.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, and butter

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra de 31 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una venta de zapatos y productos de uso personal, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, Sandra está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas zapatos y mas productos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sandra, who is 31 years old, lives with her husband and their two children. She has a shop with shoes and products for personal use. Her business is located near her place of residence in a zone with a lot of traffic. She has many customers because of the quality of the products and the good prices. Sandra is applying for a loan to purchase more shoes and more products wholesale in order to continue with her sales and thus be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and more products wholesale

loans.name: Sokmouern's Group

texts.en:
Sokmeourn is a 27-year-old married woman who resides in Kampong Cham province. She is blessed with two young children. 

She struggles to earn a living growing rice and cucumbers.  She  earns about 39,400 KHR per day. This is the second micro-loan for Sokmoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has successfully repaid  her previous loan. 

She is the leader of a 2-member group and  will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing. 

She hopes to obtain a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Tuungane B Group

texts.fr: Denise est une femme ambitieuse, membre du collectif de crédits Tuungane B, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un chauffeur, âgée de 30ans, mère de 2 enfants, tous 2 vont à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de sa mère. Elle est vendeuse  des poissons sur la route secondaire. Elle va s’approvisionner en pissons frais, fumés et salés. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son activité et achever sa maison. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Denise is an ambitious women and a member of Tuungane B Group, clients of [microfinance institution] Hekima. She is married to a 30-year-old driver and is the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. 

Denise started her business with money received from her mother. She sells fish on a back road. She is going to stock up on fresh, smoked, and salted fish. Denise hopes to obtain more loans to expand her business and finish her house. Denise would like to end by thanking Hekima for the support they provide to entrepreneurs who lack access to finance through the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To purchase fresh, smoked, and salted fish.

loans.name: Familia Responsable  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Familia Responsable está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio alegres y muy trabajadoras que siempre buscan un mejor futuro para sus familias, laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten tener sus ingresos propios. Viven en la parroquia Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, este sector es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura y muchos salen a la ciudad a realizar diferentes trabajos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Carmen, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres que es propia.
Doña Carmen trabaja como empleada privada en una fábrica de lunes a viernes, en su casa y siguiendo el ejemplo de sus padres se dedica a la cría de ganado, cuyes y gallinas, también a la agricultura que es para la venta y consumo de su casa. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de cuyes y gallinas. Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
The loan group Familia Responsable is made up of 8 female members and 1 male member. They are happy, hardworking people who always search for a better future for their families. They work in different jobs, which allow them to have their own earnings. They live in the neighborhood of Victoria del Portete in Cuenca; this area has a cold climate, and its people devote themselves to cattle raising and agriculture. Many leave for the city in order to perform different jobs. 

One of the members of this group is Miss Carmen. She is 22 years old, single, and lives in her parents' home. Miss Carmen works as an employee at a factory from Monday to Friday. At home, following her parents' example, she devotes herself to raising cattle, guinea pigs (a traditional food source in Ecuador), and chickens. She also grows food to sell and for personal consumption. The money from this loan is to buy guinea pigs and chickens. Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Fernando Isabel

texts.es: Fernando de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia, el trabaja en una empresa privada, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para poner las puertas y ventanas, por esa razón solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar vidrios de las ventanas, puertas y pago de mano de obra, así el y su familia puedan vivir más seguros.
texts.en: Fernando is 30 years old and lives in his own home. He works at a private company; with what he earns from his job, he is able to pay for some household expenses. He wants to improve his home, but what he earns from his work is not enough to install the doors and windows. For this reason, he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy window glass, doors, and to pay for labor; this way, he and his family can live more safely.

loans.use: to buy window glass, doors, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
La socia Cornelia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza platos como pollipapas es un plato a base de pollo y papas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para comprar papas y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Cornelia works in her business of selling food. She makes dishes such as "pollipapas," which is a dish based on chicken and potatoes. She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She has already had this business for 8 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is applying for the loan to buy products such as potatoes and chicken.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy products such as potatoes and chicken to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Sokea's Group

texts.en:
Sokea is a 37-year-old  married woman blessed with five children living in the  Bovel district of Battambang province. 

She grows rice  and cassava as the main source of income to secure the basic needs of her family. 

Sokea, a member of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) has a successful repayment history.  She is the leader of a 2-member group and will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing,  buy cassava plants, and pay  labor costs. 

She hopes that she can improve her income.

loans.use: to buy cassava plants, and to pay  labor costs.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from the Moung Russey district in Battambang province, Nat is a young mother in late 20s with two little kids. She grows rice on five hectares of farmland as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This is the fourth cycle for Nat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She hopes to gain a better yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Phanny's Group

texts.en:
Phanny, a resident from Kampong Cham province, is 41 years old and married. She is a mother of four children, one attends school. 

She earns an income growing rice and  supplements her income selling groceries.  She earns about 33,000 KHR per day. 

She successfully  repaid  her previous loan which she used to improve her living conditions. She leads a 2-member group and will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer  and buy groceries. 

She hopes that she can support her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer  and groceries..

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea, a resident from Banan district of Pursat Province, is 48 years old and married. 

She deals with her daily cost of living growing rice on  one and half hectare of land. She earns about 44,000 KHR per day. 

She had a first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and leads a 2-member group to apply for a new loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds.

 She hopes that she can improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel vive en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de La Paz. Esta divorciado y tiene dos hijos 
Actualmente trabaja en una entidad publica por mas de diez horas y con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de alquileres y servicios básicos. 
Necesita credito para pagar un examen medico personal. Angel es sociologo de profesion y no tiene a quien acudir
texts.en:
Ángel lives in a rented house in the city of La Paz. He is divorced and has two children. 

He now works for a public organization for more than ten hours a day, and with the income that he has, he needs to cover the costs of food, education, rental payments, and basic services.

He needs the loan in order to pay for a personal medical exam. Ángel is a sociologist, and he has no one to turn to.

loans.use: to pay for a personal medical exam

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: Franklin esta divorciado y tiene 3 hijos El cliente vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Franklin trabaja como chofer y sufre de dolores pero quiere colaborar a sus nietos comprandoles una computadora laptop que les sirva para hacer tareas Franklin no tiene a quien acudir por eso necesita su ayuda, sus hijos tienen muchos gastos y no pueden invertir en la compra de la computadora Por si acaso, en la foto aparece Franklin con otros clientes de IMPRO que no estan vinculados a él.
texts.en: Franklin is divorced and has 3 children. The client lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house, which is his property. Franklin works as a chauffeur and suffers from pain, but he wants to work with his grandchildren by buying them a laptop computer; this will help them to do their homework. Franklin does not have anyone to count on, and therefore he needs your help. His children have a lot of expenses and they cannot invest in the purchase of a computer. Just in case, Franklin appears in the photo with other IMPRO clients that are not associated with him.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his grandchildren.

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Yoeurn is a 50-year-old widow with four children, one attends school. 

To keep her family out of poverty, she grows rice and works for others for a fee during her  spare time. She is a new VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) member and leads a group of three to get a new loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to purchase fertilizer and pay for plowing. 

She hopes that she can gain a good yield.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizer and pay for plowing.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Battambang province, Nak is a father of five children and is 52 years old. His big familycounts on a single business, maize farming, which generates about 36,000 KHR per day for them. This is the first loan for Nak with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, he formed a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds, and to pay the plowing. He hopes to triple his yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds, and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Savan's Group

texts.en:
Savan is a 26-year-old mother with 1 child living  in Battambang province's  Moung Russey district. 

She deals with her daily cost of living selling fruit. This is the first micro-loan for Savan’s group.  As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more fruit. 

She hopes that she can improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng, a local farmer from Banteay Meanchey province, is 55 years old and has five children. She grows rice and raises chickens as the main source of income, and earns about 26,800 KHR per day. 

Heng has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for seven cycles and has a successful repayment history. She  needs  capital to further support her business. She formed a 2-member group to get a new loan. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her crop. She hopes that she can improve her yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her crop.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to tile a bedroom.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia Mercedes se sigue dedicando al negocio de hospedaje,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,le sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de hospedaje.La socia solicita el credito para comprar colchones y camas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Mercedes continues working in the guesthouse business. She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She has already been in this business for 7 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her guesthouse business. She is applying for the loan to purchase mattresses and beds.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy mattresses and beds.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La socia Sandra se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de medicinas, la socia tiene una botica donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de botica. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar medicamentos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Sandra continues to devote herself to medicine sales. The member has a pharmacy where she works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. The member has worked in this business for several years, and it is going very well. The member's dream is to grow the pharmacy business. The member is asking for a loan to buy medicine. 

The member is happy, thanks to the loan, and promises to honor the payments of her debt.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en: Mon is 48 years old and a married father of three children. To earn a living, he grows rice and plants rubber trees. During his spare time, he works for others for a fee. These businesses earn him about 25,000 KHR per day. Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, he formed a group of five to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy insecticide for his crop and to buy fertilizer for his rubber trees. He hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy insecticide for his crop and fertilizer for his rubber tree.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en: A local resident from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Vannak is 40 years old, married and blessed with four children. Three of the children are in school and one is too young for schooling. She deals with her daily cost of living via cassava and rice farming. This business has generated her about 31,000 KHR per day. Vannak, a former borrower who has fully repaid back her past loan completely, formed a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Bak's Group

texts.en: Residing in Battambang province, Bak is 59 years old and a widowed mother of 10 children. She secures the basic needs of her family via rice farming. This business has returned her about 19,400 KHR per day. This is the fourth cycle for Bak with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan and it has improved her lifestyle gradually. Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer and pay for plowing the field. She hopes that she can gain a better yield.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer and pay for plowing the field.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose Luis es soltero y no tiene hijos El cliente esta viviendo con sus abuelos en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento, la pintura interior de la casa esta muy desgastada. Jose Luis esta ganandose la vida como peluquero canino y el credito lo invertira en la compra de pintura para refaccionar las paredes de su casa Jose Luis es la unica fuente de ingresos para el hogar, la jubilacion de los abuelos no alcanca, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Jose Luis is single and has no children. He lives with his grandparents in La Paz in a house of brick and cement. The interior paint in the house is very worn out. Jose Luis is earning a living as a dog groomer, and he will invest the loan in the purchase of paint to refresh the walls of his house. Jose Luis is the only source of income for the household. The pension of his grandparents is not enough, and so he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy paint to refresh the walls of his house

loans.name: Carmen Estela

texts.es: Carmen de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que todos los días se esfuerza por salir adelante al lado de su compañero de vida, vendiendo diversidad de frutas partidas enfrente de su casa de habitación donde se acercan sus clientes a solicitar sus productos. Carmen desea encementar el piso del corredor de su vivienda, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para lograrlo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: Carmen, who is 31 years old, lives in her own house along with her life companion and her family group. She is an entrepreneurial woman who every day makes an effort to get ahead at the side of her life companion. She sells a variety of cut-up fruits in front of her house, where her customers come to seek her products. Carmen wants to cement the floor of the passageway of her house, but she doesn't have the necessary money to do it. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor of the passageway of her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor of the passageway of her house.

loans.name: Soeng's Group

texts.en: Soeng is a mother of two dependent kids residing in Bovel district of Battambang province. She manages the needs of her family via a vegetable garden and a paid-working job. This business has generated her about 32,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Soeng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, in a group of two, she is leader. For Soeng, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the plowing fee and buy fertilizer. She hopes to gain a good yield from her vegetable farming better than before.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing fee and buy fertilizer for her farming activity.

loans.name: Seanghai's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Seanghai is a 45-year-old married mother of five children. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice for 28 years. To better support the family, she works as a paid worker to earn additional income. The current business earns her about 56,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 37,000 KHR each day for future needs.
 
Seanghai has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loan has helped Seanghai to better support her family and increase the business. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business and make more income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en: Phan is 54 years old and is a married mother of five children. She struggles to make a living via her rice cropping and tailoring businesses. She has been involved in her current businesses for several years and earns about 18,600 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Phan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it has returned her a decent income to improve her lifestyle. Now, in a group of three, she is the leader. For Phan, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy rice seed and insecticide for her crop. She highly hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Roeurn's Group

texts.en: Roeurn, a local farmer from Battambang province and a mother of seven children, is 52 years old. She is one of the breadwinners in the family, who makes a living via rice cropping. This business earns her about 35,000 KHR per day. Roeurn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages; she has completed the past six cycles with a successful repayment history. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader, Roeurn will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, and rice seed for her crop. She hopes that she can make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop.

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en: A resident from Battambang province, Rat is 51 years old and married. She is a mother of five children. For her family, rice cropping and a paid-working job are the main sources of her family's income. This is not the first loan for Rat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan completely and now she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy five sacks of fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can get a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Saly's Group

texts.en: Saly, aged 55, is a married mother of eight children. She is a local farmer who grows rice and cassava as the main source of income. During her spare time, she works for others for a fee. Now, she is in need of working capital. Therefore, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. For Saly, the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the plowing and transplanting fee, and to buy rice seed. She hopes that she can get a better income than before.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing and transplanting fee, and to buy rice seed.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en: Sarun, age 32, is a resident from Battambang province where her business is run. She has two dependent children and they are too young for schooling. Rice farming, cow raising, and vegetable farming are the main sources of her income and she earns a decent income to secure the daily basic needs of the family. Sarun, a previous borrower who has fully repaid her past loan, formed a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy an additional cow to raise. She hopes that she can expand her animal husbandry business and make good improvements in her life.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow to raise

loans.name: Roeurn's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Battambang province, Roeurn is 33 years old and a mother of two children. One of her children is under-aged for schooling and one is in school. For her family, rice cropping and a paid working job have returned her about 25,000 KHR per day as her main source of income. This is the second loan for Roeurn with a successful repayment of the past loan, and the first loan for her co-borrower in a group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes to make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en: La, a local farmer from Battambang province, is 31 years old and a married mother blessed with three schoolchildren. She strives for a living via rice farming and selling hot soy milk.  She has been involved in her current businesses for five years. Including this loan, this is the third loan for La with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan wisely. Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and buy fertilizer for her crop farming. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and buy fertilizer for her crop farming.

loans.name: Roeurn's Group

texts.en: Roeurn, a farmer from Battambang province is 51 years old. She is the mother of four children. She earns a living via rice cropping and works for others. This business earns her about 39,000 KHR per day. Roeurn, who is in her third cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) has a successful repayment of her past two loans. She formed this group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the plowing fee and labor cost, and to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She hopes to support her business so she can make a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing fee and labor cost, and to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farming activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement blocks, sand, gravel, rebar, sheet metal, lumber and cement, and to pay for labor for constructing a house on his parcel of land.

loans.name: 08 - Phú Thọ 2 - Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy works in agriculture, raising pigs. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Thủy is 48 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2012, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy is the group leader of the 08 - Phú Thọ 2 - Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en: Lim, a local farmer from Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, is 60 years old and a mother of four children. For her family, rice and cassava are the main crop-farming business that generates about 33,000 KHR per day along with the paid-working job that she has during her spare time. Now, she is in need of working capital. Therefore, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed, and to pay for the plowing fee for her cash-crops. She hopes to make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy seed, and to pay for plowing fee for her cash-crops.

loans.name: Leun's Group

texts.en: A villager from Kampong Cham province, Leun is 32 years old and a widowed mother of one child. She supports her life as a single mother via her occupation as a teacher at a kindergarten and her rice cropping business. This is the first loan for Leun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of five to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can make a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chamnan's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Phom Proek district, Chamnan is 26 and has two children in total. Chamnan and her husband are farmers who have been farming rice and growing cassava for 12 years to make a living. 

Chamnan is with VisionFund for this loan cycle. She is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice and cassava healthily and also hopes to make more rice to better her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Ly, a villager from Battambang province, is 48 years old and a married mother of two children. She solely counts on her cassava farming on four hectares of land as her main business and paid-working job to overcome the needs in her family. Now, she is in need of working capital to support her business. Therefore, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee, labor cost, and to buy cassava seedlings for replanting. She hopes to get a better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee, labor cost, and to buy cassava seedlings for replanting.

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en: Sreymao, age 35, is a mother of two schoolchildren. Her sources of income are from pig raising and her paid working job. She has been involved in this business for ages. This is the first loan for Sreymao with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. For Sreymao, she will spend her loan portion to buy piglets for raising. She hopes to expand her business on a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy piglets

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nhóm 10,thôn 6, Trường Giang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vân works in agriculture, raising poultry. Vân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Vân faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Vân is 39 years old, and she is married with two children. Vân is the group leader of the Nhóm 10, thôn 6, Trường Giang solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

In 2013, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Vân hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Sivorn's Group

texts.en: A mother of one little kid residing in Battambang province, Sivorn is 26 years old and a local farmer who grows cassava as the main source of income. This business has returned her about 35,000 KHR per day. This is the original loan for Sivorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she teams up as a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing and rice seed for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and rice seed for her crop.

loans.name: Nalin's Group

texts.en: A villager from Kampong Cham province, Nalin is 42 years old and a married mother of two children. She earns a living via cassava and her paid-working job. This business has earned her about 38,000 KHR per day. Nalin, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is a leader of a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy herbicide for her crop. She hopes to get a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy herbicide for her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en: Phy, a mother of seven children, is 54 years old and married. She can support the daily food consumption for her family via rice and cassava farming. Now, she is in need of working capital to support her business. Therefore, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fee, to buy rice seed, and to cover transplantation fee. She hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and to cover transplantation fee.

loans.name: 01 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương works in agriculture, growing vegetables. Hương has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetable seeds to grow and sell in the future.

Hương is 52 years old, and she is married with two children. Hương is the group leader of the 01 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of five members. Hương lives  in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetable seeds to grow and sell in the future

loans.name: Saroeurn's Group

texts.en: Saroeurn is 43 years old and a married. She has six children who are in school. To tackle the hardship of her big family, she does cassava farming and rice cropping as the main sources of income, and spends her spare time working for others for a fee. Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. Due to the lack of working capital, she takes a loan of 1,600,000 KHR whereas her co-borrower requests 1,000,000 KHR. Saroeurn, the group leader, will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing and buy rice seed for her crop. She hopes this loan can make her family better off.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and to buy rice seed for her crop.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en: Sopha, a local farmer from the Kampong Cham province, is 39 years old and blessed with five children. Nowadays, she needs to support only three kids since one is still in school and two are too young for schooling. She can earn about 41,000 KHR per day. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, so she will form a group of five to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a wooden board and to pay the labor costs to renovate her house. She hopes to fix her house on time so that she does not need to worry during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy a wooden board and to pay the labor costs to renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Lin's Group

texts.en: Lin, a resident from Battambang province, is 59 years old and married. She is the mother of five children. To secure the needs of the family, she grows cassava and rice as the main business and works for others for a fee during her spare time. This is not the first loan for Lin with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan. Now, in a group of three, she is the leader. For Lin, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing and rice seed for her crop. She highly believes that she can make a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and rice seed for her crop.

loans.name: Alma Emperatriz

texts.es:
Alma de 39 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta 6 grado de educación básica, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, pero solo 2 viven con ella, uno trabaja en una tienda local y el otro estudia bachillerato, los otros dos hijos tiene hogar propio. De ella solo depende el hijo que estudia.

Alma desde muy joven trabajaba la tierra con sus padres es por eso que cultiva granos básicos y hortalizas, trabajando 6 horas diarias desde las 6:00 am. También es comerciante, 3 veces por semana recorre la comunidad vendiendo pan dulce y pan francés.	

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción para reparar su casa, tales como teja, cemento, madera y demás, también para pagar la mano de obra que se requiera.

Alma espera que con su trabaja logre dar el estudio completo a su hijo, pues es una oportunidad que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Alma is 39 years old. She was only able to go to school up to 6th grade. She is a single mother and has 4 children, but only 2 live with her. One works in a local store, and the other is in high school; the other two have their own homes. Only the one son who is in school depends on her financially.

From a young age, Alma worked the earth with her parents, so she now farms basic grains and vegetables. She works 6 hours a day starting at 6am. She is also a saleswoman; 3 times a week she goes through the community selling sweet baked goods and french bread.

This loan will be used to purchase construction materials to repair her house; for example, tile, cement, wood, and other items. It will also pay for the labor to make the repairs.

Alma hopes that through her work, she will succeed in helping her son complete his education, which is an opportunity that she herself did not have.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies and pay for labor

loans.name: 04 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Châm has a service business making mosquito nets (to protect people from the mosquitoes). She is requesting a loan to purchase cloth to make the mosquito nets to sell.

Châm is 43 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 04 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of six members. 
Châm lives with 1 dependent. in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Châm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Châm has been involved in this business for 5 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. With her business profit, Châm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sew mosquito nets to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Thôn Thắng Cụm 03 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khuyên has a retail business selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Khuyên is 31 years old and married with two children.. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 Thôn Thắng Cụm 03 solidarity group, which consists of four members. Khuyên lives with two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Khuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Khuyên has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khuyên has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Khuyên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Khuyên hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair the roof and cement the floor of her home.

loans.name: Yndira

texts.es:
La socia Yndira se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboración de tejidos, la socia vende  chalinas, chompas, entre otros, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de chompas y chalinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lana de colores y palitos de tejer.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The group member Yndira is still working in textiles.  She sells scarves and sweaters among other things.  She sells different types of cloth, starting work at 8:00 am and finishing at 7:00 pm.  She has been in this business for eight years and she has been successful.  

She dreams of expanding her sales of scarves and sweaters. She is asking for a loan to buy wool of different colours and knitting needles.

He is happy with the loan system and is committed to meeting the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy wool and knitting needles.

loans.name: Nhóm 31 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh has a retail business selling mushrooms, salt, spices, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food (mushrooms, salt, spices, etc.) to resell.

Thanh is 41 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 31 Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2014, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thanh has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food like mushrooms, salt and spices to resell

loans.name: Tusaidiane Group

texts.fr: Basekawike est commerçante et présidente de la banque communautaire Tusaidiane, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 42 ans, mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu  de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des huiles de palmes et végétales depuis 20 ans. Elle va acheter des jutes d’huiles et 20 litres végétales. Son conjoint est un enseignant. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Basekawike is a commercial trader and the president of the Tusaidiane loan group, which works with the field partner,  Hekima.  She is 42 years old, married and mother to six children who all attend school.  She sells palm oil and vegetable oils, and began her business twenty years ago with money provided by her husband.

Basekawike plans to use her loan to buy oil sacks and twenty litres of vegetable oil.  In the future, she would like to continue working with Hekima and their loan system.  In this way, Basekawike will be able to increase her working capital, educate and feed her children.

She would like to thank Hekima for the support which they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy oil sacks and 20 litres of vegetable oil for resale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su padre Eva trabaja como cajera pero desea incursionar en el comercio de cosmeticos y otros productos de belleza en su tiempo libre  para hacer ventas a credito Eva recibe ayuda de sus padres en cuanto a comida y casa pero para su emprendimiento ella esta sola por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Eva is single and doesn't have any children.  She lives in a brick house in La Paz which belongs to her father.  

She works as a checkout assistant but she would like to set herself up in the cosmetics trade by selling beauty products in her free time.  She would sell on credit to her customers.  

Although her parents provide her with meals and a roof over her head, they cannot help her with her business venture, so she is asking for help.

loans.use: to enter the cosmetics market selling beauty products.

loans.name: Nohemi Rosalia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de materiales de construccion, la socia vende cemento, arena y clavos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, clavos y arena.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is still selling building materials.  She sells cement, sand and nails.  She works from 8:00 am until 8:00 pm.  She has been in this business for several years and she is very successful.  She dreams of expanding her business so she is asking for a loan to buy cement, nails and sand.

She is happy with the loan system and is committed to meeting the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy cement, nails and sand.

loans.name: Irma Argelia

texts.es: Irma de 47 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijas de 11 y 16 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 2 hijas, apoyándose en su negocio de venta de calzado y sandalias, la cual realiza desde hace 31 años por lo que ya es muy reconocida por su amabilidad con los clientes y la buena calidad de sus productos. Irma desea levantar su vivienda ya que se encontraba deteriorada por lo que se cayó, al no contar con los fondos económicos necesarios está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillos, hierro y laminas para reconstruir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Irma, 47, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her two children aged 11 and 16.   Thanks to her hard-work and determination she has managed to raise her two children.  

She has supported them through her shoe-selling business.  She has been doing this for 31 years so she is well-known for her friendly service and high quality footwear. 

She would like to build her house again, as it has fallen down through deterioration.  As she doesn't have the money herself, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron and corrugated sheets to rebuild her home.

loans.use: to buy building materials to rebuild her house.

loans.name: 21 Bắc Thọ Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh has a retail business selling food such as mushrooms, salt and spices. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food to sell.

Minh is 35 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 21 Bắc Thọ Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

This is Minh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Minh has been involved in this business for 6 years.
The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

In the future, Minh hopes to build a new house, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food such as mushrooms, salt and spices to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 04.tân Hà.nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hạnh works in agriculture, growing vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetable seeds to grow and sell in the future.

Hạnh is 54 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Hạnh is the group leader of the Nhóm 04.Tân Hà.Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members.

In 2013, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Maisha Group

texts.fr: Jeacquiline est commerçante depuis 5 ans, âgée de 40 ans, mariée à un assistant médical et mère de 4 enfants, qui tous étudient. Elle est membre d’un groupe d’Affaires  «Maisha » et vendeuse des produits pharmaceutiques. Elle installe sa marchandise  dans une pharmacie du quartier animé de la ville. Elle va acheter des boites de médicaments modernes (Antibiotiques, anti-inflammatoires etc.). Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle compte renforcer son capital, scolariser ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de microcrédit sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
Jeacquiline has been a commercial trader for five years.  She is 40 years old, married to a medical assistant and mother to four children who all attend school.  She is a member of the Maisha business group and sells pharmaceutical products.  She works in a pharmacy in a busy district of the town.

Jeacquiline plans to use her loan to buy boxes of modern medicines (antibiotics, anti-inflammatories, etc.).  She began her business with money provided by her husband. 

In the future, Jeacquiline intends to strengthen her working capital and educate her children.  She would like to thank the field partner, Hekima, for the support they give to non-bankable, women entrepreneurs, with their offer of unsecured loans.

loans.use: to buy boxes of modern medicines (antibiotics, anti-inflammatories etc.) for resale.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 - Quảng Xá 3 - Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng has a retail business selling dry food and soft drinks. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food and soft drinks to resell.

Hằng is 34 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 - Quảng Xá 3 - Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of four members.  Hằng lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Hằng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: 58 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phú works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

Phú is 62 years old and married with five children. She is the group leader of the 58 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
Phú lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phú has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phú has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Phú faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phú hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: 01 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

Hạnh is 62 years old and married with one child. She is the group leader of the 01 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
Hạnh lives  in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hạnh has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her child to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Sheria Group

texts.fr: Nabarungu est commerçante et membre de la banque communautaire Sheria, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un agent de l’Etat, âgée de 33 ans, mère de 6 enfants, 4 scolarisés et 2 sont gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique, chez elle, à domicile de divers articles manufacturés depuis 8 ans. Elle va acheter du sucre, bougies, sardines, biscuits etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son activité et acheter une parcelle. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Nabarungu is a retailer and member of the Sheria business group, who work with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 33 years old, married to a state official and mother to six children.  Four of her children attend school and two are still too young for school.

Nabarungu owns and runs a shop at her home.  She sells various manufactured goods.  Her business was started eight years ago, with funds provided by her husband.  She plans to use her loan to buy sugar, candles, sardines, biscuits, etc.  In the future, she would like to continue using the loan system to improve her business and buy a plot of land.

Nabarungu would like to thank Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, candles, sardines, biscuits etc. for resale.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Yên Hòa Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sánh works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Sánh is 45 years old and married with three children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the Nhóm 05 Yên Hòa Hưng Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2012, Sánh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Sánh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Sánh hopes to buy a bicycle, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: 73 -Phố 4 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a retail business selling coal. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal to resell.

Hương is 39 years old and she is married with three children.
Hương is the group leader of the 73 -Phố 4 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives with 3 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more coal to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 04 Thôn 10 Quảng Thái Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sang operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Sang is 52 years old and she is married with two children. Sang is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 Thôn 10 Quảng Thái solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is Sang's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Sang faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Sang hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: 09 Minh Thanh Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Doanh works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Doanh is 30 years old and married with three children. She is the group leader of the 09 Minh Thanh Minh Lộc solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2011, Doanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Doanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Doanh hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: 08 Bắc Thọ Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

Hạnh is 31 years old and she is married with three children. She is the group leader of the 08 Bắc Thọ Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2013, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hạnh has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hạnh has been involved in this business for 4 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

In the future, Hạnh hopes to build a new house, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 07 Thôn 03 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Dạy is 56 years old and is married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 07 Thôn 03 Quảng Lưu Group, which consists of three members. Dạy works in agriculture raising pigs. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. This is Dạy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Dạy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nyota Group

texts.fr: Zelpha est commerçante et membre de la banque villageoise Nyota, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, divorcée, âgée de 42 ans, mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu d’un crédit d’un ami. Elle est sociétaire d’un restaurant depuis 9 ans. Elle va acheter des pommes de terre, des plantains, des épices etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Zelpha is a retailer and member of the Nyota 'Banc Villageois', which works with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 42 years old, divorced and mother to two children who both attend school.  She has been running a restaurant business for nine years, and started this business with funds loaned to her by a friend.

Zelpha plans to use her loan to buy potatoes, plantains, spices, etc.  In the future, she would like to continue working with the loan system to increase her business figures, educate and feed her children.

Zelpha would like to thank Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, plantains, spices, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Tuungane A Group

texts.fr: Pascaline est commerçante depuis 2 ans, âgée de31 ans, mariée à un commerçant et mère de 4 enfants, 2 étudient et 2 sont petits. Elle est membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Tuungane A » et vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe sa marchandise à domicile dans un depot. Elle va acheter le riz, sucre, haricots, les huiles, tomates etc. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle compte renforcer son capital, acheter une parcelle, construire et scolariser ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs  non bancables en leur accordant de microcrédits sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
Pascaline has been a retailer for two years.  She is 31 years old, married to another retailer, and mother to four children.  Two of her children attend school and two are too young for school.

Pascaline is a member of the business group 'Tuungane A', and sells food products from a stall at her home.  Her business was started using money provided by her husband.  She plans to use her loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, tomatoes, etc. 

In the future, Pascaline wants to increase her working capital, buy a plot of land, build a house and educate her children.  She thanks the field partner, Hekima, for the support they offer to non-bankable, women entrepreneurs by giving them unsecured loans.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, tomatoes, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 02 Quảng Thái Group

texts.en:
Lĩnh is 31 years old and is married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thôn 02 Quảng Thái Group, which consists of eight members. Lĩnh works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Lĩnh is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit,  Lĩnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Julio Eduardo

texts.es: Julio de 39 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus hijos quienes le ayudan en la actividad agrícola, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, comercializa sus cultivos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que gana de sus ventas ayuda a mejorar la economía de su familia, Julio solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde cultiva que es el que muestra la fotografía, y así continuar con sus cultivos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Julio, 39, lives with his wife and children who help in his agriculture activity.  He grows corn and beans and has been in the business for several years.  He sells his crops at different markets near his home and uses the income from sales to help with the family economy.  Julio is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, manures, seeds, etc. and improve his cropland which is shown in the photograph.  This is so he can continue with his crop activity and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, herbicides, manures, seeds, etc. and improve his land.

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.fr: Kamwagha est une femme d’affaires et secrétaire de la banque communautaire Safina, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un commerçant, âgée de 34 ans, mère de 3 enfants, 2 scolarisés et 1 encore gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est sociétaire d’un magasin de divers articles manufacturés depuis 6 ans. Elle va acheter les savons de toilette et en poudre, sardine, riz, sucre etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kamwagha is a business woman and secretary of the Safina business group who work with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 34 years old, married to a retailer and mother to three children.  Two of her children attend school and one is too young for school.

Kamwagha runs a shop which sells various manufactured products, and began this business six years ago, with money provided by her husband.  She plans to use her loan to buy soap bars and powder soaps, sardines, rice, sugar, etc.

In the future, she would like to have further loans to increase her working capital, educate and feed her children.  Kamwagha thanks Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy soap bars and powder soaps, sardines, rice, sugar, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Maman Lève Toi Group

texts.fr:
Marg est une femme ambitieuse, secrétaire du collectif de crédits Maman Lève toi, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un agent de l’Etat, âgée de 49 ans, mère de 7 enfants, tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de sa famille. Elle est vendeuse des boissons dans une avenue animée de la ville. Elle va s’approvisionner en bières Primus, Skol, Simba, Dopell etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
.
texts.en:
Marg is an ambitious woman and secretary of the loan group 'Maman Lève toi', which works with the field partner, Hekima.
