She is 49 years old, married to a state official and mother to seven children who all attend school.  She sells drinks on a busy avenue in the town.  Her business was started with money provided by her family.

Marg intends to use her loan to buy stocks of Primus, Skol, Simba and Dopell beers.

In the future, Marg  hopes to take further loans, educate and feed her children.  She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy stocks of Primus, Skol, Simba and Dopell beers.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Los estudios son la base del éxito, razón principal por la que don Miguel Ángel a sus 53 años desea culminar su último año de la carrera de Derecho y así poder obtener su título profesional, que no pudo obtener cuando era joven por falta de recursos económicos. Estudió Derecho con el objetivo de cumplir con la justicia y marcar un cambio social. Su compañera de vida y sus cinco hijos son quienes lo motivan a cumplir sus metas. 
Miguel ha trabajado como litigante por tres años, quiere culminar su carrera para tener oportunidad a un puesto de trabajo acorde a su profesión, como lo es la abogacía. Solicita el crédito para pagar el diplomado de titulación de la carrera de Derecho, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que anhela adquirir su titulo sin retraso alguno. Es un hombre humilde, trabajador e inteligente, que planea aprovechar cada día para adquirir nuevos conocimientos teóricos y científicos, con la finalidad de ser un excelente profesional.
texts.en:
Education is the basis for success which is the main reason Miguel Ángel, 53, wants to finish his last year of Law studies and get his professional diploma.  He was unable to get it when he was young due to a lack of economic resources.  He studied Law in order to carry out justice and make a social change.  His common-law wife and five children are his motivation for meeting his goals.

Miguel has worked as a litigant for three years and wants to finish his education so he can have the opportunity to get a job in his line of work, which is law practice.  He is requesting a loan to pay for his law degree diploma.  He trusts he will obtain the loan because he wants to get his diploma without delay.  He is a humble, hard-working, intelligent man who takes advantage of every day to acquire new technical and scientific knowledge in an effort to be an excellent professional.

loans.use: To pay for his law degree diploma.

loans.name: Elonga A Group

texts.fr: Akisanti est commerçante et membre de la banque communautaire Elonga A, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 37 ans, divorcée et mère de 5 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de sa famille. Elle est vendeuse de friperie (habits pour enfants)au marché central depuis 5 ans. Elle va acheter  des culottes, chemises, chemisettes,jupes, pantalons etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son  activité, acheter une parcelle et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Akisanti is a retailer and member of the 'Elonga A' Group, which works with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 37 years old, divorced and mother to five children who all attend school.  Akisanti has been selling second-hand clothing for children at the central market for five years.  She started this business with money provided by her family.

Akisanti plans to use her loan to buy underwear, shirts, skirts, trousers, etc.  for resale.

In the future, she would like to have further loans to increase her business, buy a plot of land and educate her children.  Akisanti is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy underwear, shirts, skirts, trousers, etc. for resale.

loans.name: 02 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Hiền is 33 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Hiền is the group leader of the 02 Đông Sơn Group, which consists of five members. She has a retail business selling medication, and has been involved in this business for three years.

Hiền is requesting a loan to purchase more medication to resell. In 2012, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more medication for resale

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una joven madre de familia de 21 años, con un maravilloso hijo quien es su motor en la vida para salir adelante, vive en Chincha junto a su familia. Con mucho esfuerzo y apoyo de sus padres estudió la carrera de Computación e Informática y actualmente trabaja como secretaria en una gran empresa, ella cree que le va bien por todo el esfuerzo que siempre le pone al trabajo, la dedicación y responsabilidad con las que asume sus tareas.
Mercedes está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una impresora para que cuando tenga algún pendiente de la oficina pueda imprimir sus documentos, así también esto ayudará con las tareas de su hijo. Con esto estarán mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 21, is a young mother with a wonderful son, who is the motivation in her life to get ahead.  She lives in Chincha with her family.  With much effort and support from her parents she studied computer sciences and is currently working as a secretary for a great company.  She believes things are going well for her because of all the effort, dedication and responsibility she puts into her work.

Mercedes is grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support she can buy a printer so she can print documents she needs for the office.  It will also help with her son's homework.  This will improve her quality of life so she can continue striving for her family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy a printer for her work.

loans.name: Siege De La Sagesse A Group

texts.fr: Magambo est commerçante et membre de la banque communautaire Siege de la Sagesse A, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un volcanologue, âgée de 41 ans et mère de 7 enfants, dont 5 scolarisés et 2 sont bébés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de ses familiers. Elle est vendeuse de friperie au marché de la ville depuis 12 ans. Elle va acheter 6 ballons de friperies. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son activité, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Magambo is a retailer and member of the 'Siege de la Sagesse' business group, which works with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 41 years old, married to a vulcanologist and mother to seven children.  Five of her children attend school and two are still babies.  She has been selling second-hand clothing at the town market for twelve years, and started this business with funds loaned to her by her friends.

Magambo plans to use her loan to buy six bales of second-hand clothing.  In the future, she would like to continue working with the loan system to increase her business figures, buy a plot of land, educate and feed her children.

Magambo is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 6 bales of second-hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Amour A Group

texts.fr: Bimuloko est commerçante et  membre de la banque villageoise Amour A, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un commerçant, âgée de 34 ans, mère de 5 enfants, tous  scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu  de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des matelas dans un magasin sur la route principale de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va acheter 30 pièces des matelas. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son  activité, acheter une parcelle, construire et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Bimuloko is a retailer and member of the Amour A 'Banc Villageois', which works with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 34 years old, married to another retailer, and mother to five children who all attend school.  She has been selling mattresses from a shop on the main road in the town, for five years.  Bimuloko started her business with money provided by her husband.

Bimuloko intends to use her loan to buy 30 mattresses for sale.

In the future, Bimuloko would like to take more loans to improve her business, buy a plot of land, build a house and educate her children.  She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 30 mattresses for resale.

loans.name: Vilma Marisol

texts.es: Vilma de 31 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida gracias a su pequeño negocio de una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su vivienda, y es gracias a este negocio que ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo. La vivienda de Vilma es muy humilde, y tiene una pared de plástico como se puede observar en la fotografía, por lo que ella siente un poco de inseguridad. Pensando en cambiar esa pared de plástico por una de ladrillo y cemento, Vilma solicita  a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pared en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Vilma is 31 years old, a single mother and living in her own home with her young son of 5 years old. She is an enterprising woman who makes a living thanks to her small business, a shop for essential goods in her home, and it is thanks to this business that she has been able to provide for her son.

Vilma's dwelling is very humble, and has a plastic wall as can be seen in the photograph, so she feels a bit of insecurity. Thinking of changing the plastic wall for one of bricks and cement, Vilma is requesting a loan to purchase: cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a wall in her home.

loans.use: to purchase: cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a wall in her home.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en: Phalla, a local farmer from Banteay Meanchey province, is 52 years old and married. She is a mother of eight children, one of whom is in school. She deals with the daily cost of living via her pig-raising business and her paid working job. This businesses have generated her about 39,000 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Phalla with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely. Now, in a group of four, she is the leader. For Phalla, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a bicycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle for commuting

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Thôn 4 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Định works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Định is 30 years old and married with one child. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 Thôn 4 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. Định lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Định's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Định faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Định hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 12 Thôn 2 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thâng works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thâng is 55 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 12 Thôn 2 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. Thâng lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thâng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thâng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thâng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 03 Quảng Bình Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan works in agriculture raising poultry . She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Lan is 54 years old and married with two children. Lan is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn 03 Quảng Bình solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 02 Quảng Bình Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hà is 48 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn 02 Quảng Bình solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
La agricultura es una actividad solamente apta para toda aquella persona que ama la tierra como a una madre, como una engendradora de futuros para la vida.  Buenos futuros de esperanzas para generaciones siguientes. Es el trabajo de Valerio de 50 años de edad  casado y cuenta con ocho hijos de los cuales tres ya tienen familias separadas y los cinco últimos son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.
	
La actividad que Valerio realiza es la siembra de: papas, zanahorias, frijol y maíz. Dicha actividad lo realiza en su comunidad donde el vive, sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado local de Sololá el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con conocimiento de manejo en las hortalizas que lo heredo de su padre. La segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad.

El uso que don Valerio le dará al crédito es para la compra de semillas de papa y abonos químicos e orgánicos para que su producción se de papas se buena este año.  Uno de los grandes sueños de el es la construcción de unos cuartos para sus hijos y para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vidas adecuadas y ver que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Farming is a job only apt for the kind of person who loves the earth as if it were a mother, like a begetter of futures for life. Good futures of hopes for coming generations. This is the work of Valerio of 50 years of age, married with eight children of which three already have their own separate families and the last five go to the community school.

Valerio's work is growing: potatoes, carrots, beans and corn. He does this work in the community where he lives, his products are sold in the local market of Solola and chose this line of work because he has a knowledge of vegetables that he inherited from his father. The second job he does is a day laborer in his community.

Don Valerio will use the loan to buy potato seeds and chemical and organic fertilizer so that he will have a good potato harvest this year. One of his great dreams is the construction of some rooms for his children so that they have adequate living conditions and to see his children become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Thôn 3 Hoa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngân works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Ngân is 40 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 Thôn 3 Hoa Lộc solidarity group, which consists of four members.

This is Ngân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for three years  One of the most critical business difficulties is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes to buy a motorbike, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: María tiene 62 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hermana y un cuñado. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de verduras de forma ambulante. Dicho negocio es lo que le permite llevar el sustento a sus hogar y colaborar en la economía del hogar. María ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y paga mano de obra para construcción del cuarto.
texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old, lives in her own home with her sister and a brother-in-law. She is an enterprising woman who works selling vegetables on foot. This business is what enables her to feed her family and contribute to the family finances.

Maria has taken the decision to request this loan from FUSAI given that she wants to invest in the construction of a fourth bedroom for which she needs materials such as: bricks, cement, sand, gravel and payment for manual labor to build the room.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and pay for manual labor to build a room.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. José se gana la vida trabajando como jornalero desde hace mucho tiempo. Él es muy dedicado a su familia y se esfuerza mucho por apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto para la cocina y poder así proteger sus pocas pertenencias. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava, hierro y pagará mano de obra par ala construcción de la cocina.
texts.en:
Jose is 39 years old and lives in his own home in his family unit. Jose has made a living working as a day laborer for a long time. He is very dedicated to his family and really makes an effort to provide for the costs of the home.

With the desire to improve his living conditions, he has taken the decision to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in building a room for the kitchen and thus protect his few belongings. With the amount requested he will buy cement, sand bricks, gravel, iron and pay for manual labor for the construction of a kitchen.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand bricks, gravel, iron and pay for manual labor to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Mariana Alejandra

texts.es: Mariana de 19 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como empleada de atención al cliente en una librería familiar, además ella buscan la manera de superarse se encuentra estudiando. Mariana desea reparar el servicio sanitario y el baño de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, taza lavable, lavamanos y pagará mano de obra para reparar el servicio sanitario y el baño de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mariana of 19 years old lives in her own home with her family. She is an enterprising woman who works as a customer service employee in a family library, also she is looking for a way to excel so she is studying.

Mariana wants to repair the toilet and bathroom of her house so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, a basin, a sink and pay for manual labor costs to repair the toilet and bathroom of her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, a basin, a sink and pay for manual labor costs to repair the toilet and bathroom of her house.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 15 años, 4 años y 2 meses de edad. Morena se gana la vida por medio de la venta de antojitos típicos tales como: yuca frita, tamales, etc. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 10 años lo cual le permite aporta en la economía del hogar. Morena desea construir un cuarto por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra para pagar la construcción.
texts.en:
Morena is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children of 15 years, 4 years and 2 months old. Morena makes a living by selling local food such as fried yucca, tamales, etc. The sales have been done on foot for 10 years which allows her to support the family finances.

Morena wants to build a room so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized steel, cement, sand iron and pay for manual labor costs for the construction.

loans.use: to buy: galvanized steel, cement, sand iron and pay for manual labor costs to build a room.

loans.name: Maria Lissette

texts.es: María de 19 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una joven emprendedora que se gana la vida elaborando pan francés y pan dulce para una panadería familiar, además buscando superarse más se encuentra estudiando para poder tener algún día mejores condiciones de vida. María desea construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 19 years old and lives in her own home in her family unit. She is a young entrepreneur who makes a living making French bread and sweet bread for a family bakery, also she is looking to excel even more so she is studying to one day be able to have better living conditions.

Maria wants to build a room in her home so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a bedroom in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a bedroom in her home.

loans.name: Cruz  De Los Angeles

texts.es: Cruz tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos: uno mayor de edad y uno de 4 años de edad. Cruz se gana la vida por medio de su negocio de venta de plátanos y mariscos desde hace mucho tiempo. Cruz desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: hierro, cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava y lámina galvanizada.
texts.en:
Cruz is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and her two children: an older child and one of 4 years old. Cruz has made a living selling bananas and seafood for quite some time.

Cruz wishes to build a room in her house so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of necessary materials such as: iron, cement, sand, bricks, gravel and galvanized steel.

loans.use: to buy: iron, cement, sand, bricks, gravel and galvanized steel to build a room.

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
Ana de 64 años de edad, es viuda desde hace 13 años, tiene 3 hijos de 32 años de edad, 36 años de edad y 39 años de edad, solo uno de ellos vive con ella aunque tiene su propia familia.

Ana se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 40 años, aprendió con su padre que era agricultor y ella lo ayudaba en dicha labor. Trabaja 5 horas al día desde las 6 de la mañana. En las actividades agrícolas también se involucra su hijo.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes, semilla, plaguicidas y herbicidas, además por su avanzada edad necesita contratar mano de obra para sembrar maíz y frijol, esperando tener buenos resultados espera asegurar el alimento de su familia.

Ana quiere establecer un puesto de venta de granos básicos en la comunidad donde vive, pues se le dificulta mucho vender su producción ya que debe viajar cerca de 45 kilómetros para llegar al lugar de venta más cercano. También espera que su nieta tenga la oportunidad de estudio que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Ana is 64 years old, she is a widow of 13 years, has 3 children of 32, 36 and 39 years old, only one of them lives with her although she has her own family.

Ana has worked in farming for 40 years, she learnt it from her father who was a farmer and she helped him with his work. She works 5 hours a day from 6 in the morning. In the farming work her son also helps.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticide, herbicide, also due to her advanced age needs to contract manual labor to sow corn and beans, she is hoping to have good results and hopes to thus ensure food for her family.

Ana wants to set up a stall selling staple grains in the community where she lives, because it is very difficult to sell their yield because she must travel about 45 miles to the nearest place of sale. She also hopes her granddaughter will have the opportunity to study that she did not have.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticide, herbicide and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Elonga B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bianjira est une brave commerçante et membre de la banque villageoise «Elonga B», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 40ans, mariée a un enseignant et mère de 7 enfants, dont 5 étudient et 2 sont gosses. La cliente est vendeuse des boissons depuis 6 ans. Elle installe sa marchandise dans un dépôt de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima.  Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 50 caisses de sucré et 300 cartons de jus. Ainsi, il souhaite construire une belle maison et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits  entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: The customer, Bianjira is a good honest businesswoman who is member of the "Elonga B" Banc Villageois. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, who is 45 years old and married to a teacher; she has seven children, five of whom are studying while the other two are still young children. The customer has been selling drinks for the past six years and displays her goods in a kiosk in the town. She began her business with capital given to her by her husband. Later on, she got a loan from IMF Hekima. This new loan will be used to buy 50 crates of sugar and 300 cartons of juice. She would like to be able to build a nice house and provide for her children's education. Finally she is extremely grateful to Hekima for giving autonomy to small entrepreneurs who do not have access to classic banks.

loans.use: to buy fifty crates of sugar and 300 cartons of juice.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 74 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus hijas y nietas. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida elaborando diferentes tipos de pan dulce y francés, además sus hijas aportan a la economía del hogar. Dora desea reparar el servicio sanitario de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra dañado, además desea reparar la pila por que tiene filtraciones de agua, pero al no contar con el dinero necesario Dora solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para reparar el servicio sanitario y la pila de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dora of 74 years old age lives in her own home with her daughters and grandchildren. She is an enterprising woman who makes a living making different types of breads, sweet and French, also her daughters contribute to the finances of the home.

Dora wants to repair the bathroom in her house as it is in a damaged state, also she wants to repair the water basin because there are water leaks, but she does not have the money necessary. Dora wants a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand and gravel to repair the bathroom and the water basin of her house.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand and gravel to repair the bathroom and the water basin of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for her family for the winter period.

loans.name: Nhóm 04 Thôn 06 Quảng Thái Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 29 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 Thôn 06 Quảng Thái solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.
 
Hoa operates a food stall selling fish, and has been involved in this business for 8 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is her lack of capital. 

Hoa is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, she hopes to help her family to be healthy and happy, to do well in her business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Amour M Group

texts.fr: La cliente Igwabi est commerçante et membre de la banque villageoise Amour M, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un technicien, âgée de 38 ans, mère de 6 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de divers produits manufacturés dans un magasin du centre ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va acheter des sardines, bijoux, jus, produits cosmétiques, riz, sucre, biscuits etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: The customer, Igwabi, is a businesswoman and member of the "Amour M" Banc Villageois. She is a customer of IMF Hekima and married to a technician; she is 38 years old and mother to six children, all of whom are at school. She began her business with funds given to her by her husband, and she has been selling a variety of manufactured products in a shop in the centre of town for the past five years. She is going to buy sardines, jewelry, juice, cosmetics, rice, sugar, biscuits, etc. She would like to increase her borrowing, and be able to educate and feed her children. Finally she is grateful to Hekima for the support it gives to entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks.

loans.use: to buy sardines, jewelry, juice, cosmetics, rice, sugar, biscuits.

loans.name: Siege De La Sagesse B Group

texts.fr: Kasemengo est commerçante et membre du groupe de crédits Siege de la Sagesse B, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un Ingénieur, âgée de 36 ans et mère de 6 enfants, dont 5 scolarisés et 1 gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse d’habillements dans un magasin sur la route secondaire depuis 5ans. Elle va acheter  des culottes, chemises, jupes, pantalons etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son activité et acheter une parcelle. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kasemengo is a businesswoman and member of the "Siège de la Sagesse B" loan group. She is a customer of IMF Hekima and married to an engineer; she is 36 years old and mother to six children, five of whom are at school and one still a young child. She began her business with funds given to her by her husband, and she has been selling clothes in a shop on a side road for the past five years. She is going to buy underpants, shirts, skirts, trousers, etc. She would like to get more loans so she can expand her business and buy a plot of land. Finally she is grateful to Hekima for the support it gives to entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks.

loans.use: to buy underpants, shirts, skirts, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Nhóm 04 Thôn 01 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Hiện is 52 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 Thôn 01 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

Hiện works in agriculture raising pigs, and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is her lack of capital. In 2013 Hiện joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid 2 loans from them already.

She is applying for a loan now to purchase more baby pigs to raise and then sell in the future.

In the future, Hiện hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to able to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and then sell in the future

loans.name: Mayra Anabel

texts.es: Mayra tiene 34 años de edad habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Mayra se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora dado que hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar su familia lo necesario. Mayra vende tiene negocio de venta pupusas, pasteles, plátanos y bebidas. Ella desea construir una pila con baño pero no cuenta con el efectivo para poder proceder. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, grava, madera, lámina  y pagar la mano de obra para la construcción de la pila con baño.
texts.en:
Mayra is 34 years old, she lives with her common-law husband and her three children who are of a young age. Mayra is known for being an enterprising woman as she does all that is in her power to give her family what is necessary. Mayra has a business selling pupusas, cakes, bananas and drinks.

She wants to build a water tank with a bathroom but doesn't have the funds to be able to proceed. For the aforementioned, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to purchase the necessary materials such as: bricks, cement, sand, iron, gravel, wood, steel and pay for the manual labor to pay for the construction of a water tank with a bathroom.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, gravel, wood, steel and pay for the manual labor to pay for the construction of a water tank with a bathroom.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Thôn 01 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Thúy is 39 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 Thôn 01 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

Thúy works in agriculture raising poultry, and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is her lack of capital. In 2013, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and she has already successfully repaid 2 loans from them.

Now she is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to have enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 01 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Châu is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn 01 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. 

Châu works in agriculture raising poultry, and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is her lack of capital. In 2013 she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid 2 loans already from them.

Now she is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

In the future, Châu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 01 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Sót is 39 years old and married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thôn 01 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. 

Sót works in agriculture raising cows, and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is her lack of capital. In 2013 she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and she has already successfully repaid 2 loans from them.

Now she is applying for a loan to purchase a cow to raise in order to sell the calves in the future.

With her business profit, Sót hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise and then sell the calves in the future

loans.name: Nelson Marsilio

texts.es: Nelson de 28 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él es un joven emprendedor que se gana la vida como instructor gastronómico enseñando sus conocimientos a jóvenes con aspiraciones profesionales y con ánimos de superarse. Nelson desea afinar las paredes de su vivienda y posteriormente pintarla por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, y pintura para afinar y pintar las `paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nelson is 28 years old and lives in his own home together with his family. He is an enterprising young man and earns a living as a culinary instructor. He teaches his knowledge to young people with career aspirations and with the will to excel. 

Nelson wants to repair the walls in his home, and afterwards paint them. For this, he is asking for a loan with FUSAI in order to purchase cement and paint in order to repair and paint the walls in his home.

loans.use: to purchase: cement and paint in order to repair and paint the walls of his home.

loans.name: Mario Adonay

texts.es: Mario de 37 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijas de 13 y 14 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia apoyándose en su trabajo, en el cual presta sus servicios de seguridad, y su compañera de vida aporta a la economía familiar con sus pequeñas ventas de antojitos típicos. Mario desea reubicar una puerta de su vivienda, por lo que deberá construir una pared que tape la actual y construirla en otra zona de la casa, ya que a futuro piensa ampliar ese espacio para ser habitado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para reubicar una puerta de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mario is 37 years old and lives in his own home with his partner and their two children, who are 13 and 14 years old. He is a hard-working man and puts a lot of effort into getting his family ahead through his work. He works providing security services. His partner also contributes a bit to the household income by selling typical snacks.

Mario wants to move a door in his home. For this, he needs to build a wall which covers the current place of the door, and to build a door in another place of the house. He wants to do this because his plan is to enlarge his house in the future. Therefore, he is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and metal in order to move a door in his home.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and metal, in order to move a door in his home.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos de 24, 19 y 17 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien todos los días sale a ganarse la vida, prestando sus servicios domésticos con la firme convicción de darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, sosteniendo ella sola la economía familiar. La vivienda de Rosa está hecha de bajareque, pero ella desea construirla de bloques de cemento, sabiendo que la inversión para construirla es bastante grande a decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para iniciar construyendo las bases. Para lo que deberá comprar: cemento, arena, grava, bloques de cemento y pagar mano de obra para comenzar a construir las bases de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her three children, who are 24, 19, and 17 years old. She is an enterprising woman who goes out to offer domestic services in order to earn a living every day. She earns the household income herself and is determined to offer a better quality of life to her children.

Rosa's house is made of woven reeds and mud, but she wants to rebuild it with cement blocks. As she has to invest a lot of money into the construction, she has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI in order to start building the foundations. For this, she will have to buy: cement, sand, gravel, and cement blocks, and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, gravel, and cement blocks, and to pay for labor in order to start building the foundation of her home.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia. Él es un hombre trabajador que a pesar de haber sufrido un accidente en su trabajo anterior que le dejo un daño en su pierna, pero no se ha dejado vencer y sigue luchando por salir adelante, él recibe una pensión por ese percance, pero además demostrando sus ganas de vivir se gana la vida como mecánico de refrigeradoras y cuartos fríos. Luis desea construir un techo en el corredor de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía no cuenta con uno por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: polines, tubos de hierro, lámina y pines para construir un techo al corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis is 50 years old and lives in his own home. He is a hardworking man who, despite having suffered an accident at his previous job that left his leg damaged, has not given up and is still striving to get ahead. He receives a pension because of this mishap, but in addition he demonstrates his will to live and makes a living as a mechanic for refrigerators and cold rooms.

Luis wants to build a roof for the corridor of his house, because, as can be seen in the picture, it does not have one. For this, he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: beams, metal pipes, galvanized metal sheets, and fasteners, to build a roof to the corridor of his house.

loans.use: to buy: beams, metal pipes, galvanized metal sheets, and fasteners, in order to build a roof for the corridor of his home.

loans.name: Shahana

texts.en:
Shahana is a 22-year-old refugee. She is married and has a beautiful little daughter. Her husband is a laborer and earns money, but the main income comes from poultry. The monthly income from this is 210AZN.

Shahana has a small goose coop in the backyard and raises geese there. Then she sells them at a local bazaar with the help of her husband. The young family tries to earn as much as they can because they want to provide their daughter with a bright childhood and a good education in the future.

Shahana applied for a 1500AZN loan in order to buy hens, because hen meat and eggs are in high demand. This will increase the income of the family and cover all needs.

loans.use: to buy hens

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.es:
Sulaiman is a 60 year old married man with 23 children. His large family drove him into farming since he had to feed them and take care of their other needs. He is into growing of crops like coffee, beans and bananas and he works for 7 days a week and 12 hours a day.
He also deals in textile and timber business from where he gets an additional income to support his family.He was motivated by the profitability of the business and the fact that it was a family business.
He hopes to use the loan to buy coffee and beans for sell such that he can increase his profits. He sells products to local residents and fellow traders. He is described as honest and hard working man in business and appreciates lenders for the services offered, because he never would have grown the business hadnt it been for the financial boost.
texts.en:
Sulaiman is a 60-year-old married man with 23 children. His large family drove him into farming since he had to feed them and take care of their other needs. He is into the growing of crops like coffee, beans, and bananas; he works 7 days a week and 12 hours a day.

He also deals in the textile and timber business, where he gets an additional income to support his family. He was motivated by the profitability of the business, and the fact that it was a family business.

He hopes to use the loan to buy coffee and beans to sell so he can increase his profits. He sells products to local residents and fellow traders. He is described as an honest and hardworking man in business, and appreciates lenders for the services offered because he never would have grown the business if it hadn't been for the financial boost.

loans.use: To buy coffee and dry beans

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Age 53 years, Ly is widowed and lives with her children in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She earns a living through raising chicken and working for others for fees. She can earn about KHR20,000 per day from the current business, and is able to save about KHR10,000 each day for the future. 

This is the first loan for Ly with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy chicken feed and more chickens to raise. 

She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and more chickens to raise.

loans.name: Grupo Las Comerciantes De Utatlan Group

texts.es:
Es un día muy caluroso, el mercado mayor de Sololá está repleto de personas que van y vienen, unos comprando otros vendiendo.  La esperanza baila entre los dos grupos.Entre esos grupos se encuentra Catarina de 47 años de edad ella con tanto esfuerzo y empeño realiza el sostenimiento de 5 hijos, los dos primeros ya tienen familias apartes y los tres últimos son estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de la comunidad. (Catarina es la que se encuentra en medio de la fotografía)
	
La actividad que ella realiza es la compra y venta de verduras en el mayoreo del departamento de Sololá, ella viene realizando dicha actividad durante 10 años ella empezó dicha actividad porque le genera una muy buena ganancia para cambiar las condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia. La segunda actividad que ella realiza es trabajar como ama de casa.
Ella se ha convertido en un ejemplo a seguir en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de personas se han reunido a Catarina para así emprender juntos los negocios para que ellos también tengan las condiciones de vida.

El uso respectivo que ella le rara al crédito gestionado es para la compra de mas verduras para luego su respectiva venta por los alrededores de su comunidad y en el mayoreo de Sololá ya que es lo único que a ella le genera ingresos económicos, uno de los sueños de ella es ver que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales en la vida y agrandar mas su negocio de venta de verduras y construir casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
It is a very hot day. The main market of Sololá is full of people who come and go, some buying and other selling. Hope dances between the two groups. Among the groups is Catarina, aged 47. With a lot of hard work and dedication, she supports her 5 children. The two oldest already have families of their own and the three youngest are students in a nearby school in the community (Catarina is in the middle of the photo). 
	
The activity she does is buying and selling vegetables in the wholesale market of the department of Sololá. She has been doing this activity for 10 years. She started it because it generates good profits to change her and her family's living conditions. Her second activity is working as a housewife. She has become an example to follow in her community and that is why a group of people have gotten together with Catarina to they can start business and also improve their living conditions.

The reason she is asking for the loan is to buy more vegetables so that she can do her selling around the community and in the wholesale market of Sololá. It is the only thing that generates income for her. One of her dreams is to see her children have good professions in life and expand her business selling vegetables, as well as build houses for her children to they can have adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do repairs and maintenance on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre y un sobrino. Él es un hombre emprendedor que buscando la manera de apoyar a su madre en la economía familiar instalo una pequeña tienda de venta de productos varios en su vivienda, lo que le permite sostener la economía del hogar. Juan desea cambiar el techo del corredor de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, y polines para cambiar el techo del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan is 31 years old and lives in his own home with his mother and his nephew. He is an enterprising man who, looking for a way to help his mother with the household expenses, opened a small shop selling various products in his home. By this, he covers the household expenses.

Juan wants to replace the roof of the hallway of his home. For this, he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets which he will use to replace the roof of the hallway in his home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets and beams to replace the roof of the hallway of his home.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion works hard to support her family. She is widowed, and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Concepcion requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for two years now.

Concepcion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rocio Nohely

texts.es:
Rocio es una joven trabajadora de 25 años, trabaja como empleada del hogar en su ciudad natal, Lima. Siempre se esfuerza para poder salir adelante, el buen desempeño que tiene en el trabajo es el resultado de los valores que sus padres inculcaron en ella y a los deseos de superación con los que despierta cada mañana, esa motivación está haciendo que Rocio cada día se esfuerce más en sus labores.
Rocio está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una nueva cocina para su casa, ya que la que tiene está deteriorada y es un poco peligroso cocinar en ella, así tendrá mayor seguridad y seguirá luchando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Rocio is a hardworking woman who is 25 years old. She works as a domestic employee in her city of origin, Lima. She always works hard to be able to get ahead. Her good performance at work is the result of the values that her parents instilled in her and her wish to get ahead that she wakes up with every morning. That motivation is making Rocio strive more every day at her work.

Rocio is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the support they have given, she will be able to buy a new stove for her house. The one she has is deteriorated and it is a little dangerous to cook with it. This way, she will be safer and she will keep fighting for her family's well being.

loans.use: to buy a stove for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Parasakthi Shg - Venanallur Group

texts.en:
Suganya is the leader of the Parasakthi Self Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO People's Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu. Suganya lives in Venanallur village with her child and husband in her own house. Her husband is a farmer. She has taken loans from PAT previously and repaid them on time.    

Suganya, like each of the other members, is requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. It costs 1,400 INR. A smokeless stove emits less carbon dioxide, which reduces smoke. Traditional stoves consume more time and money. The smokeless stove is highly efficient and designed for long-term use. This will allow a reduction in problems related to health, deforestation and climate change.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Anastasio

texts.es: Don Anastasio es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta, se dedica desde hace varios años al cultivo de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia  con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Anastasio is a hard-working, responsible and honest person. For various years he has earned a living planting corn. He sells his harvest in different markets close to his home. By this, he can cover some of the household expenses. He lives in his own house with his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc. in order to improve the plot shown in the picture, and to continue with his crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc. to improve his land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more underwear for selling.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su casa desde hace 15 años tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos del hogar, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de: huevos, refrescos, granos básicos, sopas, detergentes, etc. y asi poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their son in their own house. She has had a store in her house for 15 years. She has many customers because of the great variety of products and the good prices she offers. With the proceeds from her sales and with the help of her husband, they can cover the household expenses.

Maria is asking for a loan in order to buy eggs, soft-drinks, staple grains, soups, detergents, etc., in order to be able to continue her sales and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy eggs, soft-drinks, staple grains, soups, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweet bread and quesadillas for selling.

loans.name: Phonyearnoy Group

texts.en:
Mee's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water. The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. 

Mee is excited that she and her neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter. This is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: José de 29 años de edad habita en vivienda humilde pero propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijas de 1 y 7 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que todos los días se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia, apoyándose en su trabajo de albañil independiente, el cual realiza desde hace 10 años, en el lugar en el que soliciten sus servicios. La vivienda de José está hecha de lámina, pero actualmente desea cambiar el techo de la misma, ya que como se observa en la fotografía, actualmente se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 29 years old and lives in a very simple home, which, however, is his own. He lives with his partner and their two children, who are 1 and 7 years old. He is a hard-working man who every day struggles to get his family ahead and to support them with his job as an independent bricklayer. He has done this job for 10 years and works where his services are needed. 

José's home is made of metal sheets, but now he wants to replace the roof, because, as can be seen in the picture, it has deteriorated. Therefore he is asking a loan from FUSAI to purchase galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to replace the roof of his home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to replace the roof of his home.

loans.name: Tong Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Hoa is an ethnic Thai woman, currently living with her husband and two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province.
 
The main occupation of her family is chicken breeding and cultivation with two or three chicken litters sold each year bringing an income of approximately VND 25 million, including costs. That money is just enough to cover her family's living expense and the remaining money is not enough to invest in ckicken breeding. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes the loan will help her family invest and expand her chicken breeding in the garden, a highly profitable model, so that her family can have a better life, as well as pay for her children’s education and improve conditions.

loans.use: to invest in chicken breeding.

loans.name: Nguyen Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh, born in 1983, is the youngest member in the group. She currently lives with her husband and her lovely and smart daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family's main income is livestock breeding and cultivation. Each year, it is just enough to make a living after deducting the costs from the revenue. 

She wants to expand breeding of chickens and geese but she doesn’t have enough money. So she needs to borrow money to invest in expanding the breeding to create more income for her family.

She expects the loan will partly support the investment in breeding and improve her family's life. She and her family will have the highest awareness of being responsible to repay on time in order to get good advice from M7-MFI for her business, her production plan, and for spending and saving effectively.

loans.use: to expand breeding of chickens and geese.

loans.name: Nguyen Hue's Group

texts.en:
Hue was born in 1971. She lives with her husband and son in Hat Lot town, Mai Son district, Son La province.
 
Her family income is from cultivation and breeding, in which breeding provides the main income. The economic condition is not very good. This year, because she has planned to upgrade the house, her family decided to invest in expanding their livestock breeding. She desires to borrow a loan for this purpose.
	
She hopes the breeding work will be favorable and bring her family greater revenues to improve their lives and realize their intended future.

loans.use: to invest in expanding livestock breeding.

loans.name: Rudenia

texts.en:
Rudenia is 36 years old and a mother of six children, ages 7 to 18. They live in Carles, Iloilo. 

Rudenia and her husband have been in a fishing business for 18 years now. She is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets and a fishing boat. Rudenia aimed at making her family's life comfortable, but because of the typhoon catastrophe that befell them, she and her husband have to work hard to make the most of what they have now to make up for what they lost. She hopes that with the loan, they can have their source of livelihood in abundance.

Her income will be for food and school fees. 

In the future, she hopes to see her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and buy educational equipment for her son.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Rosa de 20 años de edad, es soltera y estudio hasta bachillerato,  con ella solamente viven sus abuelos.

Rosa se dedica a trabajar con sus abuelos en las labores agrícolas, todos los días desde la 5:30 am luego regresa a su casa para luego dedicarse a cuidar su granja de cerdos. Todo lo que sabe de agricultura y el cuido de cerdos lo aprendió de sus abuelos. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar materiales de construcción como arena, hierro, cemento, ladrillo y demás para construir una galera en donde pueda tener a sus animales, por el momento el lugar donde los tiene no es adecuado.

Rosa planea más adelante establecer una tiende de artículos de primera necesidad, en la zona donde ella vive no hay ninguna así que espera le dé buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Rosa, 20, is single and studied up to high school.  Only her grandparents live with her.

Rosa works with her grandparents doing agricultural labor at 5:30 in the morning, then returns home to take care of her pig farm.  She learned everything she knows about agriculture and raising pigs from her grandparents.

She'll use the loan to buy sand, rebar, cement, bricks, and other construction materials to build a pen for her animals.  The place she's keeping them at the moment is not suitable.

Rosa's plan for the future is to set up a store to sell staple products.  There's no such store in the area where she lives, so she hopes it gives her good results.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a pig pen

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who is a massage therapist in the Philippines. Annabelle has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from selling herbal products.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials like oil, towels, etc. for her business.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like oil, towels, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith works hard to support her family.

Judith is married and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Judith requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Judith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 61 years old, married and had three children. She is a hog raiser and a vegetable vendor, too. Through her business, she was able to gain income to sustain her family's needs. She wanted to keep improving her income, but had insufficient funds to revolve in her business, so she is now asking for additional capital of P7,000 to buy hog feed and to buy vegetables (eggplant, beans, tomatoes) to sell. Someday, she hopes to achieve financial stability and grow as a successful vendor and hog raiser.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a snack vendor in their village. She is 42 years old and has five children. She cooks fish balls, eggs, and hotdogs. From her small business, she was able to gain enough daily income to buy meals for her family. She hopes to keep improving her business and gain good profits so she can invest in a hog raising business. Milagros is now asking for a loan of  P13,000 to buy eggs, squid balls, hot dogs and fish balls to cook and sell. 

Someday, she hopes to improve her profits and cook more snacks to meet all her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy eggs, squid balls, hot dogs and fish balls to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from videoke machine rental. 

Delia is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is married and she has 2 children. She has been involved in business activities since 2014, starting with her own working capital of $800. She has a kiosk in her house and she is also selling in the market. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy additional supplies, including cooking oil, perfume, salts, rice, coffee, noodles, slippers, sugar and other things to sell. She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business, because her hope is to open a bigger store in the future. Marina also raises animals at her house, like cows, pigs, a horse and chickens.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, perfume, salts, rice, coffee, noodles, slippers, sugar and other things to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single mother of four children and all of them go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells used clothes and has been in this business for seven years. 

She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. She sells from door to door and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include the rainy season, which hinders her movements, and transportation. 

She is hoping to get a permanent business location and also to build a house on her plot of land. She resides now in a rented house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than four years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She has had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, in order to provide their children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Merlita would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 30,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Merlita dreams of making her store bigger. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 49 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, vinegar, sanitary pads, shampoo, hair conditioner, soft-drinks, etc. Corazon has been in this business for 13 years and sells a wide variety of items. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, vinegar, sanitary pads, shampoo, hair conditioner, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
El grupo "San Judas Tadeo" está ubicado en una comunidad 100% cañera donde se encuentra uno de los 58 ingenios productores de azúcar de México. La mayoría de las personas trabajan en el campo, se levantan muy temprano y comienzan a cortar o a limpiar la caña a las 6:00 AM pues tratan de aprovechar al máximo la mañana y su clima fresco. Por las tardes, los trabajadores llegan a compartir su almuerzo, que disfrutan bajo la sombra de algún árbol.

El nombre del grupo lo eligieron por la fe que tienen en el santo, y porque ha sido él quien les ha dado fuerza espiritual para continuar.

Rosalía es soltera, vive con su mamá, no tiene niños pero cuida a la hija de una sobrina; es la niña quien alegra sus días. Desde hace ya 8 años Rosalía mejor conocida como “Chalía” se ha dedicado a vender refrescos, al principio vendía en su casa pero actualmente se ha asociado con su madre y hermana. Entre las tres han abierto una tienda de abarrotes donde y ella invierte en la compra de los refrescos. Con las ganancias obtenidas apoya a su madre con parte de los gastos de la casa. Asimismo, Chalía compra el material necesario para la elaboración de piñatas, guías, coronas las cuales vende en noviembre y diciembre que es cuando sus clientes las buscan. “Aprendí a hacer coronas y a encerar el papel para las flores de las guías pues mi madre me enseñó, también hacer las piñatas”. De esa manera, en noviembre y diciembre la familia obtine un poco más de ganancias. Es por eso que ha Chalía ha solicitado un préstamo nuevamente a VisionFund México para invertir en la compra de refrescos, jugos, agua y un poco de material (globos, floratec, papel crepe, cera, hojas de colores, unicel, hojas para corona, papel celofán, diurex) para las coronas, piñatas y guías. De esta manera comenzará a surtirse y a prepararse para la época de ventas de sus productos. 

Las demás integrantes son:

Felicitas - Venta De Abarrotes
María - Venta De Ropa
Virginia - Venta De Abarrotes 
Inés - Venta De Ropa
Marisela - Calzado Por Catalogo
Salustia - Venta De Refrescos

*En la imagen: Rosalía viste una blusa blanca y está de pie justo detrás de la señora de blusa blanca con flores rojas.
texts.en:
The "San Judas Tadeo" communal bank is located in a 100% sugarcane community where one of Mexico’s fifty-eight sugar producing mills is found.  Most people work in the field; they arise very early and begin cutting and cleaning the sugarcane at 6:00 in the morning, trying to make the most of the morning and its cool climate.  In the afternoons, the workers come to share their lunch, enjoying the shade of a tree.  The name of the group was chosen because of the faith that they have in the saint, and because he has been the one that has given them the spiritual strength to keep going. 
 
Rosalía is single, and lives with her mother.  She doesn’t have children but takes care of her niece’s daughter.  It is the child that brightens her days.  For eight years, Rosalía, better known as “Chalía”, has been engaged in selling soft drinks.  At first, she sold them in her home, but currently she is partnering with her mother and sister.  Among the three, they have opened a grocery store where she is investing in the purchase of soft drinks.  With the profits she earns, she supports her mother by paying a portion of the household expenses.  Chalía also buys the necessary material to make piñatas, leis, and crowns, which she sells in November and December when customers are looking for them.  “I learned to make crowns and wax the paper for the floral leis because my mother taught me; she also showed me how to make piñatas”.  In this way, the family earns a little more profit in November and December.  For this reason, Chalía has requested another loan from VisonFund Mexico.  She will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, juice, and water as well as a little material (balloons, “floratec” [botanical formula]), crepe paper, wax, colorful leaves, Styrofoam, crown sheets, cellophane, and Scotch tape) for the crowns, piñatas, and leis.  In this way, she will begin to stock up and prepare for the products’ sales season.  

The rest of the members are

Felicitas – grocery sales
María – clothing sales
Virginia – grocery sales
Inés – clothing sales
Marisela – footwear by catalog
Salustia – soft drink sales

In the photo, Rosalía is wearing a blue blouse and is standing just behind the woman in the white blouse with red flowers.

loans.use: comprará: refrescos, jugos, agua, globos, cera, hojas de colores, unicel, papel celofán

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 36 years old and is married with one daughter. Her husband earns money by assembling vehicle spare parts. Thanh has been selling drinking water bottles for seven years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to raise her child. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Thanh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of drinking water bottles to sell. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy drinking water bottles to sell.

loans.name: Aligrace

texts.en: Aligrace is single and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell. In the future, Aligrace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao would like to take a further loan to buy more soft drinks to sell from her store. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 50-year-old married mother of three, who has been baking delicious saj bread since 2008 in order to support her husband who works as a taxi driver in covering their family's increasing living needs and education costs.

Zeinab is well-known in her region. Her business is located inside her house since she can't afford to establish her own bakery with her limited income combined with her husband's because of their family's increasing needs.

In parallel to her current business, Zeinab works in an agriculture business specialized in tobacco to make sure she can provide her children with the best education.

Today, she is  acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's increasing university tuition fees.

She hopes to develop her existing businesses more to make sure that she can have a good income to cover her children's future education costs.

loans.use: to pay for her children's university tuition fees

loans.name: Luz Melissa

texts.es:
Luz es una joven emprendedora de 20 años, soltera y trabaja vendiendo golosinas en su ciudad natal, Lima. Cada mañana Luz despierta con la motivación de querer superarse, y que su día sea mucho mejor que el anterior, es por ello que cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy optimista, responsable y trabajadora.
Luz está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprarse una laptop para en sus ratos libres poder navegar por la red, así como investigar sobre cursos a distancia que pueda estudiar, así estará mejorando su calidad de vida y más adelante podrá tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is a young entrepreneur of 20 years old. She is single and her job is selling candy in her hometown of Lima. Every morning Luz wakes up motivated to better herself and make each day better than the last. She believes that being optimistic, responsible and hard-working makes her good at what she does. 

Luz is thankful to the lender Kiva because with the help they have offered, she will be able to buy herself a laptop so that in her spare time she can surf the internet and investigate distance-learning courses that she could study. By doing this she will improve her quality of life and one day be able to have her own business.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for personal use.

loans.name: Leby

texts.en:
Leby is 40 years old and has been fishing for five years in Carles, Ilo-ilo. He also manages to have another business - a "motorbike-for-hire". These activities usually earn him about 12,000 PHP. However, Leby is also providing for his two-year-old-son's needs. The typhoon Haiyan that affected their location many months ago adversely affected his fishing business, and he is trying to make up for the loss. He is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. 

He hopes that with the loan he can have sturdy nets to use and be more productive when fishing. In the future, Leby hopes to send his child to school for his better future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is 53 years old and blessed with eight children. To generate income, she owns and manages a small retail store within her community. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she aims to improve her retail store to generate sufficient income. Having limited capital, she would like to take a loan of PHP25,000 to buy cooking oil, sugar, noodles, canned goods, snack foods, laundry soaps, beverages and soft drinks to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help to her for improving the business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, noodles, canned goods, snack foods, laundry soaps, beverages and soft drinks to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Carolotan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 33 years and she earns more income from a general store.
