She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like rice, vegetables, fish, spices, etc. for her food production business. Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, vegetables, fish, spices, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.es: Maria de 63 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta, siempre esta buscando la manera de poder salir adelante con su familia, desde hace algunos años posee un negocio de venta de ropa ubicado en el mercado municipal de la localidad donde ella reside, tiene mucha clientela, con las ventas que realiza obtiene buenas ganancias que le ayudan a solventar los gastos que se le presentan, vive en casa propia con su esposo, Doña Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para damas, caballeros y niños para surtir su negocio, obtener mejores ingresos y junto a su esposo  tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, age 63, is a hardworking, responsible, and honest woman. She is always looking for ways for her and her family to get ahead. A few years ago, she started a clothing business at the municipal market in the area where she lives. She has many customers, and with the sales that she generates, she is able to generate a good income for covering her current expenses. She and her husband live in their own home.

Doña Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothing in bulk for women, men, and children so that she can restock her business. As a result, she will generate more income so that she and her husband can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition for her oldest son.

loans.name: Binh's Group

texts.en:
Binh is 42 years old and lives with her children and her husband, who works as an electrician. To help support her family, Binh has been running a shop for the past 20 years, selling electrical products and appliances from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a 6-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

In the picture she is the fourth from the left, wearing a checked shirt. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Binh is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of electrical appliances to sell from her shop. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy electrical appliances to sell.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga would like to take a further loan to buy materials to continue her business of making electrical wire. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of wire and materials to make electrical wire.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is 51 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. She runs a general store that she started six years ago.

She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sugar, sanitation items and other basic products to sell from her store.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica, está casada, su pareja es electricista y agricultor, con él ha procreado 4 hijos de 31 años de edad, 34 años de edad, 37 años de edad y 38 años de edad. Con ella además de su esposo vive una hija y dos nietas.

María tiene 30 años de dedicarse a la venta de leche y queso frescoque ella misma elabora, aprendió por iniciativa pues tenía que ayudar a su esposo de alguna manera para sacar adelante a su familia, trabaja 4 horas diarias y luego ayuda a su esposo en las labores agrícolas.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos vacas lecheras, ya cuenta con 3 pero aumento la demanda de producto y necesita satisfacer a sus clientes.

María espera tener un negocio más próspero y  diversificar los productos a ofrecer como crema y otros tipos de quesos así tener mejores ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
María, age 56, went to school through the third grade.  She is married, and her life partner is an electrician and a farmer.  They have four children, ages 31, 34, 37, and 38.  A daughter and two granddaughters live with her and her husband.

María has been selling milk and fresh cheese that she makes for 30 years.  She learned on her own initiative.  She had to help her husband, in some way, in order to get the family ahead.  She works four hours every day, and then she helps her husband with the agricultural work.

The loan will be used to buy two dairy cows.  She now has three, but the product demand has increased, and she needs to satisfy her customers.

María hopes to have a more prosperous business and to diversify the products she sells such as cream and other types of cheeses.  This way she will have better earnings for her family.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: La Domesticas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras, exitosas una de ellas es Julia tiene 47 años de edad, acompañada y su negocio es la elaboración y comercialización de cepillos de lavar ropa, tiene cinco años de tener su negocio y el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como nylon de colores, madera, alambre, etc. Margarita tiene 31 años de edad y su  negocio es la venta de prendas de plata, ropa, calzado y Dolores tiene 43 años de edad su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, calzado y ropa.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising and successful members. One of them is Julia, age 47. She is in a relationship and has a business of making and selling scrub brushes for washing clothes. Julia has been in this business for five years and her loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials such as colored nylon, wood, wire, and other items.

Margarita is 31 years old and has a business of selling silver jewelry, clothes, and shoes. Dolores is 43 years old and has a business of selling cosmetics, shoes, and clothes.

loans.use: to buy colored nylon, wood, wire, and other supplies for making scrub brushes.

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en:
Matanat is 46 years old and married with a daughter and a son. She is a refugee, as are the other members of the family, and all of them live in an IDP settlement. Her husband is a laborer and he helps the family as much as possible, but the main income comes from gardening. Matanat has been raising and selling seasonal fruits and vegetables for 22 years. She has good experience in gardening, but her monthly income is only about 220AZN.

Gardening is in high demand in Azerbaijan because people use fresh fruits and vegetables for different tasty things. Matanat has a grocery at a local bazaar and sells her harvest there. However, Matanat’s garden wasn’t productive enough this year. She applied for a loan of 1,500AZN in order to buy good fertilizers to increase the harvest. She wants to increase her income and provide her family with a good life.

loans.use: to buy good fertilizers to increase the harvest.

loans.name: Chuong

texts.en:
Chuong is 34 years old and married with a son. She lives in Ho Chi Minh city. Chuong supports her family through running a cafe, selling breakfast and soft drinks for people in her community.

She started this business 10 years ago. Now she is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more better quality food to meet her customers' demands. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers, and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business.

loans.use: To buy food for selling from her cafe.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan would like to take a further loan to buy ice storage and cutting equipment. Lan's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ice storage and cutting equipment.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc would like to take a further loan to buy appliances and ingredients to make food to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy appliances and ingredients to make food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Marío Roberto

texts.es:
Mario de 63 años de edad, es casado, estudio hasta 9° grado de educación básica, vive con su esposa y 2 nietos.

Mario es agricultor,  aprendió desde pequeño trabajando con su padre, además cría ganado en su casa, todos los días se levantan todos a las 5:00 am para contribuir con el ordeño del ganado y las labores agrícolas, luego su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, en la tarde sus nietos van a estudiar y él cuida los animales.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una novilla que le vende un familiar a buen precio y quiere aprovechar la oportunidad, espera hacerla producir leche y contribuir con el sostén de la familia.

Mario se proyecta que con financiamiento y las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de la cosecha y la leche poder comprar un terreno donde cultivar y tener sus animales.
texts.en: Mario is 63 years old and married. He studied up to 9th grade of primary school. He lives with his wife and 2 grandchildren. Mario is a farmer. He learned this job by working with his father. He also raises cattle. Every day, the family gets up at 5 a.m. to milk the cows and work in the field. Afterwards, Mario's wife works in household chores. In the afternoon, his grandchildren go to school and he takes care of the animals. He will use the loan to buy a heifer from a relative who is selling it at a good price, and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity. He hopes to have the heifer produce milk and help with the family's income. With the loan and the earnings from selling his harvest and the milk, Mario hopes to be able to buy a lot where to cultivate and keep his animals.

loans.use: to buy a heifer for fattening.

loans.name: Nila Shg - Vellanur Group

texts.en:
Jerlin is 32 years old and resides in Vellanur, a small village in Tamil Nadu, India. Jerlin is married, and they have two children, both of whom are studying in elementary school. Her husband is a laborer in agricultural fields, but now is unable to sustain his family with his income alone.
 
Jerlin is the featured borrower of the 15 other-member “Nila” Self-Help Group (SHG). The group has been receiving loans from the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) for the last four years.    

Jerlin and her group would like to take a Kiva loan to purchase a Greenway smart smokeless stove. Each group member is requesting a small loan of INR 1,400, which will be repaid in easy installments. The Greenway smart stove is a single burner, high-efficiency cook-stove designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel including wood, cow dung and agricultural waste. It also produces 70% less smoke while using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook-stoves.  

Jerlin and her group have the opportunity to save time and cut a recurring fuel expense, all while being able to cook in a healthier environment. This stove has also been tested and certified by the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy (MNRE), Government of India.

loans.use: to purchase a sustainable smokeless stove

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a young businesswoman. She is married with one child and is living in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who mentors secondary school students. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 25 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. Cynthia started the business in 2012 because she wanted to be financially independent.
  
Cynthia would like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. Cynthia hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feeds

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang would like to take a further loan to buy raw food and noodles to make meals for selling from her stall. Trang's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy raw food and noodles to make meals for selling.

loans.name: Renia

texts.en:
Renia is a sari-sari (variety) store owner from the municipality of Carles in Ilo-ilo. She is married, and together with her husband, has another business, which is fishing. They have been fishing for 38 years already. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets and merchandise such as canned goods, noodles, condiments and toiletries. Renia hopes that with a loan, she can continue building her life back after the Haiyan typhoon caused her to lose a good income from the past months and greatly affected her neighborhood as well.

Her profit will be used to buy healthy food and for reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and merchandise such as canned goods, noodles, condiments and toiletries

loans.name: Udhaya Shg - Valadi Group

texts.en:
Krishnaveni (who has her hand raised) and nine other women hailing from Valadi in Tamil Nadu have formed a Self-Help Group (SHG) named Udhaya. 

Thirty-year-old Krishnaveni is a daily wage laborer, as are the other members of the group. They work long hours outside, only to come back home and spend a lot of time cooking over traditional "chulha" stoves that emit a lot of smoke that is detrimental to their health. The smoke affects the children at home too. Besides, there is always the danger of contracting respiratory ailments hovering over their heads. 

So Krishnaveni and her group have approached PAT, which is promoting cook stoves as part of their energy initiative with the financial support of Micrograam. The benefits of the Greenway cook stove are: fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of CO and CO2, fast and convenient cooking, high durability, and they are maintenance free and smokeless. The stove operates on all solid fuels such as wood, agro-waste, charcoal, coal and dry dung, and does not require any refurbishing or recurring costs. Due to all the above reasons, these cook stoves are preferred by the group.

Krishnaveni is the featured borrower, and her group is seeking a loan repayable in easy installments to buy the Greenway cook stoves. Your loan will help these hardworking women to ensure better health for themselves and their families.

loans.use: to buy a sustainable cook stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing

loans.name: Azizullo

texts.ru: Азизулло 52-летний житель района Дж.Руми. Он работает в государственном учреждении, а его жена домохозяйка. У них шестеро детей - трое сыновей и трое дочерей. Сыновья тоже работают. Азизулло планирует открыть столовую на центральном рынке района. Он уже приобрел помещение для столовой, однако там необходимо провести косметический ремонт, а также купить столы и стулья. Для этих целей Азизулло берет кредит в размере 1000 долларов США. В его столовой будет работать жена Азизулло. Она давно хотела работать. Благодаря кредиту жена Азизулло будет обеспечен работой и к тому же их финансовое положение улучшится. Поэтому они надеются на этот кредит.
texts.en: Azizullo is a 52-year-old resident of the J.Rumy district. He works at a public institution and his wife is a homemaker. They have six children - three sons and three daughters. Their sons have  jobs. Azizullo is planning to open a cafe in the central market. He already has the space for the cafe but he needs to make some cosmetic repairs and buy tables and chairs. This is why Azizullo is taking out a loan for $1000 USD. His wife has wanted to work for a while and will now work in the cafe. Thanks to the loan, Azizullo's wife will be able to work and the family's financial situation will improve. This is why they need the loan.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs and make repairs to his cafe

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 40 years old, married and had three children. She is managing a general store selling grocery items, meat and fish to the people in her village. She patiently manages her small business in order to gain good profits for her family's daily consumption of meals and the school fees of her children. 

She wanted to buy more stock of merchandise to sell, so she is now asking for additional revolving capital of 18,000 pesos to buy canned goods, soft drinks, chicken and pork meat to sell. Someday, she hopes to keep increasing her income and continue improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, chicken and pork meat to sell

loans.name: Rene Jose

texts.es:
René de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° de educación básica, tiene 14 años de estar casado y su pareja se dedica a la venta de pupusas, han procreado 2 hijos de 7 años de edad y 11 años de edad. Solamente su esposa y sus hijos viven con él.

René es electricista, tiene 7 años de experiencia, aprendió un poco estudiando pero fue un amigo que le enseño completamente el oficio, trabaja entre 6 y 7 horas diarias, ya que al ser empleado de la alcaldía desempeña trabajos eventuales. Cuando no labora como electricista, trabaja la tierra con su esposa, ambos son agricultores.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar herramientas de trabajo, taladro, pulidora y un equipo de soldadura, así podrá desempeñar mejor su trabajo, ya que algunos no los acepta por carecer de estas herramientas que son necesarias para realizarlos.

Rene espera algún día tener una compañía de servicios de eléctricos, pues considera que son muy demandados y será un gran negocio. También espera que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en: René is 35 years old. He studied up to 9th grade of primary school. He has been married 14 years and his wife sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas). They have 2 children who are 7 and 11 years old. Only his wife and children live with him. Rene is an electrician. He has 7 years of experience. He learned it a bit by studying, but it was a friend of his who fully taught him the job. He works between 6 and 7 hours a day, because as an employer at the mayor's office he works some casual jobs. When he is not working as an electrician, he works the field with his wife since both are farmers. He will use the loan to buy work tools: a drill, a polishing machine and welding equipment. This way he will be able to do his job better, because he has had to refuse some jobs due to the lack of these needed tools. Some day, Rene hopes to have a company of electrical services, because he thinks there is high demand for these services and it would be a great business. He also hopes that his children finish a college education.

loans.use: to buy a drill, a polishing machine and welding equipment.

loans.name: Rysbek

texts.ru: Рысбеку 33 года, холост. Образование- среднее, с 1997 года занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Рысбека, на сегодняшний день у него есть 3 коровы, 19 овец. В наличии есть 0,80 ГА поливной земли, где Рысбек  выращивает кукурузу для откорма скота. Рысбек подрабатывает оказывая услуги перевозок по городу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рысбек обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, улучшение благосостояния, так как он планирует в ближайшем будущем жениться.
texts.en: Rysbek is 33 and unmarried. He has a high school education and has been raising livestock since 1997. Thanks to his hard work, Rysbek currently has three cows and 19 sheep in addition to a 0.80 hectare plot of land where he plants corn to feed his livestock. Rysbek also earns money by providing transportation services around town. In order to expand his farm, Rysbek applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy sheep. He will use the profits to continue investing in his business and improving his financial situation because he is planning to get married soon.

loans.use: To purchase sheep in order to have a more profitable business so that he will have money for his wedding

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es:
Ovidio, de 31 años y padre de dos hijos, aprendió a ser chofer mientras vivía en la capital y al venir a su comunidad de origen con sus ahorros compró un vehículo y se dedicó a este servicio público de transporte que le ha generado un ingreso económica favorable para su familia y apoyar a su comunidad para el desarrollo.

El ha solicitado un préstamo para darle el mantenimiento requerido por el vehículo y poder servir de esa manera a su ciudad, además que su actividad laboral es una fuente de ingresos para su familia.

Dentro de sus metas es lograr comprar otro vehículo y ampliar su negocio.  Y como resultado darles un mejor panorama económico a sus hijos y educación para que sean buenos profesionales en la vida. 

Mientras los pasajeros de suben y bajan en su vehículo llevan sus propias vidas como Ovidio la suya hacia el desarrollo en un futuro menor y a una condición de vida favorable.
texts.en:
Ovidio is 31 years old and the father of two children.  He learned to be a driver while living in the capital, and upon returning to his hometown with his savings he bought a vehicle and began offering public transport services. This has generated income that is favorable to his family as well as his support towards the community development.

He has requested a loan to give his vehicle the necessary maintenance. He can in this way be of service to his town, and his work is a source of income for his family. 

One of his goals is to buy another vehicle and expand the business, in order to give his children a better financial outlook and education so they may become future professionals. 

While his passengers get on and off his vehicle they carry on with life, as does Ovidio, oriented towards development in the near future and favorable living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Wualdina

texts.es:
La señora Wualdina es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijos y  esposo en una comunidad en la zona sur  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas y su negocio  es muy conocido en su comunidad.
Doña Wualdina necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, cal, leña. Los cuales  necesita para seguir elaborando su  producto espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un aumento considerable el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida.
Doña Wualdina espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  sus hijos continúe con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto  del  2014
texts.en:
Sra. Wualdina is a hardworking and responsible person who lives with her husband and children in a community that is located in southern Honduras. Her business involves making and selling tortillas. In addition, her business is well-known in the community.

Doña Wualdina needs a loan in order to buy corn, lime powder, and firewood. These items are needed so that she can continue making her product. Thanks to this loan, she expects to have the necessary supplies for continuing her business and meeting the demand of her customers. Her sales will also increase considerably, which will be reflected in her quality of life.

Doña Wualdina hopes that her business continues to grow so that she can gain more recognition in her community. This will enable her to continue supporting her family and to help her children continue their studies so that they will have more opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, and firewood for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two of them go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Joy operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy cassava, sweet potatoes, onions, tomatoes and sweet bananas. She works seven days a week. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy cassava, sweet potatoes, onions, tomatoes and sweet bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de ropa de segunda mano su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su madre quien le ayuda con el negocio, es una joven muy trabajadora, responsable  y honesta, siempre está buscando la manera de poder ayudar a su madre en los gastos de la casa, ella está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar fardos de ropa y seguir con sus ventas, para que junto a su madre tengan una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is pixilated in the photo is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She has been selling secondhand clothes for three years and her business is located in her home. The borrower lives in her own house along with her mother, who helps with the business.

She is a hardworking, responsible, and honest young woman who is always looking for ways to help her mother with the household expenses. The borrower is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy bales of clothing so that she can continue her sales. This will help her and her mother to have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Aracely

texts.es:
Rosa de 51 años de edad, por falta de recursos económicos, no tuvo acceso a la educación, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 28 años de edad que está estudiando en la universidad. Vive con su hija y solo su hija depende de ella.

Rosa es ama de casa, pero también tiene 30 años dedicándose a la venta de lácteos, tiene dos vacas lecheras que le proporcionan lo necesario como para vender leche y queso que ella misma elabora, trabaja 6 horas diarias y en el cuido de los animales también le colabora su hija.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una vaca productora de leche que Rosa espera llegue a mejorar la producción de leche y a la vez aumentar la producción de sus derivados para la venta.

Rosa se proyecta tener un negocio de lácteos mayor, ofrecer otros tipos de productos como el quesillo y la crema, también que su hija termine la carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old. Because of the lack of financial resources she didn't go to school. She is a single mother who has a 28 year old daughter who is studying at university. She lives with her daughter and only her daughter is dependent on her.

Rosa is a housewife but also has 30 years of working selling dairy products. She has two milk cows that produce enough milk to sell and cheese that she makes herself to sell. She works 6 hours a day taking care of the animals and also has the help of her daughter.

The loan will be used to buy a milk cow that Rosa hopes will increase her milk production and at the same time increase the milk by-products for sale. Rosa plans to have a bigger dairy business, offering other types of products like cream cheese and cream. She also hopes that her daughter completes her university studies.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a 34-year-old married man from the town of Carles, Iloilo.  He has one daughter who is four years old. Jessie relies on fishing and catching crabs to earn a living and support his family. A few months back, his place was hit by Haiyan typhoon that wrought havoc to their place, especially on the fishing equipment of people like him. Jessie persevered and works hard for his family. He is asking for a loan to buya  fishing boat, engine and fishing nets.

In the future, he  hopes to be able to give his family an abundant and comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, engine and fishing nets

loans.name: Media

texts.en:
Media is a 23-year-old businesswoman from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. Media volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school.  She teaches students beneficial leadership skills. Additionally, Media rents a shop where she sells cooking oil, sweets, royco, soap, and sugar. She has been running this business for a year and it has enabled her to support her family.  
With the Kiva loan, Media would like to expand her business into a retail store. She will purchase more products to sell. A thriving business will allow her to improve her standard of living and provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pair of young bull calves to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Oeun Group

texts.en: Oeun is a farmer and a widowed woman with three children living in Pursat Province of Cambodia. She cultivates rice and also fattens animals at home. She has been a farmer since 1994. One of her children is a student. She can earn approximately $11 daily. Now Oeun would like to request a loan with a group of six members and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will provide her and her family a hygienic living. In the future, she is going to expand her farming, renovate her house and support her child to finish high school or university, if possible.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a 26 year-old married woman and a mother of a one year-old child, from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than five years now. This is the source of their income. Jenelyn and her family live in a typhoon ravaged place in the country.

Jenelyn is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. With this, her husband will be able to go back to fishing and augment his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.  The loan will help alot so she can improve her business. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business that will allow her to earn a bigger profit .

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for nine years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Margarita would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 15,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Margarita hopes to improve her business and also the general living condition of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Vilma Maribel

texts.es: Vilma es una persona muy trabajadora siempre está buscando la manera de poder salir adelante con su familia, desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de tostaditas de plátanos y papas  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su esposo, Vilma está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas bolsitas de tostadas asi como muestra en la fotografia para seguir con sus ventas y poder tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Vilma is a hard-working person who is a;ways looking for a way to get ahead with her family. For the past number of years she has been selling plantation and potato chips. Her business is located at her house. She lives with her husband in her own house. Vilma is requesting a loan to buy more bags of plantain chips as shown in the photo. Then she can continue with her sales and together with her husband enjoy a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more bags of plantain chips.

loans.name: Eden Group

texts.fr: Bahani est commerçante et membre de la banque communautaire Eden, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 40 ans, veuve et mere de 5 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Elle est sociétaire d’une mini quincaillerie depuis 16 ans. Elle va acheter des matériels et matériaux de construction et autres articles(Sacs de clous, ciments, fers à béton, des huiles moteurs etc.). Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits construire en dure, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Bahani is a merchant and a member of the community bank Eden. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 40 years old, a widow, and the mother of five children, who are all in school. She started her business with funds from her husband when he was alive. Bahani has been an associate of a mini-hardware-store for sixteen years. She is going to purchase construction materials and supplies and other items (bags of nails, cement, iron rods, motor oil, etc.). She wishes to obtain more loans, build [a substantial house], and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and supplies and other items (bags of nails, cement, iron rods, motor oil, etc.)

loans.name: Ujumbe Group

texts.fr: Ruboneka est commerçante et membre de la banque communautaire Ujumbe, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 52 ans, marié à un pasteur et mère de 7 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu  de son mari. Elle est propriétaire d’une  quincaillerie depuis 10 ans. Elle va acheter des matériels de construction (Sacs de clous, vannes, fer à béton, tôles etc.). Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits,  construire en dure, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Ruboneka is a merchant and a member of the community bank Ujumbe. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 52 years old, married to a pastor, and the mother of seven children, who are all in school. She started her business with funds from her husband. Ruboneka has been the owner of a hardware store for ten years. She is going to purchase construction materials and supplies (bags of nails, screens, iron rods, sheetmetal, etc.). She wishes to obtain more loans, build [a substantial house], and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (nails, screens, iron rods, sheetmetal, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and pay labor to build a room in her house.

loans.name: Dora Ursula

texts.es: Dora de 45 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre y su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que todos los días se esfuerza por salir adelante, y apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar, prestando sus servicios domésticos  de forma domiciliar. Dora desea colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda para mejorar su calidad de vida, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena y pagar mano de obra para colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dora is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her mother and her family group. She is an enterprising woman who puts forth the effort every day to get ahead, and to help her mother with household expenses, by offering her domestic services as a maid. 

Dora wants to install cement flooring in her home in order to improve her quality of life. For that reason, she is soliciting a loan through FUSAI to purchase floor blocks, cement, and sand, and to pay workers to install the floor in her home.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of floor blocks, cement, and sand, and to pay workers to install the floor in her home.

loans.name: Turgunoy

texts.ru:
Тургуной 16 лет назад начала животноводческий бизнес в своем районе Хуросон. Этой деятельности она научилась при доме мужа у своего свекра. Тургуной имеет среднее специальное образование. Она одновременно работает в школе преподавателем. У Тургуной есть двое детей. Сыну 14 лет, а дочери 16 лет. Они школьники. В деятельности ей помогают дети и свекор. Им нравится разводить коров и телят, так как они обеспечивают их молоком и молочными продуктами. 
В данный момент Тургуной хочет увеличить поголовье скотов, чтобы сделать бизнес еще прибыльнее. На сумму кредита она хочет купить несколько крупнорогатых скотин и надеется, что ее поддержат.
texts.en:
Turgunoy started her livestock breeding business sixteen years ago in the Khuroson District. This business was started in the yard outside her husband's house by her father-in-law. Turgunoy has a specialized secondary education. She simultaneously works as a teacher in a school. Turgunoy has two children. Her son is 14 years old and her daughter is 16 years old. They are still in school. Her children and her father-in-law help her with her business. They like to raise cows and calves as these animals provide them with milk and dairy products.

Currently, Turgunoy wants to increase the size of her herd in order to make her business even more profitable. She wants to buy several cattle with the money from the loan and hopes that you will support her.

loans.use: to buy several cattle.

loans.name: Amina Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nkamisha est commerçante et membre de la banque villageoise Amina, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, célibataire, âgée de 34 ans, mère de 1 enfant non encore scolarisé. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son salaire. Elle est vendeuse et sociétaire d’une boutique dans le centre commercial depuis 6 ans. Elle va acheter de produits manufacturés: des bijoux, jus, cosmétiques, riz, sardines sucre, biscuits, matelas etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit et nourrir son enfant. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: This client, Nkamisha, is a merchant and a member of the ’banc villageois’ Amina. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 34 years old, unmarried, and the mother of one child not yet in school. She started her business with funds from her salary. Nkamisha has been a salesperson and an associate of a store at the shopping center. She is going to purchase manufactured goods: jewelry, juice drinks, cosmetics, rice, sardines, sugar, cookies, mattresses, etc. She wishes to increase her credit and feed her child. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase manufactured goods: jewelry, juice drinks, cosmetics, rice, sardines, sugar, cookies, mattresses

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Sau, 50, is widowed and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business eight years ago. She sells sugar, toys for children, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to strengthen and whitewash the walls of his house.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, 55, is widowed and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a general store and an internet shop in front of her house. 

She started this business three years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products such as instant noodles, sugar, salt and other food products.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy noodles, sugar, salt, and other food products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Purisima

texts.en:
Purisima is 66 years old and comes from Carles, Iloilo. She is a widow and has eight adult children. For ten years now, she has been doing fishing and food vending to earn a living. Purisima is asking for a loan in order to buy ropes, fishing nets and fishing weights. Purisima always works hard in spite of her age because she does not want to be dependent on her children for her needs.

In the future, she hopes to see her business grow which will allow her to save more and buy healthy food.

loans.use: to buy ropes, fishing nets and fishing weights

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquín de 30 años de edad habita junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 6 meses de edad en vivienda propia. Él es un hombre trabajador que todos los días se esfuerza por darle lo mejor que puede a su familia, por lo que se desempeña como carpintero, elaborando diversidad de artículos, como roperos, gaveteros, juegos de comedor, etc. Además su compañera de vida presta sus servicios domésticos para apoyarlo con la economía familiar. Joaquín habita en una vivienda humilde hecha de lámina y madera pero se siente muy feliz porque es propia, pero tratando de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia desea cambiar el techo, ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Joaquín is 30 years old and lives with his life companion and 6 month old son in his own house. He is a hard-working man who each day makes an effort to give the best he can to his family. To do this he works as a carpenter making a variety of articles like wardrobes, dressers, kitchen sets etc. Also his life companion uses her domestic services to support the family economy. Joaquín  lives in a modest house made from laminate and wood but he is happy as it is his own, But he is trying to improve the family's living conditions and wants to replace the roof as it is in poor condition. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized laminate, wood and nails to replace the roof of his house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood and nails to replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Saony Group

texts.en:
Saony is a 25-year-old farmer, cultivating rice and fattening animals. She has been a farmer since 2006. She is a married woman with two children. One of her children is a student. Her husband is 28 and also a farmer. Together, they can earn approximately $10 a day. 

Saony would like to request a loan with her group of four members, and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will help her and her family live in hygienic and better conditions. In the future, she is going to expand her farming, build a new house and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Duoc

texts.en:
Duoc is 62 years old and is married. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She is running a general store. She started this store ten years ago. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitary items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her family in emergencies.

loans.use: To buy food and household items such as eggs, sugar and sanitary items.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Hello, Lenders! Meet Rebecca, a 20-year-old ever smiling farmer from a remote village in Birongo, in the rich highlands of Kisii area of Kenya. She has been actively involved in farming for the last two years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs and various varieties of food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming but the biggest challenge she is facing is lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs. 

Rebecca is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry; sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy, and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality which will translate to more income. 

Apart from an increase in egg output, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that could have been spent in buying fertilizer. 

Your loan will bring joy to her family because she will be able to support her ageing parents and improve her living conditions. Rebecca’s goal is to save more money so that she can go back to school and through your loan she will realize her dream.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Bermet

texts.ru: Бермет 55 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей, образование средне-специальное, по специальности повар, однако на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Бермет добилась очень хороших результатов, у нее есть 1 корова, 50 овец, 5 коз и 1 теленок. Также 1,55 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает картофель и фасоль. Молоко реализует оптовым покупателям, муж подрабатывает на тракторе. Ежемесячный доход Бермет составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бермет обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. Бермет является лидером группы "Байдоолот", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. На прибыль от кредита Бермет планирует увеличить своё хозяйство и купить земельный участок для сына, где он построит свой дом.
texts.en: Bermet is 55 years old, married and a mother of 5 children. She has a secondary-specialized education and is a cook by profession, but has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for many years. Bermet achieved very good results - she has 1 cow, 50 sheep, 5 goats and 1 calf. She also has 1.55 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows potatoes and beans. She sells milk to wholesale customers, and her husband works part-time as a tractor driver. Bermet's monthly income amounts to about 8,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Bermet requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy two bulls. Bermet is a leader of the "Baidoolot" group that consists of two more people, besides her. Bermet is planning to use the profit from this loan to grow her business and buy a land plot for her son, where he can build his house.

loans.use: to buy two bulls in order to grow her business and buy land for her son

loans.name: Gulzina

texts.ru: Гулзине 27 лет, замужем, 3 детей, образование среднее, она очень ответственная и трудолюбивая. С 2005 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулзины есть 1 корова, 1 лошадь и 5 коз. Также на 1,0 ГА собственной земли Гулзина выращивает картофель и фасоль и многолетние травы. Гулзина знает технологию ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности и умеет вкладывать средства по назначению. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Гулзина является одним из трех членов группы "Байдоолот". Гулзина намерена увеличить поголовье скота, а доходы от кредита позволят ей накопить средства на постройку дома и на образование ее детей.
texts.en: Gulzina is 27 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a secondary education, and is a very responsible and hardworking person. She has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2005. Today, Gulzina has 1 cow, 1 horse and 5 goats. She also has 1.00 hectare of owned land, where she grows potatoes, beans and perennial herbs. Gulzina knows the technicalities of the agricultural business and how to invest money where it is needed. In order to further develop her business, Gulzina requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 10 sheep. Gulzina is one of the members of the "Baidoolot" group. Gulzina intends to increase her livestock headcount, and the earnings from this loan will allow her to save money to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount and save money to build a house and educate her children

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The person on the photo is Jane. She is thirty-five years old, single and blessed with three children. She does poultry farming.

She is borrowing a loan to buy quality poultry feed and projects the egg production will increase. She sells eggs and chickens in the local market and hopes to meet the demand of this market. It is from this she hopes her income will increase. She feels that the Kiva loan will assist her to improve her family’s  living standards such as quality education for her children.

 Jane  appreciates Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Herbet Antonio

texts.es:
Herbet de 38 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta 7° grado de educación básica,  esta acompañado y su pareja tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas, han procreado  3 hijos de 10 años de edad, 6 años de edad y 2 años de edad, solo su hija mayor estudia y esta cursando 4° grado de educación básica  en la escuela de la comunidad.

Herbet es comerciante, tiene 12 años de experiencia administrando su tienda  y su molino de nixtamal,  aprendió con su padre que se gano la vida de la misma manera y al no poder  encontrar un empleo formal se dedico al comercio y a prestar servicios de molienda.

El préstamo será utilizado  para comprar productos de la canasta básica tales como arroz, frijol, azúcar, huevos, especias, bebidas y demás,  así aumentar el inventario de su tienda y satisfacer la demanda de la zona.

Herbet espera que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo logre ahorrar el dinero para comprar una casa para vivir cómodo y seguro con su familia, pues por el momento vive en un predio de la alcaldía municipal.
texts.en:
Herbet is 38 years old and he could only study up to 7th grade in basic education. He is married and the couple have a business that sells tortillas. They have three children, ages 10, 6 and 2 years of age. Only the eldest daughter is in school. She is in 4th grade in basic education in the community school.

Herbet is a merchant with 12 years of experience in administering his store and his nixtamal (tortilla dough) mill. He learned the trade from his father who earned his living in the same manner. After being unable to gain formal employment, he dedicated himself to commerce and offering milling services. 

The loan will be used to purchase products in the family basket, such as rice, beans, sugar, eggs, spices, drinks, and other items to augment his store's inventory and satisfy demand in the zone.

Herbet hopes with much effort and work to be able to save money to buy a house and live comfortably and securely with his family. At present, they live in a property belonging to the city government.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, eggs, and other items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo ha vivido toda su vida en la comunidad el sardinal  tiene 33 años de edad , con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo de sus padres estudio la escuela primaria , en esos años era algo peligroso andar en la carretera ya que estaba recién terminando la guerra , su padre le enseño a trabajar las tierras y sembrar maíz frijoles y otros granos , el le tiene mucho cariño a sus padres aunque su  madre hace dos años falleció  nos dice tristemente , el tiene su hogar y vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos su familia dice lo son todo para el por eso trabaja arduamente para que no les falte el pan de cada día, en esta comunidad no cuentan con energía eléctrica por eso el quiere hacer este tramite de crédito y comprar un sistema solar para que asi su familia pueda mejorar su condición de vida ya que estar a oscuras en las noches es bien triste.
texts.en:
Jairo, age 33, has lived his entire life in the community of El Sardinal. Through the great sacrifice and effort of his parents, he was able to get his primary school education. During those years, it was dangerous to walk along the highway because of the war that had just ended. His father taught him how to work the land and to plant corn, bean, and other crops. Jairo is very fond of his parents, but he sadly says that his mother died two years ago.

Jairo has a home where he lives with his wife and their three children. He says they are the reason why he works hard, so that they won’t be lacking in their daily needs. His community does not have electricity, so Jairo is requesting this loan so that he can purchase a solar energy system. As a result, his family can have better living conditions because being in the dark at nighttime is a sad situation.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Four Sisters Group

texts.en:
Fatima is the featured borrower for Four Sisters’ Group. She came from the Philippines to Lebanon with her other group members to work as housekeepers in order to improve the poor living conditions of their beloved families.  They got together to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been friends since they arrived to Lebanon, as they are working hard to develop their living.

Fatima is a 42-year-old, married mother of four children. She left her hometown in an attempt to improve the poor living conditions of her family there, and to satisfy her beloved children with a better living. She wants to pay her children’s increasing school tuition fees. Thus for this reason, her acquired loan will be invested in paying for her children school tuition fees.

With respect to the other group members, Fatima is a 45-year-old, single lady who wants to help her family. Amelyn is a 44-year-old, married mother of three children, and Concedcion is a 42-year-old, married mother of three children, and both want to pay the school fees of their beloved children. Fatima is the first on the left. Concedcion is the second one on the left. Fatima is the second one on the right, and Amelyn is the first one on the right.

loans.use: to pay her children’s increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien, 57, is widowed and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Hien started a food store to sell powdered milk 20 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of milk to sell at her store to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy powdered milk to sell from her store.

loans.name: Cesar Geovanny

texts.es:
El  señor  Cesar  de 38 años de edad vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación, se dedica a la venta de elotes cocidos, leña, tamales  y a la crianza de cerdos, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo de manera ambulante.
Don Cesar  es conocido por ser una persona muy luchadora  ya que cada día se transporta en su bicicleta  a vender por las diferentes aldeas y vive  en la aldea del Tular  al sur de Honduras.
Don Cesar  está solicitando  el préstamo  para la  compra de fertilizante y con las ganancias  espera que mejore un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
Su sueño es comprar una motocicleta para transportarse.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del 2014
texts.en:
Sr. Cesar is 38 years old and lives in a house with his wife. He sells cooked corn on the cob, firewood, and tamales. In addition, he raises pigs. His sales are conducted Monday through Sunday as a street vendor.

Don Cesar is known for being a very determined person. Each day he travels on his bicycle so that he can sell in different neighborhoods. He lives in the neighborhood of Tular, which is in southern Honduras.

Don Cesar is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizer. With his earnings, he hopes to improve a little his quality of life and that of his family. His dream is to buy a motorcycle for traveling.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Uulkelsin

texts.ru: Уулкелсин 54 года, замужем, 3 детей. У Уулкелсин среднее образование, с 1997 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 20 овец и 1 лошадь, также есть земельный надел мерою 1,05 ГА, где она выращивает картофель, фасоль и многолетние травы, реализуя свою продукцию оптовым покупателям. Также она продает экологически чистое, вкусное, домашнее молоко, которое пользуется большим спросом. Уулкелсин известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. Она является одним из трех членов группы "Байдоолот".  Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уулкелсин обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойной коровы, для увеличения объемов реализуемого молока. Доходы от кредита Уулкелсин планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Uulkelsin is 54 years old, married and has 3 children. Uulkelsin has a secondary education, and has been involved in agriculture since 1997 in order to provide an additional source of income. Today, she has 2 cows, 20 sheep and 1 horse. She also has 1.05 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes, beans and perennial herbs for sale to wholesale customers. She also sells ecologically clean, delicious, farm-fresh milk that is in high demand. Uulkelsin is known as a principled, honest, decent and reliable person. Uulkelsin is one of the three members of the "Baidoolot" group. In order to further develop her business, Uulkelsin requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 1 dairy cow to increase milk volumes.  Uulkelsin plans to use the earnings from this loan to grow her business and wants to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy 1 dairy cow to increase milk volumes

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret is 64 years old and sells cereals. She is married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with eight children She has been running her business for 34 years and right now her monthly income is KES 40,000.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of cereals for sale. She will also use part of it to pay school fees for her children. She will use the anticipated profits to buy school books and pay school fees for her children.

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Soro

texts.ru:
Соро живет в сельском районе Хуросон. Ей 55 лет. Она по профессии учитель. Ее трудовой стаж в школе составляет 26 лет. Одновременно последние 20 лет Соро занимается животноводством. Ей помогают все члены семьи. Соро живет в районе с мужем, сыном и невесткой. Двое дочерей уже обзаведены семьями и живут отдельно.
Соро берет кредит с целью увеличения поголовья своих скотов. Она хочет расширить бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Soro lives in a rural district of Khuroson. She is 55 years old. She is a teacher by profession. She has 26 years of work experience. Concurrently, Soro has been involved in animal husbandry for the last 20 years. All of her family members help her with the business. Soro lives in her district with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Two of her daughters already have families and live separately. Soro is requesting this loan to increase her livestock headcount. She wants to grow her business and improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. She is 38 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Rommel, her husband, works as a driver. She oversees the operation of their jeepney unit, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

She has one jeepney with a 14-16 person capacity, for which she is paid a boundary* (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 every day. Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippine.

Cecilia is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan assistance to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her Jeepney unit. She will use the profit to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she wants another jeepney unit to be used for their business operation. She hopes that her children will be able to complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the jeepney owner a fixed amount (the boundary) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the boundary, minus what he pays for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Shayimkan

texts.ru: Шайымкан успешно погасила первый кредит, она благодарна всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Она по-прежнему работает в швейном цехе и занимается разведением и продажей скота. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Шайымкан есть 2 коровы, 2 теленка, 10 овец и 1 лошадь. Для содержания скота есть все условия, на зиму заготовлено 200 тюков сена. Шайымкан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку жеребят для увеличения поголовья скота с целью дальнейшей его перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Шайымкан  планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, а также накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Shayimkan successfully repaid her first loan and is grateful to everyone, who has helped her with the financing. She continues to work at a sewing factory and is involved in raising and selling livestock. Today, Shayimkan has 2 cows, 2 calves, 10 sheep and 1 horse. She has all of the necessary conditions for keeping livestock and prepared 200 bales of hay for the winter. Shayimkan requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy foals in order to increase the livestock headcount for future resale. Shayimkan plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further developing her business and saving money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy foals for fattening up and resale in order to develop her business and save money for her son's wedding

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
This is Carmencita, 55, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Dante, a driver, and they have no children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Carmencita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Carmencita dreams of expanding her store. She and her husband only desire to be always happy and contented even if they don't have their own child. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is applying for a loan of 600 USD, to improve her business. She has a kiosk and she is a businesswoman. She is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including eggs, cooking oils, perfume, noodles, candies, soaps, detergents, sugar, salts, slippers and other things to sell.  She started her business in 2011 with a working capital of $200. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin, because she wants to open a big store in the future.  She hopes with this loan she can get a good management for her business and to increase her income in the future.

loans.use: to buy things to sell like eggs, cooking oils, perfume, noodles, candies, soaps, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 29 years old. She is a widow with four children, and she resides in Buhera District, Zimbabwe. Juliana volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches secondary school students life skills. Additionally, Juliana sells products such as shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for two years now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Juliana will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and it will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Sandra Lisseth

texts.es:
Sandra de 24 años de edad, solo estudio hasta 5° grado de educación básica, está acompañada, con su pareja han procreado 3 hijos y todos estudian.

Sandra es ama de casa, pero cuando dejo la escuela se dedicó a trabajar la tierra con sus padre, por lo que hoy ayuda a su esposo con las actividades agrícolas.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizante para los 14,000 mts cuadrados cultivados con su esposo, para que de esta manera se asegurar la cosecha, el alimento de la familia y la posible venta.

Sandra espera que con el esfuerzo de su esposo y el de ella logren dar a sus hijos laoportunidad de estudio que ellos no tuvieron.
texts.en:
Sandra is 24 years old, and only studied until the 5th grade of basic education.  She is in a relationship, and she and her partner have three children, who are all in school.

Sandra is a housewife, but when she left school she worked the land with her parents, which is why she now helps her husband with the farming.

The loan will be used to purchase fertilizer for the 14,000 square meters she farms with her husband.  In this way the harvest and family's food will be ensured, with possible sales from the harvest.

Sandra hopes that with her and her husband's efforts, they will be able to give their children the opportunity of education that they did not have.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Catherine operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers and treatments. She also generates income from selling soft drinks. She operates seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and power shortages. 

Catherine aspires to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers and treatments

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is 58 years old and blessed with five children. Due to the hardship of living, she engages herself in cooking and selling snack foods within her community. She aims to strengthen her business and to make it profitable to generate sufficient income. She plans to cook more snack recipes to sell, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to avail an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy milk, sugar, fruits, bananas, melon, flour, seasonings, etc. that she needs to cook and sell. Being a kind and responsible mother, she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed for her business like milk, sugar, fruits, bananas, melon, flour, etc.

location.town: Brgy. Carolotan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Liliana Elizabeth

texts.en:
The Credit Group "Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio (Women of the New Millennium) reunite every 15 days in the Canton Montecristi, known for their rich pre-colonial culture and for their artisan crafts that are recognized both nationally and internationally. 

Liliana lives here, she is 28 years old, and is in a common law relationship but doesn't have children. She is a recent Civil Engineer graduate and is waiting for a job to put her skills into practice. Liliana is a woman that always likes to get ahead and be independent. She is dedicated to selling American clothing door to door and also out of her house where clients come when the new merchandise arrives. She has been involved with this activity for 1 year. 

This loan will be used to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. She has spent 3 cycles in this credit group and likes it because the loans are very fast. Her dream is to use her Civil Engineering degree.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, shirts and children's clothes for her business.

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.ru: Элеонора успешно погасила кредит, она очень благодарна всем, кто помог ей в финансировании, Элеонора закупила скот и развила свою деятельность. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Элеоноры есть 3 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 30 овец и 3 лошади. Также на своем земельном наделе Элеонора посадила картофель и зерновые культуры для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализацию. Элеонора продает молоко местным жителям, вкусное и экологичное, оно пользуется большим спросом.  Для содержания скота есть все условия, однако Элеоноре нужно скосить сено, для заготовки корма на зиму, поэтому она и обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 12,000 сом (KGS) на покос сена. Доходы от кредита Элеонора планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, а также накопить средства на покупку машины для сына.
texts.en: Eleonora successfully repaid her last loan and is grateful to everyone, who has helped her with the financing. Eleonora bought livestock and grew her business. Today, she has 3 dairy cows,1 calf, 30 sheep and 3 horses. Eleonora also planted potatoes and cereal crops on her land for internal consumption and resale. Eleonora sells ecologically clean and delicious milk to local residents. The milk is in very high demand. She has all of the necessary conditions for keeping livestock, but Eleonora needs to cut hay to prepare feed for the winter, and this is why Eleonora requested a loan in the amount of 12,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to cut hay. Eleonora plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further developing her business and saving money to buy a car for her son.

loans.use: to cut hay in order to prepare livestock feed for the winter

loans.name: Erkingul

texts.ru: Эркингул 43 года, вдова, есть сын. У Эркингул среднее образование, 22 года назад начала заниматься заниматься сельским хозяйством, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было всего 12,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве Эркингул есть 1 дойная корова, 15 овец, 1 бычок, полученное молоко она реализует местным жителям, так как молоко экологически чистое и вкусное, оно пользуется большим спросом. Также у Эркингул есть земельный надел мерою 2,60 ГА, где она выращивает зерновые культуры для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 7,000 сомов (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает для содержания ее семьи, поэтому Эркингул берется за любую работу, сейчас она хочет купить нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота и объемов реализации молока в будущем. Эркингул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS), на который она и купит 2 нетелей. Доходы от кредита позволят Эркингул увеличить ее доходы и материальное состояние семьи.
texts.en: Erkingul is 43, widowed, and has one son. She has a high school education and started a farm 22 years ago with 12,000 som (KGS) of startup capital. She currently has one dairy cow, 15 sheep, and one young bull. She sells milk to local residents because there is high demand for delicious organic milk. Erkingul also has a 2.60 hectare plot of land where she grows crops to sell and use at home. She earns about 7,000 som (KGS) per month, which is not enough to support her family. She will do any job, and she currently wants to buy heifers to increase her livestock headcount and sell more milk in the future. Erkingul applied for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank in order to buy two heifers. She plans to use her profits to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase two heifers in order to increase her family's income

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy food and drinks to sell from her stall. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and drinks to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar, whose loan request was already financed by Kiva lenders, now is requesting financial support for expanding her agribusiness. This hardworking woman uses much effort to make financial stability for her family, and has a great desire to do much for their welfare. Her project is profitable, but it needs the support for further development. She has requested a loan of 3,200 GEL to set up a greenhouse and expand the variety of the products that she sells at the local market.  She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  

As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will significantly increase. Tamar will be grateful for the help and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: to set up a greenhouse and expand her agribusiness.

loans.name: Kurinjipoo Shg - Thirupurapiyam Group

texts.en:
A group of seventeen women formed Kurinjipoo Self-Help Group in Thirupurapiyam, a tiny village in Tanjore, Tamil Nadu.
