Most of their fellow villagers, including these 17 women, work during the days as laborers in nearby industries and farms, and some of them have their own livelihood. They make just enough money to return home in the evenings and feed themselves and be able to repeat the same thing all over again the next day. It is hard for the women, who also attend to the myriad domestic chores, such as cleaning and washing and cooking. Apart from the physical exertion, it is the lack of respite from the dust and smoke, at work and at home, that takes a toll and makes them susceptible to health hazards. Lung diseases are extremely common.

PAT (Micrograam’s partner) works to address part of the problem. They promote clean, energy-efficient cooking stoves, so that, at least while cooking, the women’s exposure to soot and smoke is minimized. The stoves use dung, agro-waste, etc. as fuel and therefore have low CO2 emissions. They are also very cheap to run and help save significant amounts of money. So, Nalina the featured borrower, and her group have decided to buy these stoves. They are all married and most have young kids. They know it is imperative that they offer their kids as healthy a life as possible, so they can grow up and extricate their families from the poverty spiral they are trapped in. They do not have enough money to buy these stoves outright. They seek to borrow the requisite amount and repay it back within the time.

loans.use: to buy smokeless stoves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to upgrade and improve her premises.

loans.name: Orfelinda

texts.es:
Orfelinda tiene 44 años de edad, vive sola, dedicada a la agricultura cultivando café de la variedad Catimor, esta actividad la desarrolla hace más de 10 años en el caserio de Vista Alegre, su domicilio esta ubicado en el distrito de Callayuc, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Orfelinda se dedica al Cultivo de café, hace 10 años en el Caserio Pampa Grande. Ella desea el crédito para invertir en las labores agrícolas, de mantenimiento en su cultivo de café, en las compra de abonos, pago de peones; y poder obtener una buena cosecha en el 2015. Ella posee conocimiento en el negocio por lo cual será una gran inversión.
texts.en:
Orfelinda is 44 years old and lives alone. She makes a living working in agriculture, growing coffee of the Catimor variety. She has been following this occupation in the Vista Alegre hamlet for over 10 years. Her home is in the Callayuc district, which is in the province of Cutervo and region of Cajamarca, in the northern highlands of Peru.

For the past 10 years, Orfelinda has been growing coffee in the Pampa Grande hamlet. She is requesting a loan to invest in the maintenance of her coffee crop, to purchase inorganic fertilizer, and to pay for farming labour, in order to get a good harvest for 2015. She is knowledgeable about the business, so it will be a great investment.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of her coffee crop, to purchase inorganic fertilizer, and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en:
Arcely lives in Amulung. She is 54 years old, widowed and had four children. She is managing a store for income. 

In her retail store, she sells rice, hog feed and grocery items. She manages her business well, and ensures that she offers good products and services to all her customers. Arcely wants to develop her sales, which is why she is asking for PHP 25,000 to buy cases of soft drinks, sacks of rice, canned goods, sugar and noodles to sell.

In the future, she hopes to keep earning good profits to save for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks, sacks of rice, canned goods, sugar and noodles to sell

loans.name: Tung

texts.en: Tung is requesting a new loan to buy a new sewing machine. Tung's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers, and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to make shoes.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy breads and dumplings to sell. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy bread and dumplings to sell

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en: Muoi is requesting a new loan to buy good quality food for selling. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality food for selling.

loans.name: Karina

texts.en: Karina is a single mother and has worked as an instructor for eight years now. She recently visited the doctor to get a vision exam since her family has a history of eye related problems. At the eye exam, she realized she was having difficulty seeing objects from a far distance. Due to financial reasons she was unable to get the surgery performed in the past. She is requesting a loan to get an eye surgery.

loans.use: to have eye surgery.

loans.name: Alan

texts.en: Alan is single and currently lives with his family. He has been working in a construction company for a few years now. His dad is now retired and he is helping his parents financially. His father has developed vision problems and Alan decided to take him to get a vision exam. While in the eye exam, they found out he had an eye retina problem and an emergency procedure had to be performed. The loan will help him pay for his dad's surgery.

loans.use: to pay for his father's eye surgery.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco Javier is married and lives with his wife and children. He has been working for a manufacturing company for a few years now. He started to develop vision problems and it got to the point where it started to affect his job duties and was therefore disabled for some time. He is requesting a loan to get an eye surgery. He currently helps his parents financially and for this reason had been unable to get the surgery done.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery.

loans.name: Lucrecia Clemencia

texts.es:
Lucrecia de 53 años de edad, madre soltera, con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad , originaria de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Esta madre luchadora se caracteriza por su tenacidad, positivismo, ganas de luchar por la vida y brindarles a sus hijos principalmente estabilidad económica, sus estudios, porque quiere formar hombres de bien para la sociedad. 
Gracias a  su perseverancia tiene por actividad económica la venta de comida casera, en  su casa de habitación, esta señora dedica unas doce horas diarias realizando su trabajo, desde la preparación de la misma hasta la venta , desde muy temprano empieza su día de trabajo para que sea productivo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de productos comestibles para la preparación de los diferentes plastos como: arroz, carne roja, pollo, plátanos, cebollas, chiltomas, arina, aceite, tomates, platos descartables,basos descartables, cubiertos, gaseosas, jugos, etc. En la foto muestra parte del material que necesita para vender su comida. Con el propósito de que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Lucrecia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, porque a través de esta ayuda se obtiene un trabajo digno para muchos Nicaragüenses.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is 53 years old and a single mother with two sons she is responsible for. She is a native of Leon, a place located in the western part of the country.  This courageous mother is characterized by her tenacity, positivism and desire to fight for a good life and to give her sons economic stability and an education because she wants to produce men who are good for society.

Thanks to her perseverance she has a business selling homemade food in her home. This lady spends about twelve hours a day working, from preparing the food to selling it. She starts her work day very early so that she can be productive. 

The loan’s objective is to invest in working capital and to supply her business with food to prepare her different dishes. She will buy items such as rice, red meat, chicken, bananas, onions, green peppers, flour, oil, tomatoes, disposable plates, disposable cups, cutlery, soft drinks, juices, etc. In the photo she is showing some of the products she needs to sell her meals. Her goal is to earn more income in the not too distant future.

Lucrecia is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, because through this help many Nicaraguans find decent work.

loans.use: to buy food such as rice, red meat, chicken, bananas, onions, green peppers, flour, oil, tomatoes, soft drinks, juices, etc.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 31 years old, married and blessed with five children. He sells soft drinks, biscuits, sweets and bottled water and has been running this business for two years.

He will use this loan to buy more soft drinks and bottled water to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya and he repaid his previous loan successfully. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks and bottled water.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина, 32 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. На протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. У Мадины высшее образование, она работает преподавателем в местной школе. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья. Мадина достигла больших успехов в своем бизнесе. В хозяйстве имеет 3 дойные коровы, 5 овец и 2 лошади, наличие дойных коров позволяет Мадине продавать молоко среди местных жителей и оптовых покупателей. Также есть земельный надел, 0,85 ГА собственной и 2,50 ГА арендованной земли, где она выращивает картофель, зерновые, эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Мадина обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистых коров, что позволит ей увеличить удой экологически чистого, вкусного молока, а соответственно и прибыль от его реализации. На доходы от кредита Мадина хочет расширить свое хозяйство, а также приобрести квартиру в городе.
texts.en: Madina is 32 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 10 years, and is an expert in her business. Madina has a higher education and works as a teacher at a local school. Her entire family helps her with the business. Madina achieved significant results in her business. She has 3 dairy cows, 5 sheep, and 2 horses. Having dairy cows allow Madina to sell milk to local residents and wholesale buyers. She also has 0.85 hectares of owned and 2.50 hectares of leased land, where she grows potatoes, cereal crops and sainfoin for internal consumption and sale. Madina requested a loan in the amount of 90,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy purebred cows, which will allow her to increase the volumes of ecologically clean, delicious milk and, thus, profits from its sales. Madina plans to use the earnings from the loan to expand her business and also to buy an apartment in the city.

loans.use: to buy purebred cows in order to increase milk volumes and income from selling milk

loans.name: Obrad

texts.en:
The borrower, Obrad, is 31 years old and comes from one of the minority communities in Kosovo. He is married and has two children ages 6 and 8 years old. 

While he is employed as a guard in a local primary school, Obrad is also involved in agriculture in order to add extra income to his family. He really enjoys and is grateful for the opportunity he has to work on his land, planting wheat and corn. He has been able to sell his harvest for profit each season and provide better living conditions for his family than with just his salary alone. 

For the first time, Obrad is requesting a loan in order to purchase guano and repair his tractor. It has become very worn and damaged over the years and he has not had enough income to be able to make the necessary repairs. He is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders. He promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To purchase guano and repair his tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Jorge is married and lives currently with his family. He works for a bus driving company. He is currently responsible for his mother because of her age and he worries about her well being. With age, she has developed a vision problem that is preventing her from daily duties. Jorge is supporting her financially because she does not have the resources to pay for the surgery by herself. A loan helps him pay for his mother's surgery.

loans.use: to pay for his mother's eye surgery.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, a 64-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has five children. She runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Dung requests a loan to purchase more products, such as rices, candies, and soft drinks to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as rices, candies, and soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Imrane

texts.en: Imrane is the mother of 4 children at 23 years old. She comes from an Ashkali community and, as with most of the women there, she stays home to take care of the house and the children while her husband works. He transports goods and materials for others, making a small salary, keeping them in poor living conditions as his son is very ill and they can not manage to pay for all of their needs, his medical attention and improve their conditions. Most often, this situation makes Imrane feel depressed and frustrated because her husband works hard for them. Imrane is requesting a loan in order to purchase wood for heating because the wood is at a cheaper cost when purchased before the winter season, and to purchase a stove. She knows that the heat in the winter will help her son and his illness and she will also use some of the money for his medications. Imrane sees this opportunity as a way to help her son and improve their conditions overall. She knows that without the help of the lenders, she would never be able to help her son and family. She is very thankful for the support.

loans.use: To purchase wood for heating and a stove

loans.name: Afrime

texts.en: Afrime is an Ashkali woman who is the mother of seven children. Her husband is a musician and she works for a private company. Their salaries are both very low and they live in poor conditions without the chance to improve things around them. As her husband mainly works in the summer and spring seasons, they have to budget his salary through the entire year for all of their needs. It’s a difficult task to be able to provide for their large family and save any money. Now, Afrime is requesting a loan to add an annex to their home. This will allow their large family to have extra space and comfort and the children to have a needed area for school study. Afrime is very happy for the support from the lenders.

loans.use: To add an annex to their home

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, appearing in the photo, is married and blessed with two children. She is thirty-five years old and works hard to support her family. She is a member of Kuibanga Women Group in Limuru Kenya. In 2014 she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from training on savings, entrepreneurship, and financial management.

She is a vegetable farmer and also practices dairy farming. Eunice is taking the loan to purchase hybrid seed and hire an extra plot for her farming activities as she has a good number of customers and the demand for vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbages and spinach is very high.  She hopes that her business will thrive, hence go a long way in  supporting  her family and improving her living standard by providing good shelter and clothing for the kids. 

Eunice is very happy with Kiva and their lenders for this great support.

loans.use: To  buy hybrid seeds to plant and hire an additional farming plot.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 34-year-old married father of three. Six years ago, he started working as taxi driver to provide his family with better living conditions and to cover their needs and expenses.
Mohammad is trying hard but he is still suffering from a limited monthly income. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay the school tuition fees of his beloved children to make sure that they can benefit from the best education for a brighter future.

loans.use: To pay the school tuition fees of his beloved children

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline, 33, is a mother of one child and has been doing mixed-farming for four years. She lives with her family on her small farm in Thika, Kenya. Her primary income source is bananas. She also keeps a dairy cow to provide milk for her infant daughter. 
Bananas were making her money until recently when the prices dropped in the market. Ever since, the prices have not been stable. Banana farmers are not recouping any money they invested in the farm inputs. Pauline learned a lesson and decided to diversify as she waits for the market conditions to improve. She is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase poultry. 
With the loan, the poultry acquired will provide Pauline with an additional stream of income. The eggs produced will be sold to neighbors and at the local market for profit. This investment will cushion Paulina from risks associated with dealing with only a single product in the market. 
Income generated from the poultry farm will enable Pauline to pay off her loan obligation, pay child-related expenses and to keep improving the quality of life she is leading.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсаре 51 год, вдова, мать 2 детей. Дети взрослые и помогают матери по хозяйству. По характеру Гулсара очень добрая, веселая, трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Имеет развитое хозяйство, а именно 10 овец и 2 коровы, а также арендует земельный надел мерою 0,5 ГА, где она выращивает рис. Гулсара получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 3,000 сом (KGS). Безусловно это катастрофически мало для жизни, но несмотря ни на что Гулсара не унывает и хочет развить свой бизнес. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Гулсара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также она мечтает устроить достойную свадьбу ее сыну.
texts.en: Gulsara is 51 years old, a widow and a mother of 2 children, both of whom are grown and help their mother. Gulsara is a very kind, happy, hardworking and goal-oriented woman. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry. She has a well-developed business with 10 sheep and 2 cows. She also leases a 0.5 hectare land plot, where she grows rice. Gulsara earns a monthly profit of about 3,000 som (KGS). Clearly, this amount is catastrophically small for living, but, despite all this, Gulsara does not despair and wants to grow her business. This is why she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock. Gulsara plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business and also dreams of organizing a decent wedding for her son.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to grow her business

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
Leona is a 20-year-old businesswoman from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer at the local secondary school and she runs her own business. Leona rents a table at a flea market where she sells bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  
With the Kiva loan, Leona will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and it will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs. Leona also hopes to go back to school.

loans.use: To increase her clothing stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy quality seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing

loans.name: Mbeneke

texts.en: This is Mbeneke. She is a small scale irrigation farmer in Matuu, Kenya, where she cultivates french beans and cowpeas. Her husband died five years ago and she was left to take care for her seven children alone. She has managed to educate only two of her seven children up to high school, with a lot of difficulties. A loan from Kiva will help Mbeneke raise income from the farm to support her family and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional small land for raising harvest.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives at a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a fruits and vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to towndwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Aurora Eugenia

texts.es:
Aurora Eugenia de  47 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales estudian, son originarios de Leo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente el país, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, a pesar de todas las adversidades  sigue luchando para poder mantener su negocio, hacer cada día mas rentable, y cumplir sus metas personales, como formar  a sus hijos en profesionales, y brindarles estabilidad en todos los sentidos.
Gracias a su perseverancia y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica una librería, actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación. El negocio lo tiene surtido con material como: cuadernos lápices, cartaluninas, fastener, folder, resma de papel, tarjetas, lapiceros, bolsas de regalos, etc.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir con productos producto su librería, para mantener la demanda de la clientela, y que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Aurora agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Aurora Eugenia is 47 years old, married, and has two young children who are in school. They are from Leo which is located in the western part of the country. She is a responsible, hard worker with a strong desire for self-improvement. In spite of the adversity she faces, she continues to struggle to be able to maintain her business and to make it more profitable every day. She also is trying to meet personal goals such as to have her children be trained to become professionals and offer them stability in every sense. 

Thanks to her perseverance and her desire to get ahead, she has a stationery store which she runs out of her house. She stocks the business with items such as notebooks, pencils, construction paper, fasteners, folders, reams of paper, cards, pens, gift bags, etc. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock up her store so she can keep up with her customers' demand and increase her income. 

Aurora is grateful for the help that Kiva investors give to people of scarce financial resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can do dignified work.

loans.use: to supply her stationery store with products such as notebooks, pencils, construction paper, fasteners, folders, reams of paper, cards, pens, gift bags, etc.

loans.name: Vahide

texts.en: Vahide, 53, is the mother of five children. She is from an Ashkali community in Kosovo, where most of the women stay home to care for the house and kids. Her husband works for an electric company, but his salary is low. They live in very poor conditions -- common for their area -- and struggle to meet their daily needs. For the first time, Vahide is asking for a loan in order to purchase wood for the upcoming winter season. The wood is typically cheaper to purchase pre-season and they will be able to purchase more now than they can later. The wood will provide much heat in the winter and decrease their utility costs as well. She would also like to use some of the money to renovate one of their rooms ,which is in very bad condition. She appreciates this support and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase wood for the upcoming winter season.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is married with five children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open-air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Iris Estela

texts.es:
Iris de 33 años de edad,  estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica, está acompañada y con su pareja a procreado 2 hijos de 5 años de edad y 15 años de edad. Tres personas son las que viven con ella.

Iris es ama de casa, pero también trabaja en las labores agrícolas con su pareja, todos los días se levanta a las 4:00 am para empezar el día y luego ir a trabajar la tierra, por las tardes ordeñan las vacas, con la leche elaboran queso que después lo venden entre sus vecinos y en zonas cercanas.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una vaca lechera, con ello espera aumentar la producción de leche y así mismo la del queso, para tener mayor cantidad de producto a ofrecer.

Iris espera tener buenos resultados, ahorrar los suficiente para comprar un terreno en donde tener a sus animales.
texts.en:
Iris, 33 years old, attended school until the sixth grade. She has a partner with whom she has two children, who are 5 and 15 years old. Thus, three people live with her.

Iris is a housewife but she also does agricultural work with her partner. She gets up every day at 4 a.m. to begin her day and then goes to work the land. In the afternoons she milks the cows and makes cheese from the milk that she afterwards sells to neighbors in nearby areas.

She will use the loan to purchase a milk cow.  With it she hopes to increase milk production and consequently that of cheese so that she can have a larger number of products to offer.

Iris expects to earn a good profit and to save enough to purchase land where she can keep her animals.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Mandarina Group 2

texts.en:
When Rosa was 17 years old she got into an informal permanent union, she lived with her partner until he died in a soccer game, fourteen months ago. Currently Rosa is 22 years old and has a daughter.

She has a commodity store, she considers that her business is essential because it is what allows satisfy her needs and those of her daughter. The loan that Rosa received is of Q 7,200, she will invest it in expanding her store, and  will buy and sell vegetables and commodities. She expects to receive a monthly income of Q 900.

Rosa is the leader of Mandarina 2 Group, and she is the one raising her hand on the picture. Her group is made of 9 women (6 of whom are named Rosa!) who will invest their loans in commercial and agricultural activities. All the women are from the Ixil Maya ethnicity. In average each member of the group has 4 children. The average of their loans is Q 3,711.11.

loans.use: to expand her store by buying and selling vegetables

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 22 años y vive en Parcona junto a su familia. Tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, es el mejor regalo que tiene y por él se esfuerza día a día porque no quiere que pase necesidades. Trabaja como Obrero de construcción y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y porque trabaja muy duro para poder obtener buenos resultados.
Luis está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un juego de dormitorio para su hijo, con esto mejorará su calidad de vida, podrá tener mayor comodidad y Luis continuará con su labor porque más adelante quiere convertirse en un Maestro de Obras.
texts.en:
Luis is a young man eager to get ahead. He is 22 years old and lives in Parcona with his family. He has a two-year-old son—the best gift he could ever have—and for him he works hard every day because he wants him to have everything he needs. 

He makes a living as a construction worker, and he believes that he is doing well because of his good performance and because he works very hard to obtain good results.

Luis is thankful to Kiva lenders because with their support, he will be able to purchase a bedroom set for his son. With the bedroom set, his son will be more comfortable, and his quality of life will improve. 

Luis will continue working because he wants to become a Master Builder in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a bedroom set for his son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a responsible housewife who engages in cooking and selling snack foods, meals and grocery items within her village. She is 56 years old and blessed with six children. Due to financial insufficiency, she would like to strengthen her business to earn sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to access a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy rice, vegetables, fish balls, frozen foods, soft drinks and more grocery items to resell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, fish balls, frozen foods, soft drinks and more grocery items to resell

location.town: Brgy. Carolotan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nelly Lorena

texts.es:
Nelly es una joven emprendedora y que ha tenido la iniciativa de comenzar su negocio de venta de calzados para damas y caballeros para poder apoyar a su familia y así sacarlos adelante, ella cree que le va bien en el negocio por su dedicación, trabaja más de 10 horas diarias, a su corta edad tiene claro lo que quiere lograr más adelante.
Nelly está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar más calzados para poder incrementar sus ventas, así mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y continuará esforzándose para formar una gran empresa.
texts.en:
Nelly is a young entrepreneur who took the initiative to start a business selling shoes for men and women to support her family and help them get ahead.

She thinks that her business is doing well due to her dedication; she works ten hours a day. At her young age she has a clear idea of what she wants to achieve in the future.

Nelly is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they provide she will be able to buy more shoes, thus increasing her sales. This will improve her family's quality of life and she will continue to work hard to create a large company.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her business.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 27-year-old married man and a father of three children. His oldest child is 13 years old and the youngest one is 5 years old, living with his family in Sana'a City, Yemen. He works in his pharmacy. He has a  diploma certificate of pharmacy. Now, he is a pharmacist. 

Saleh started his business one year ago. He started his own business with a small amount of money through purchasing a taxi to work as a driver to transport people to earn enough money to open the pharmacy. Soon, he accumulated a good amount of money and purchased a bus and worked on it as a driver to transport people from one station to another. From that bus, Saleh was able to accumulate a good amount of money and opened his own business which is a small pharmacy in the capital city of Sana'a. 

In reality, Saleh is a very active and dynamic young man. He knows how to run his business well. Now he has a good experience in his business. The patients and his neighbors have good things to say about him. They describe him as a kind, honest and a hardworking man. Due to that good reputation, Saleh has very many customers, so he wants to enlarge his business more. Unfortunately, his capital is still low. 

For this reason, Saleh applied for a loan of 2,500,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase different kinds of medicines and medical equipment for his pharmacy in order to be able to meet all the needs of the customers. 

Saleh looks forward to improving his business and expanding it more, as well as opening another branch besides the first one.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of medicines and medical equipment for his pharmacy

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a 30-year-old married mother of one child. Seven years ago she started to work as a secretary in a clinic to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Pascal is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay the school fees of her beloved child. She hopes to open a clothes shop in the future in order to save some profit for her beloved family and develop their living.

loans.use: To pay the school fees of her beloved child.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel, is aged 47, married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 22 years and earns a net income of PHP 1,500 daily. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their food expenses and school allowances of their children. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase canned goods, milk, noodles, biscuits, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, milk, noodles, biscuits, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres sells retail goods and has been in this business for five years now. She is 58 years old, is widowed and has six children. Right now her monthly income is 10,000 KES.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of goods such as tissue paper, matchboxes and bottled water. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. Her future hope is to have a stable business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 29-year-old man married to Elizabeth, who adds additional income to support their family's welfare. They are blessed with one child. Moses has been operating a shoe shop for a period of ten years, earning an income of 15,000 KES at the end of every month.

Moses was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now taking out his first loan of 20,000 KES. He intends to use this amount to buy ladies' shoes, men's shoes and children's shoes to sell to his customers on a daily basis.

Moses plans to use the anticipated income to buy his own plot and to build a permanent house for his family and hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy ladies' shoes, men's shoes and children's shoes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Anie

texts.en:
Anie is married, and she helped her husband manage their own farm for a living. He earns better income from their banana farm so that she was able to sustain their needs. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for farming. 

Aside from this, the couple has a fishing business that earns better income for the family, too. While waiting for their farm, her husband goes fishing to earn for their daily expenditures. Recently, Anie took a new loan to purchase new fishing nets. 

She wants to send her children to school to have a better education and hopes that someday in the future, her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
HELLO LENDERS! Meet Rose, 27 years of age. She is very ambitious, enterprising and a go-getting woman who hails from Kisii area of Kenya. She is a proud mother of five, and has been doing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income are egg selling, crop selling, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet. 

Rose loves farming and has even nicknamed her cow “Otiso” (from a person’s name) and she really takes good care of her dairy cows. The Kisii area has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming that is good soils, good climate, a good transport system and a ready market for horticulture products. Rose wants to take advantage and start horticultural farming. 

She is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming, and through her improved income she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. The financial benefits that Rose will reap are almost immediate, and hence she will be assured of a secure future. Her proximity to an air strip is an added advantage because she plans to start exporting her horticulture to international markets once she has accumulated more profits. Rose patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Anitah

texts.en:
Anitah, 25, is a nice, dark, young, Kisii girl who practises mixed-farming in Bagusero village in Kisii area of Kenya. She keeps dairy cattle and grows crops. The mother of 2 has made a living doing this work for 4 years. Her primary income sources are milk, crops and income from side hustles. 

Anita is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The additional cow will grow her asset base and increase her income through milk production. The cow will also help in utilization of the space and pasture available. 

Anita loves cows. In an interview with our loan officer, she stated, "Cows give my family income. The biggest challenge is that it takes a lot of input and time to manage my work." 

Anita joined Juhudi with aspirations to succeed in life. She joined through a group called Bomegota. Bomegota group was taken through a 2 month training to qualify for a loan. After being trained, Anita said, "Juhudi really transforms lives of people and trains farmers on how to improve production."
She plans to spend the increase in income on her children's school fees. When asked how her family will benefit from the loan investment, she replied, "To add another cow so that will supply milk to schools nearby and to my family."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam operates a retail business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She appreciates the support of previous loans, which helped her to sustain her business. 

Mariam is requesting 50,000 KES to boost her kiosk by purchasing wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира успешно погасила свой кредит без просрочек и задолженностей, она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Полученные средства Гулмира вложила в развитие ее бизнеса. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 3 коровы и 0,20 ГА собственной земли, где Гулмира выращивает клевер. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса Гулмира  обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, а также Гулмира откладывает деньги на образование своих детей, старший сын уже учится в университете, а младшая дочь пока школьница, но тоже планирует поступить в институт.
texts.en: Gulmira successfully repaid her last loan without delays and skipped payments and is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who has helped her with the financing. Gulmira invested the loan into developing her buisness. Today, she has 3 cows and 0.20 hectares of owned land, where she grows clover. In order to further grow her business, Gulmira requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy calves. Gulmira plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further developing her business and saving money for her children's education. Her oldest son already attends a university, and the youngest daughter is still a school student, but also plans to apply to a university.

loans.use: to buy calves in order to grow her business and pay for her children's education

loans.name: Rifadije

texts.en:
Rifadije want to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan which she used for building materials, doors and windows to finish the renovation so they can have more space for the children and a pleasant place for studying. 

She is very grateful but she is still in need of another loan because the materials were very expensive and she could not finish her repairs. She is requesting another loan for the same purpose. She is very happy to have this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for this support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to renovate the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock - such as groceries, grains, fizzy drinks, fried snacks and other consumable goods - to stock up her business.

loans.name: Misael Antonio

texts.es:
Misael de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica, esta acompañado y no tiene hijos, su pareja es ama de casa pero también cría aves de corral.

Misael tiene 4 años de experiencia en el manejo del ganado de engorde en repasto, decidió dedicase a esta actividad debido a que no encontraba empleo y vio en el ganado una oportunidad para ganarse la vida. Para ello todos los días pastorea a sus animales en terrenos que alquila

el préstamo será utilizado para comprar 2 novillos de engorde, para que despues de engordarlos venderlos a buen precio y generar ingresos económicos para la familia.

Misael tiene como meta comprar un terreno para tener a sus animales y así no tener que estar alquilando ya que le eso genera costos.
texts.en:
Misael, 45, attended primary school until the 6th grade. He lives with his partner, and he has no children. His partner is a housewife, but she also raises poultry. 

Misael has four years’ experience with raising and fattening grazing cattle. He decided on this occupation because he couldn’t find work, and he saw an opportunity to earn a living by raising cattle. To do this, he grazes his cattle every day on pastures that he rents.

The loan will be used to purchase  two steers, in order to fatten them and sell them afterwards at a good price. In this way, he will generate income for the family.

Misael’s goal is to purchase a pasture for his animals so that he won’t have to rent, as that generates costs.

loans.use: to purchase two steers to fatten.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her potato crops.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 28-year-old woman married to Anthony who adds additional income to support their family welfare and they are blessed with two children. Esther has been operating a grocery shop for a period of four years earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Esther was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES 15,000 and intends to use this amount to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions, vegetables and carrots to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Esther plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to pay for her family to have a successful life.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions, vegetables and carrots to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is married, with two children. She has settled in Bunawan, Calamba, with her family. Mercedita owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She earns better income from her farm and had repaid successfully her previous loan, which was used for farm chemicals. She wants a greener farm to increase her income. For this reason, she is taking out a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure in order to restore farm nutrients. In the future, she plans to renovate her house for better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Erkinai

texts.ru: Эркинай 32 года, замужем, мать малолетних 3 детей. У Эркинай среднее образование, много лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 3 дойные коровы и 1 бычок, 10 овец, также земельный надел мерою 1,00 ГА, которую Эркинай сдает в аренду. Супруг с радостью помогает Эркинай в ведении ее бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота, однако на зиму нужно заготовить корм для скота, поэтому Эркинай и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена и корма для скота, часть средств она потратит на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Эркинай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет приобрести сельхоз технику.
texts.en: Erkinai is 32 years old, married and a mother of 3 small children. Erkinai has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for many years. She has 3 dairy cows, 1 bull, 10 sheep and a 1 hectare land plot that Erkinai leases out. Her husband gladly helps Erkinai with running the business. She has all of the conditions for keeping the livestock, but needs to prepare livestock feed for the winter. This is why Erkinai requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy hay and livestock feed and use some of the money to increase livestock headcount. Erkinai plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount and wants to buy agricultural machinery.

loans.use: to buy hay and livestock feed and an additional cow

loans.name: Samayapurathal Shg - Thirupurapiyam Group

texts.en:
Sangeetha (the featured borrower who is standing with her hand raised) and six of her friends, Banumathi, Rani, Shantha, IILamandavi, Abirami and Anjalai, have formed a group called ‘Samayapurathal’. All hail from Thirupurapiyam village of Tanjore in Tamil Nadu. Most of them are daily-wage labourers and help supplement their household income. 

These diligent women are unable to save money from their monthly income. A major chunk of their income goes towards buying firewood or kerosene, and a lot of their time is spent cooking over traditional ‘chulha’ stoves. These chulhas, apart from being time-consuming, also emit a lot of smoke, which plays havoc with their health. This adds to their medical expenses.  

Hence, to tackle these problems, they have approached PAT (MicroGraam’s field partner) to buy Greenway cookstoves. The benefits of the Greenway cookstove are that: it leads to fuel savings, uses all solid fuels, minimizes emissions of CO and CO2, supports fast and convenient cooking, is highly durable, and is maintenance-free and smokeless. The stove operates on all solid fuels, such as wood, agro-waste, charcoal, coal and dry dung, and does not require any refurbishing or recurring cost. 

Hence, they are seeking a group loan repayable in easy installments. They intend to use the loan to purchase Greenway cookstoves. Your loan will help these women to have better health and also save a little more money.

loans.use: to purchase a sustainable cookstove.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married, with two school-going children. They live in their own house, which has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a business selling khangas (women's wrap cloths), selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (women's wraps) for resale

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 22 years old and runs a retail shop in Kisumu town. He is married and together with his spouse he has been blessed with one child. He has been in this business for 2 years now and it has been profitable. Right now he makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

He will be using this loan to buy more stock of goods to sell. These include sugar, flour, rice, and cooking oil. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In the future, he hopes to have a stable business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials in order to expand her car parking business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in personal products.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María de 33 años de edad,  es casada y con su esposo han procreado 4 hijos de los cuales solo 2 estudian. Es una familia de escasos recursos, su esposo es agricultor de granos básicos pero ocasionalmente lo contratan para realizar trabajos en la comunidad.

María es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de artesanías religiosas, empezó comprándolas para luego venderlas a mejor precio, pero ahora las elabora ella misma.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar materiales para elaborar camandulas y otras artesanias, se acerca la temporada de feria en la zona y es una buena oportunidad para ofrecer el producto, ya que es muy demandado.

Espera su mejorar su negocio y con la ayuda de su esposo ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor vida  de la que ellos gozaron.
texts.en:
Maria, 33, is married and she and her husband have 4 children, 2 of whom are in school.  This is a low-income family.  Maria's husband is a farmer who cultivates staple grains, and he is also occasionally hired to do work in the community.

Maria is a merchant who sells religious handicrafts.  She started buying these to later sell at a better price, but now she makes them herself.

Maria will use this loan to buy materials to make rosaries and other crafts.  The fair season is approaching in her area, and this is a good opportunity to offer her products for sale, as they are in high demand.

Maria hopes that her business will improve, so that with the help of her husband, she can offer her children a better life than the one they had.

loans.use: to buy yarn and plastic decorative items to make crafts

loans.name: Vun's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Kampong Cham province, Vun is 52 years old and a mother of four children, one of whom is in school. To make a living, she grows rice and raises pigs. Moreover, she sells grocery items to earn extra income.
 
This is the seventh loan cycle for Vun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loans. She is now leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her house will have electricity to use.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy biodigesters for resale.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle is married with three children. She operates their own farm to make a living. She has a farm of bananas, where she earns income for their needs. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for farm maintenance. 

Aside from her banana farm, she cultivates flowers and sells them in the market. She had a better income from this activity and wants to improve it. She took a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizer in order to boost her farm. 

She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Joan Group

texts.en:
Emily is the featured borrower of Joan group. She came from Philippines to Lebanon with her other group members to work as housekeepers in order to improve the poor living conditions of their beloved families. They got together to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been friends since they arrived to Lebanon, as they are working hard to develop their living.

Emily is a 32-year-old single mother of one daughter. She left her hometown in an attempt to improve the poor living conditions of her daughter there, and satisfy her beloved daughter with a better living. She wants to pay her daughter’s increasing school tuition fees. Her loan will be invested in paying for her daughter's school tuition fees. 

With respect to the other group members, Joann (second from the left), Jinky (second from the right) and Pilar (the first from the right) are going to send the acquired loan to their beloved families back in the Philippines to cover their increasing living needs.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi appreciates the support of the previous loan, which helped her to stock her spare parts business.

Here again she comes to you requesting another loan of KES 30,000 to buy motorcycle spare parts for sale. She says thanks to Yehu and Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for sale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 60, is a father of four who practices small-scale farming in Mutati village, which is near Thika town in Central Kenya. In Thika, there is a presence of a large-scale pineapple production in farms sustained through irrigation. The area experiences long dry spells annually.

James has been a farmer in this area for 10 years. He has made a living selling fruits and crops from his farm. He says the highlight of his activities is when he makes ‘good sales’. James strives to increase his productivity and profitability. Lack of money to acquire better tools and machines has been his main challenge.

James is seeking a loan to purchase a water pump. The water pump will make his work at the farm very efficient. With the machine, he will use little fuel to pump large quantities of water uphill for irrigation of his crops and for domestic use.

With your loan, James will be able to keep the crops green and healthy throughout the year. This will ensure abundant harvest at the end of the season. Good yields will enable him to cater for the next season’s farming expenses. His family stands to benefit from the machine too because they will not have to use a lot of time and energy fetching water at the stream and transporting it home.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Jereen

texts.en: Jereen, 27 and the mother of two, has been running a general store for over three years to make a living. Her husband operates their own farm, their main source of income. Her store helps her with their daily needs. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. The couple is determined to save for the future education of their children. In the future, she wants to expand her business as well as hopes to have a greener farm to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Uno de los negocios característicos de Sololá es la crianza de animales de todo tipo. Desde hace 6 años Rosalina de 44 años, quien vive en su comunidad, se dedica a la   crianza de pollos, negocio que genera una satisfactoria ganancia para el beneficio de su familia y para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Ella tiene 9 hijos por quienes lucha cada día los cuatro primeros ya son casados y tienen familias apartes y los cinco últimos son estudian en la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.

La actividad que ella realiza es la compra, venta y crianza de pollos en la comunidad donde ella vive, a ella le genera ganancias buenas porque no tiene competencia en dicho negocio y le ayuda a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.

Hace una solicitud de préstamo para la compra de pollos de granja y criollos y como también la compra de concentrado para pollos y así genera más ganancias para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y apoyar a su comunidad en un desarrollo hacia el futuro.
	
Son sus metas para generar más ingresos y el sostenimiento de su familia y seguir en la crianza de pollos y la compra de un molino de nixtamal y que sus hijos sean profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
One of the typical business of Sololá is raising all kinds of animals.  Since she was 6 years old, Rosalina, now 44, who lives in this community, has earned a living raising chickens.  This business has brought in satisfactory earnings for the family's benefit and to improve her children's quality of life.   She has 9 children, and fights for them daily.  The first four children are married and have their own families independently, and the last five study in the school  near their community.

Rosalina's business is purchase, sale and raising chickens in the community where she lives.  She has good earnings for this, knows how to do it, and it helps her to improve her life conditions and those of her family.  

Rosalina is asking for a loan to buy broiler chickens and ones to feed organically, and also concentrated chicken feed.  She will earn more and be able to improve her family's standard of living and support her community in its development for the future.

Her goals are to generate more income and sustain her family and continue raising chickens,  to buy a corn mill, and that her children will be professionals one day.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer, a refrigerator, supplies and ingredients like cream, sugar, milk, and sweeteners.

loans.name: Donald

texts.en: This is Donald. He is farmer and rears dairy cow in Kisumu, Kenya. He is single and was orphaned 7 years ago when he was left with the responsibility of taking care of his siblings. He owns one dairy cow that has been a source of income for him. He hopes to harness adequate resources through hard work and loans, to have more cows that will enable him educate his siblings and further his studies in animal husbandry. A loan from Kiva will help Donald make the first steps towards achieving his dreams of education and sustainability.

loans.use: to purchase one more dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation.

loans.name: Samayapurathal-1 Shg - Thirupurapiyam Group

texts.en:
The “Samayapurathal-1” group of six women is led by Kolanjiyammal. Her group members are on a mission to make a small but important change to their way of living. All are living in Thirupurapiyam village in Tanjore district of Tamil Nadu. Kolanjiyammal is the featured borrower. 

These women use traditional stoves for cooking in their homes. The noxious smoke and particulate matter that emanate from the stove is the primary cause for many respiratory illnesses. Their children often complain of breathlessness, and their husbands’ productive years, not to mention their own, are reduced because of ill health.   

Fortunately for these women, improved design and technology offers an alternative cookstove, which employs an efficient combustion process to reduce the smoke and hazards associated with the traditional cookstoves. These women are requesting a loan to buy this stove. Your contribution to meet their loan target will help them make a wise and necessary investment in a healthy future.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless cookstove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old, married and together with his spouse, blessed with seven children aged between 18 and 2 years old. He has a retail shop which he has been running for nine years now and it has been profitable.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of cooking oil, maize flour, sugar and detergent. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of goods and also pay school fees for his children.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future he hopes to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 28 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 9. She lives in Carles, Iloilo with her family. For the last ten years, she and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business. She is asking for a loan to buy fish net, rope, and fishing weights. Her business profit will enable her to send her children to school and to provide her family with a healthy diet.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be successful in providing her children their education.

loans.use: to buy fish net, rope, and fishing weights

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu operates a coconut-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase seven sacks of coconuts to sell to her clients. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 33-year-old woman married to Benard, who adds additional income to support their family welfare. They are blessed with one child. Lilian has been operating a retail shop stall for a period of seven years, earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Lilian is now servicing her third loan of KES 27,000 with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use this amount to buy sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, and detergents.

Lilian plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her child, and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, and detergents.

loans.name: Ay's Group

texts.en:
Ay is a citizen from the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children. To support her family, she grows rice. She supplements the family’s income by selling grocery items. She has been engaged with her business for 25 years.
 
She is in her fifth cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy solar panels. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy solar panels

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 21 years old and she sells shoes. She has been running this business for three years now and makes a monthly income of KES 3,000. She is married and she has no children.

She will use this loan to buy more shoes for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards. 

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future, she hopes to open a wholesale shop and supply goods to retailers in her town.

loans.use: to buy stock of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Noemie

texts.en:
Noemie is a 27-year-old married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She has four children ages two to nine. For four years now, Noemie and her husband have been engaged in fishing to support their children. She is asking for a loan to buy a new boat and fishing nets. It is her wish that this will pave the way to a more abundant life for her and her family. The income generated will keep her children healthy and in school.

In the future, Noemie dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy a boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline is 35 years old, married and with her spouse is blessed with seven children. She has a food stall from which she sells different kinds of food to her customers. She has been in this business for eight years.

She will use this loan to renovate her food stall by putting up new iron sheets and buying more seats for her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To renovate her food stall.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en: Jonah lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband works on their farm while she operates her own retail store. She is now earning more income from her business and has saved for the education of her two children. To offer more items for sale, she took a new loan recently to purchase more grocery goods. She always finds ways to augment their earnings and works hard on her business to have a sustainable income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo is a 51-year-old married man from the town of Carles, Iloilo.  He supports eight children, ages 6 to 18. Marcelo relies on his fishing business to provide for his family. He has been fishing for 24 years now. He is asking for a loan to buy engine parts and fishing nets. Marcelo is confident that when these will be available, he can better support his family, especially his children's education.

In the future, he hopes to be able to send all his children to school.

loans.use: to buy engine parts and fishing nets

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been running his piggery for more than five years. He earns well for the needs of his only child and the entire family. 

He joined GDMPC to gain access to the micro finance services of the cooperative. Recently, he took out a new loan to buy feeds and additional piglets to raise. 

He wants to make an expansion to his business and dreams to provide his child a better education in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Miraji

texts.en:
Miraji is a married woman with two children, both in school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: “When women come together, they are powerful,” says Jane, a 45-year-old farmer who has eight children and lives in the village of Machoge, in the Kisii area of Kenya. As a girl, she watched women in her village mobilize to replace traditional thatched roofs with waterproof corrugated iron. The memory of this collective effort led her to join Chabumba self-help group that helps enterprising women who have the same vision and goals. Jane has been farming for the past 12 years and through mixed farming, she has been able to take care of her family. She loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows 'Moraa' (from a person's name). Although Jane passionately loves farming, she faces the challenge of water shortages. Most of the rain water goes to waste, which is why she is seeking a loan to buy a water tank. Jane comes from an area where there is no piped water. Therefore this water tank will assist her to harvest water during the rainy seasons and also store water for home consumption. Harvested water will assist Jane to irrigate her farm, ensuring that there is a constant production of crops. Jane spends about six hours a day fetching water for her household. The nearest spring is 2 kilometers away, the water is filled with sediments and the queues are very long. But through your loan she intends to put the water tank just outside her house and she will be spending less than two minutes fetching water. She will used the time saved in turning subsistence farming into profitable small enterprises .All that Jane waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijas en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas y su negocio es muy conocido en su comunidad. 
Doña Erika necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, cal y leña. Los cuales  necesita para seguir elaborando su  producto. Espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia.
 Doña Erika espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  sus hijas continúe con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca,  Honduras –  Agosto  del  2014
texts.en:
Sra. Erika is a hardworking and responsible person who lives with her daughters in a community in southern Honduras. Her business of making and selling tortillas is well-known in her community.

Doña Erika needs a loan in order to buy corn, lime powder, and firewood. These supplies are needed so that she can continue making her product. Thanks to this loan, she will have the necessary supplies for continuing her business and meeting the demand from her customers. In addition, her sales will increase greatly, which will be reflected in her family’s quality of life.

Doña Erika hopes that her business will continue to grow and become the most well-known establishment in the community. This would enable her to continue supporting her family and to help her children continue their studies so that they can have more opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, and firewood for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is earning well from her banana farm and had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming supplies. With her generated revenue, Tessie was able to open a retail store in their village and she earns well from this. 

In order to increase sales, she took out a new loan from GDMPC to purchase more grocery goods and grains to sell. 

Tessie wants to improve the general living condition of her family and hopes to see her children become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods and grains to sell

loans.name: Guler

texts.en:
Guler is a 32-year-old married woman and has a daughter. Her husband is a laborer and earns money for family somehow. Guler earns money for the family selling women's clothing in a small shop at a local bazaar. Her monthly income is 300 AZN but this isn’t enough to cover the life costs of family.

Selling clothes is much expanded in Azerbaijan because people like to wear different nice clothing. Women like to dress up beautifully for weddings, parties, holidays and for everyday life. Guler has worked in this area for five years and knows her clients’ demands very well.

Guler’s income doesn’t cover her family’s demands and it’s hard for her to pay rent for a shop where she sells. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to supply new, modern clothing and increase the assortment of her shop. She plans to sell more clothes and increase her income for paying a rent. She hopes to expand the business and help her family in such a hard time.

loans.use: to supply new, modern clothing and increase the assortment of her shop.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha has operated a retail business selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business and she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

Here again, she comes to you requesting for a loan of Kshs 20,000. She wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to add to her stock. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to add to her stock.

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is married and has been blessed with 5 school going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes in the upbringing of their children. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Meali operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access this loan to boost her business.

Meali dreams to expand her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fruits for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer for topsoil and leaves, pesticide and herbicide.

loans.name: Rukije

texts.en: Rukije wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which has helped her to do general renovations to her house. This loan has helped her to improve the living conditions for her and her family. Rukije has decided to start her own business selling food products. She now for the second time is requesting a loan in order to prepare the shop, which is located within her home. She is very optimistic that she can earn a profit from this business and improve the living conditions of her family. She is very grateful for this support.

loans.use: to start own business selling food products.

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
Aggrey is 52 years old, married and together with his spouse Rose, they have been blessed with four children, ages 27, 23, 19 and 16 years.

Aggrey runs a general store where he sells different kinds of retail products like sugar, flour, soap and other household products. He has been in business for the last 20 years earning a monthly income of KES 40,000.

Aggrey has requested his fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 100,000 to purchase retail goods to sell. It is important to note that this being his fifth loan, Aggrey successfully repaid his previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Aggrey will be able to pay school fees for his children.
Agrrey's hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable and successful business.

loans.use: to purchase retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 27 years old and a mother of two children. She helps her husband earns a living with her vegetable garden and has been doing this for three years. She planned to cultivate the vacant lot to expand her gardening plot. 

Rosalyn borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy seedlings and organic fertilizer. 
She sells her vegetables in the market and to her neighbors. In this picture, she is in front of her little house where she plans to renovate.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has been earning from her farm for over six years. She had successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for farming cost and she earns good income from her farm. She cultivated the adjacent lot and planted more root crops. 

Lorna took out a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure. It helps to boosts her farm. 

She hopes to have an abundant harvest in order to generate better income for the purpose of renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 30-year-old woman married to Justus who adds additional income to support their family welfare. They are blessed with two children. Mercy has been operating a grocery stall for a period of eight years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Mercy was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000 and intends to use this amount to buy bananas, oranges, watermelons, pineapples and vegetables.

Mercy plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, watermelons, pineapples and vegetables.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh 47, is married and lives with her four children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a mason while she has earned a living selling noodles with beef for the last four years. She went into this line of work to cover her expenses and generate income to use raising her children. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying food to sell and to repair her motorbike. She would also like to use part of this loan to pay for her children's school fees. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her family's income and invest in the future of both her business and her children.

loans.use: to buy food to sell, repair her motorbike and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Juvelyne

texts.en:
Juvelyne is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juvelyne is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Juvelyne has a food vending business in the Philippines. Juvelyne requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, fish, meat, noodles, etc. for her food production business.

Juvelyne has been in this business for five years. In the future Juvelyne would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
