loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, fish, meat, noodles, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 40 years old from the community of Carles in Iloilo. She has one son who is 5 years old. Marilyn is engaged in fishing and also owns a sari-sari (variety) store business to provide for her son. She works hard for his future. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise and a fishing net. The income generated will be used for family consumption, reinvestment in the businesses and the education of her son.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it more successful.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a fishing net

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is 36 with one child and is separated from her husband. She runs a retail clothing store in town to earn a living. After over five years running the business, she wants some improvements to offer to her costumers. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase a wider variety of fashion clothing to sell. She hopes to expand her business for a better future for her child.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of fashion clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and body crèmes in order to start her small business.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rizalina is 51 years old and five of her children are currently in school.

Rizalina has a dry goods business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to increase her stock of dry goods to sell, such as belts, slippers, toys, etc.

Rizalina has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell, such as belts, slippers, toys, etc.

loans.name: Telesfora

texts.en: Telesfora works hard to support her family. Telesfora is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional material and gear for her business. Telesfora has been in this business for 11 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional material and gear for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has operated a retail business of selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour and crates of soda, among other necessities. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour and crates of soda, among other necessities.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a mango and banana resale business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years.

Juanita requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more bananas and mangoes to sell.

In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and mangoes to sell

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For 28 years, Lien has run a business of selling meals for people in her community. Her husband helps her in that business.

Lien would like a loan to upgrade and repair her food stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for the future and any difficulties her family may face.

loans.use: to upgrade and repair her food stall

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai would like to take a further loan to buy more kinds of food, such as biscuits and soft drinks, to sell. Mai's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of food, such as biscuits and soft drinks, to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Kapan town with her 8-year-old son. To be financially secure and ensure a stable income for herself and her son, Nver, she started up her retail business three years ago. Maria now needs to bring in more stock so she has applied for this loan. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please help this hard working woman to enlarge her stock of clothing supplies and provide a larger variety clothing to her customers.

loans.use: to buy new stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy a food cart and repair the washroom. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a food cart and repair the washroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase household products and offer her customers a wider variety of products in her general store.

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en:
Muoi is 48 years old, and is married with two children. She and her husband have been running a general store for selling food, soft drinks, and household items in front of their door for 13 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Muoi is requesting a loan to expand her business and to buy a larger quantity of food and beverages to stock her store. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Angela Cristina

texts.es:
Uno de los negocios característicos de Sololá es la crianza de animales de todo tipo. Desde hace 2 años Angela de 49 años, quien vive en su comunidad, se dedica a la   crianza de pollos, negocio que genera una satisfactoria ganancia para el beneficio de su familia y para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Ella tiene 8 hijos por quienes lucha cada día los cuatro primeros ya son casados y tienen familias apartes y los cuatro últimos son estudian en la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.

La actividad que ella realiza es la compra, venta y crianza de pollos en la comunidad donde ella vive, a ella le genera ganancias buenas porque no tiene competencia en dicho negocio y le ayuda a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.

Hace una solicitud de préstamo para la compra de pollos de granja y criollos y como también la compra de concentrado y vitaminas para pollos y así genera más ganancias para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y apoyar a su comunidad en un desarrollo hacia el futuro.
	
Son sus metas para generar más ingresos y el sostenimiento de su familia y seguir en la crianza de pollos y la compra de un molino de nixtamal y que sus hijos sean profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
One of the big businesses in the city of Sololá is animal husbandry. For two years now, Angela, who is 49, has dedicated herself to raising chickens. This business generates a satisfactory income that benefits her family and improves her children's quality of life. She has eight children for whom she fights every day. The first four are married and have their own families and the last four are studying at the school that is close to their community. 

Her business includes buying, selling and raising chickens in the community where she lives. She makes a good living because she has no competition. She is requesting a loan to buy farm chickens, free range chickens (criollos), chicken feed and vitamins in order to increase her income and improve her children's quality of life and support her community's development into the future. 

Her goals are to improve her income, support her family, continue her chicken business, buy a corn mill (for tamales). She hopes her children will pursue professional careers in the future.

loans.use: buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Promise, which is located in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. The group is composed of five hard-working members, the majority of whom have never attended school. They primarily speak the Maya language Ga and Twi. Although they lack a formal education, these women have succeeded in managing their businesses, providing income support for their families. They are into the selling of flasks, water bottles, bags, food items, ripe plantains, beans and groceries.

Lydia is the group’s featured borrower. She is 56 years old, divorced, and has one child. Lydia’s business is preparing and selling food items, and selling bags throughout the week. She sells some at her residence and sometimes goes to her customers from one door to another. 

Lydia is requesting for a loan which she will use to buy more bags and food items, and sell to her customers. Her income has helped her to educate her child, take care of their home and reinvest in her business.

Along with Lydia, the other four members have completed a few loan cycles with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch. These loans have helped increase their small businesses. They are extremely grateful for the support of ID-Ghana and its partnership with Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy more bags and food items, and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious is 22 years old and is married with two children. She resides in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe. Precious is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who mentors young students. In addition, she rents a shop at the local business center where she sells products such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, and chips. Precious has been running this business for two years now, and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Precious will purchase more cooking oil, sugar, salt, chips, and soaps to increase her stock. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. She wishes to help vulnerable children in her community and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, sugar, salt, chips, and soap.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony has a bakery business which he has been running for 5 years now. He is 26 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 2 children. He also supports 4 people in her family. 

He will be using this loan to buy more stock of baking flour and crates to use in his bakery. He will be able to supply more bread to his customers and make more income which he will use to cater for his children's school fees.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future he hopes to improve his business and also build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy baking flour and crates.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 47 years old, married and with his spouse has been blessed with six children. He has a clothes-selling business and has been running this business for 23 years now.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya and he will use it to buy more clothes to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to buy the basic needs for his family. 

His future hopes and dreams are to grow his business and be able to provide for his family as well as provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Kapan town with her two school-aged children. Her husband lives and works abroad and sustains his family financially. 

Marine has been in the clothing sales business for 4 years. The assortment of clothing she sells is pretty limited and it needs to be updated and expanded periodically so that her business can be productive and up to date. The loan she asks is very important for her for the purchase of a new stock of clothing.

Marine has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of clothing for resell

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is 57 years old and married with twelve children.  

Vevencia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Vevencia has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vevencia has been pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vevencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en:
Tendai is a young businesswoman from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer. She mentors secondary school students. Over the past year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 15 birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business because she wanted to be financially independent.  

Tendai would like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent. Tendai also wants to go back to school.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking supplies and to make physical improvements to his establishment.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 36 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Alma has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Chiedza

texts.en: Chiedza is a 23-year-old businesswoman who lives in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who mentors secondary school students. Over the last year, she has expanded her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business in 2012 because she wanted to be financially independent. Chiedza would like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use this Kiva loan to buy more broiler chicks to raise and feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent, and also intends to employ someone to help her run the business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, feed and medications.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 54 years old and she sells clothes in Kisumu town. She is married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with three children. Her spouse also provides additional income.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of clothes such as shirts and jeans trousers to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to add more clothes.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Conrad

texts.en:
Conrad is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children. He supplies bread to various retail shops in his town and has been in this business for 10 year now. 

He will be using this loan to buy more bread for supply. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. In the future he hopes to grow his business and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more bread for supply.

loans.name: Fabian Yoel

texts.es:
Fabian es un joven soltero de 20 años con muchas ganas de salir adelante y brindarle lo mejor a su familia, es por ello que trabaja como empleado en una empresa en su ciudad natal, Lima. El buen desempeño en su trabajo es el resultado de todo el esfuerzo y la dedicación con el que cada día cumple su labor. Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por ellos que lucha constantemente para poder brindarles un mejor futuro.
Fabian está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá construir el piso de su casa para mayor seguridad y comodidad de su familia, así estará mejorando su calidad de vida y continuará esforzándose para más adelante empezar a estudiar la carrera de Derecho.
texts.en:
Fabian, 20, is single and wants to get ahead in life and provide the best for his family. That is why he works as an employee in a company in his birth place, Lima. His good performance at work is a result of the effort and dedication he puts into his job very day. The biggest impetus in his life is his family; he fights hard to provide them with a better future.

Fabian is grateful in advance to the Kiva lenders for their support. With this loan, he'll be able to build a floor in his home for his family's security and comfort. He wants to improve his quality of life and continue working hard so he can study law in the future.

loans.use: build a floor in his home.

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is 28 years old and married with one child, who is currently in school. She works very hard to provide for her child.

Argie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, milk, juice, soft-drinks, biscuits, candies, etc. 

Argie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina owns a food selling business where her neighbors and passersby are her customers. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of operation.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the future. She thanks Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chick, feed, and drugs.

loans.name: Kamunyaka Hope Well Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Esther, a member of Kamunyaka Hope Well Women Group. She is fifty seven years old, married and blessed with seven children. 

She does vegetable farming and grows cabbages and carrots. She is applying for a loan to buy manure to help improve her crop yield. She looks forward to bountiful harvests leading to higher income.  This will help support her children by providing education, clothing and also ensuring food security in her household.
 
Esther is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and she promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as lotions, quilts, and electrical appliances, among other things, to sell.

loans.name: Rosantina

texts.en:
Rosantina has been involved in business activities since 2000, she started with her own working capital of $1000. She has a kiosk, and Rosantina hopes to open a bigger, business in the future. 

Now she is requesting a loan of $1500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business and to increase her income. After she gets the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she will use it to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including sugar, noodles, biscuits, tea, soy sauce, ketchup, water, cigarettes, soft drinks, hard drinks, perfume, clothes and other things to sell. 

She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, biscuits, tea, soy sauce, ketchup, water, cigarettes, soft drinks, hard drinks, perfume, clothes and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three more sewing machines, materials, and sewing thread.

loans.name: Ismael Felipe

texts.es:
Ismael es un hombre muy luchador y soltero de 27 años que vive en Ica junto a su familia. En sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y ayuda a su mamá quien es su mayor motivación en la vida para salir adelante. Por iniciativa propia con mucho esfuerzo trabaja como taxista, trasladando a los clientes a diversos destinos de la ciudad, y cree que le va bien por su empeño y porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de sus clientes.
Ismael está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar toda la revisión y mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo, de esta manera no tendrá inconvenientes al momento de transportar a sus clientes y seguirá luchando para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ismael is a very determined 27-year-old bachelor who lives in Ica with his family. In his free time he likes to listen to music, and he helps his mother, who is the greatest motivation in his life for succeeding. On his own initiative, and after a lot of effort, he works as a taxi driver, transporting different customers to various parts of the city. He thinks his work is going well because of his dedication and because he always like to look after his customers' welfare.

Ismael is grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support he will be able to to carry out all the work and maintenance on the vehicle he uses for work. In this way, he won't have any problems when he transports his customers, and he will be able to carry on fighting to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his car.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and her three children are in school.

Edelyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs. Edelyn has been in the pig-fattening business for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her enterprise.

In the future, Edelyn would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Charlita is 28 years old and her two children are in school.

Charlita has a business selling soft drinks in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell.

In the future, Charlita would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a motorbike that will enable her to distribute her dishes more efficiently.

loans.name: Dieyfroza

texts.en: Dieyfroza is married and the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past three years, she has earned a living running a tea shop where she sells to local customers tea that she makes at home. Her biggest challenge is stiff competition from other tea sellers. She is requesting this Kshs 30,000 loan to buy sugar, beans and tea leaves for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans and tea leaves

loans.name: Dilbarkan

texts.ru: Дилбаркан 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Дилбаркан среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 2007 году благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Дилбаркан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 1 корова, 10 овец и 2 лошади.  Также есть земельный надел мерою 1,98 ГА, где она сеет ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Дилбаркан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для закупки скота, а именно 3 коров. Дилбаркан намерена развивать свой бизнес, построить большой сарай для скота и купить новый автомобиль для семьи.
texts.en: Dilbarkan is 44 years old, married and raising 5 children together with her husband. Dilbarkan has a secondary education, and to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2007. Thanks to her diligence, drive and hard work, today Dilbarkan has 1 cow, 10 sheep, and 2 horses. She also has a 1.98 hectare land plot, where she plants barley. The monthly income amount to about 15,000 som (KGS). Dilbarkan requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock, specifically 3 cows. Dilbarkan intends to develop her business further, build a large barn for livestock and buy a new car for the family.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to grow her business and build a large barn for livestokc

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. 

Mariamu requested another loan from Yehu for 50,000 KES, which she will use to purchase seven sacks of coconuts and cashew nuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts and cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photograph is Viola. She is forty-one years old, married and blessed with three children. She practices maize and bean farming. Most of the produce is for commercial purposes. She is borrowing a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. This will increase her crop yield and enable her to meet her customers' rising demand for maize and beans. She hopes for increased income. This will enable her to support her children's education and family's basic needs.

Viola is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for this support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Maendeleo Women Group

texts.en: Margaret, who we see here raising her hand, is a member of the Maendeleo Women's Group. She is 49 years old, married and blessed with five children. She earns a living by raising maize and beans and has also for the last six years run a kiosk where she sells various food items. Having gone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise management, she is able to run her enterprise effectively. Margaret has applied for a loan to buy more bananas, mangoes and oranges to sell to her customers. She hopes her business will thrive so that she can earn more income and pay for the education of her children. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy bananas, mangoes and oranges.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a wardrobe for her house.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 48 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store.

Tita has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fruit- and vegetable vending.

Tita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bagman

texts.en:
Bagman is 39 year old, married, and has three children. The family lives in an IDP settlement because they are refugees. The family's main source of income is gardening; Bagman raises and sells fruits and vegetables, which he has been doing 10 years. People buy fresh fruits to prepare different delicious pies and juice and use vegetables to cook tasty dishes. His monthly income is 250 AZN.

Baman requested a loan for 1,200 AZN, which he will use to buy fertilizers for his garden. With the loan, he hopes to increase productivity.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mejumaa operates a vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market, to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge -- the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business, in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase vegetables to resell, including green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell, including green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Lendita

texts.en:
Lendita is a 39-year-old Romani woman who is also a mother of 6 children. Her husband works as a cleaner and has a very low salary. In order to help with the family needs, she has started doing handicrafts from her house. 

Now, Lendita is in need of a loan to purchase more materials for her work. This loan will help her to continue to add income to their family. She is very happy to have this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials and continue to add income to their family

loans.name: Dufatanyingufu Group

texts.en:
Dufatanyingufu is a group led by Marie Therese who is 38 years old. The group name means “sharing power” in English. The group members sell different items, and they all believe they will improve their businesses through the loan. 

Marie Therese has been a group leader for the past 6 years. She sells foodstuffs. With the loan, Marie Therese would like to buy more foodstuffs like banana, cassava and potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs like banana, cassava and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
En Sololá existe una variedad de negocios donde la gente puede escoger donde consumir sus necesidades diarias.  Pero lo importante no es la cantidad de consumo sino la calidad de esos servicios al cliente.

Anastacia mujer de 61 años se ha dedicado, con su tienda de abarroterías, servir al público con una calidad de servicio.  Se necesita una vocación especial para ello y Anastacia lo tiene porque es una de las negociantes más buscadas en su negocio, ella lleva realizando durante más de trece años y para ella es una forma de cómo obtener ingresos económico para el sostenimiento de su familia. Ella realiza diferentes actividades tales como: venta de ropa típica, venta de tacos y la venta de papas fritas.

Dos razones le han motivado para solicitar  un préstamo: ampliar su negocio en la compra de mercadería de abarrotería por la cantidad de clientes que le buscan y la necesidad que tiene de construir una casa para sus dos hijos.  

Las aspiraciones que ella tiene es la ampliación de su tienda para obtener mejores ganancias y para la construcción de su casa para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y que se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
In Sololá, there are a variety of businesses that people can choose from to meet their daily consumption needs.  The important thing, however, is not the amount of consumption, but the quality of those services to the customer.

Anastacia, a 61 year old woman, has devoted herself to her grocery store, providing the public with quality service.  A special vocation is needed for this work, and Anastacia has it because she is one of the most sought after businesswomen in her business.  She has been managing her business for more than thirteen years and it is a way for her to obtain income to support her family.  She is engaged in several activities such as selling traditional clothing, tacos, and French fries.

There are two reasons that have motivated her to apply for a loan. She wishes to expand her business by purchasing grocery goods for the amount of customers that are looking for it, and she needs to build a house for her two children.

She aspires to expand her store to earn better profits, and to build a house to improve living conditions for her family, and hopes that her children become professionals in life

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizer, manure, urea and coffee formula to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
Margret and her group members thank all Kiva lenders for their successful first loan. Members used their previous loan to expand their farms, buy good quality seeds and farm tools. As a result, their season harvests doubled and their incomes from sale of farm harvests increased. For example, Margret used part of her income ($225) to buy a cow - that she named YICE. She used the rest of her income to pay school fees for her children and bought a wheel chair for her son with disability. 
Margret seeks to get a new loan to expand her garden, hire casual laborers, buy quality seeds and herbicides for her new garden.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs like good quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pestcides to improve their farming

loans.name: Felista's Group

texts.en:
Felista’s group members are so grateful to Kiva lenders for their previous loan. Felista, who had not received any loan in her life time, used her loan to buy farm inputs, paid casual laborers to cultivate her land and bought a ton of cow dung manures for her garden. Felista harvested four tons of onions and over 260 cases of tomatoes – this was her biggest harvest ever! She used part of her harvest sales to buy three pigs and paid school fees for her children. 
She asks for a new loan to expand her garden and she also plans to hire a piece of land to open a new garden. She will use part of the loan to buy good farm inputs and more manures for her garden.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs like good quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is a single mother of one child. She resides in Buhera District, Zimbabwe. Hilda is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who teaches secondary students leadership skills. Additionally, Hilda operates a poultry project at her homestead. With the Kiva loan, Hilda intends to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed. She hopes to improve her standard of living and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 32 years old, from Carles, Iloilo. She is married, with three children, ages six, eight, and nine. 

Lida and her husband have been fishing for ten years now to support their family. She is asking for a loan to buy a fishing boat, engine, fishing weights, rope, fish net, and floaters. These are necessary in order for their livelihood to flourish. Her income will keep her children healthy and in school.

In the future, Lida wishes to expand her business, so she can continue supporting her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, engine, fishing weights, rope, fish net, and floaters.

loans.name: Eyzangul

texts.en:
Eyzangul is 59 years old and a widow. She has a daughter and two sons. Her elder son is a driver and earns money for the family, somehow. The family lives in an IDP settlement, and the main source of income for them is gardening. Eyzangul has been raising seasonal fruits and selling them at the local bazaar, for 30 years. She sells fruits at the local bazaar, because she knows that fresh fruits are always in high demand. She raises very tasty fruits, such as grapes, apples, cherries, and so on. Her monthly income is 220 AZN, and this money doesn’t cover her family's needs.

Because her income isn’t enough for the family, she applied for a 1000 AZN loan, which she will use to buy good garden tools and fertilizers. This purchase will increase the productivity and income of the family. This is Eyzangul's first loan. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy good garden tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Musenya

texts.en:
Musenya is a 54-year-old woman. She is married to Katemi, who adds additional income to support their family, and they are blessed with four children.  Musenya has been operating a cereals stall/shop for a period of five years, earning an income of KES 5,000 at the end of every month.

Musenya was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000. She intends to use this amount to buy maize to sell to her customers.

Musenya plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a crib and baby clothes for his newborn child.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth's group members thank all Kiva lenders for their previous loan. Members used their previous loan to buy good quality farm inputs, seeds, tools, and fertilizers that enabled them to maximize their farm harvest by over 150% from the previous harvest. 

Ruth used her loan to buy good quality ground nuts seeds and manures. This season she harvested 463 lbs of ground nuts from the 139 lbs she harvested last season on the same land. She used some of her harvest sale to buy a 50x100 feet plot where she plans to plant tomatoes this season. 

She asks for a new loan to enable her to cultivate her new land, expand her ground nut garden and buy good quality farm inputs for her garden.

loans.use: To cultivate new garden and buy farm inputs like good quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides

loans.name: Sehare

texts.en:
Sehare is a married 34-years-old mother with three children. Her husband works in goods transportation, while she works as a cleaner in a private residence. She is very busy all day with her work. 

Sehare is requesting a loan in order to insulate her home before the upcoming winter season. The house is normally very drafty and does not retain the heat well, therefore it costs them a lot of money to stay warm. The home is also starting to have damage from the water leaks during the snow and rain. She would like to address this before it causes more significant damage and problems. 

She is very happy for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to insulate her home before the upcoming winter season

loans.name: Dora Alicia Acuña Gonzalez's Group

texts.en:
Dora Alicia and Adela live in a small community belonging to Tuxpan municipality, in Veracurz. They are devoted mothers and economically dependent on the incomes from their husbands' work in the field. 
Dora Alicia has two kids that attend school and she is positive that education is very important for their future and wishes her children have better lighting to complete homework once the sun has set. 
When her children are at school, she makes bread and sells it at her bakery, a small business she has achieved with great effort. She wishes the family could spend more time together, extending the light hours so she can share some of the bread she makes with her husband, who arrives late at night. She is also looking forward to charge her cellphone so she can hear music while baking and she can have a phone for special orders.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow them reduce household spending and improve their home lighting

location.town: COL. FIDEL HERRERA BELTRAN, TUXPAN, Veracruz

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. She has 10 years of experience in this field. Her husband helps her in the business. She is the mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

Kousar wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand for these items at her shop. She expects to see an increase in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Sameena

texts.en:
Sameena is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling bed sheets and covers for many years. She always has a great collection to offer to her customers. Her husband also assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in the local market. She makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income.

For the improvement of her business, Sameena contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. With this loan, she would be able to purchase a greater variety of bed sheets, covers and spreads in various colours and designs. She is expecting to see an increase in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of bed sheets, covers and spreads in various colours and designs.

loans.name: Tamil-1 Shg - Thirupurapiyam Group

texts.en:
Kala, 40 years old, is a leader of the Tamil-1 Self Help Group, which was formed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Thirupurapiyam village, Tanjore District, Tamil Nadu. Kala lives in her own house with her two children and husband. Her husband is a farmer. Kala has been taking loans from the PAT and she is regular in her repayment of the loans on time.    

According to the 2011 census, 70% of India still cooks on timber, animal dung and crop residues. The largest quality issue is that rural India still cooks on the mud stove, which is both inefficient and poses considerable health hazards due to the smoke and soot released. Therefore Kala wants to buy a smokeless stove for her family. The stove is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. It costs 1400 India Rupees (INR). It is more efficient than the traditional mud stove. Traditional stoves consume more time and money. Burning of biomass fuels causes almost 500,000 deaths every year in India alone (Source: WHO 2009). Smokeless stoves prevent sickness and deaths from the indoor air pollution due to cooking activities.   

Kala and the other members of the group are requesting a loan to each buy a smokeless stove and have a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her final postgraduate courses

loans.name: Irum

texts.en: Irum is 30 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo (sitting with Irum in a rickshaw) is Irum’s husband. He is a driver by profession, and he provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the vehicle requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Irum has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, which she will use for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts, for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Irum hopes that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and that it will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare parts for the rickshaw

loans.name: Virginia Morales Senaida's Group

texts.en:
Virginia, Daniel and Dominga live in a community in Ometepec municipality, one of the poorest mountain regions in the state of Guerrero. This is an area rich in terms of vegetation and natural resources, but with complications to access electricity due to geography.

Virginia and her family are proud farmers who harvest mainly corn but sometimes they also plant beans to have some extra money. But Virginia is also an artist! She weaves beautiful blouses and skirts with the regional tradition motifs. She told us that if they have access to alternative and quality lighting sources by acquiring a solar home system, the family will be able to spend more quality time with each other, and also she would be able to weave more and teach her young daughter so they can make more money and pass on the family tradition.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will substitute the use of batteries and fuel to improve her family's quality of living

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine's group members thank Kiva lenders for their previous loan. The members used the loan to buy good quality inputs, fertilizers and paid casual laborers to plough their gardens. Their harvest doubled from the previous farming seasons.

Josephine, the group chairperson, used part of her crop sales to buy three pigs and paid school fees for her children. 

Josephine's group request for a new loan to start ploughing new gardens and expand their farms. They will use this new loan to pay casual labours, buy good quality seeds and fertilizers for their new gardens.

loans.use: to expand garden and pay for farm inputs like good quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio es un feliz padre de familia, casado con una maravillosa mujer con quien formó un hogar lleno de amor con 3 hijos por quien da su vida para poder brindarles mejores oportunidades en la vida. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la venta de verduras y menestras en el campo ferial de su ciudad, cree que le va bien por todo su esfuerzo, su ardua labor diaria y porque es una muy buena persona.
Leoncio está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar semillas como pallares para sembrar en su chacra, con esto sus ventas mejorarán y así más adelante podrá ampliar su negocio y ofrecer más productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leoncio is the happy father of a family, married to a wonderful woman with whom he has home full of love. They have 3 children, and they give their all to offer them better opportunities in life.

For more than 10 years now, he has sold vegetables and lentils for a living, in his city's fairgrounds. He believes that everything is going well for him because of all his effort, his hard work every day, and because he is a very good person.

Leoncio thanks the lenders on Kiva for the support they provide. He will be able to purchase seeds, such as lima beans, to sow on his fields. This will give him better sales and allow him to expand his business and offer more products to his customers in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, such as lima beans, to sow in his fields

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian de 57 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad y trabajando.

Mirian trabaja para una familia de la zona urbana, realiza los oficios de la casa, lleva cerca de 20 años trabajando de esta manera porque no encontró otra forma de mantener a sus hijos.

Necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas, fertilizante para el suelo, semillas, plaguicidas, herbicida y fertilizante foliar para sembrar 7,000 mts cuadrados de frijol, labor que realizaran sus hijos.

Mirian piensa seguir trabajando mientras Dios le preste vida, ya que quiere algún día mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mirian, aged 57, is a single mother to three children, all of whom are of legal age and work.

Mirian works as a housekeeper for a family in the urban area. She has been following this occupation for 20 years because she couldn’t find another way to provide for her children.

She needs a loan to purchase agricultural inputs such as soil fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, herbicides, and foliar fertilizer to plant beans on an area of 7,000 square metres (1.7 acres)—a task that will be carried out by her children.

Mirian plans to keep on working for as long as God grants her life because she wants to improve her home someday.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides, herbicides, and foliar and soil fertilizers.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 22-year-old girl who volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools. The course she teaches improves the well-being of students, by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Theresa rents a table at the local flea market, where she sells products such as handbags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for one year, and it has enabled her to support her family.

With the Kiva loan, Theresa will purchase more goods, such as handbags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts, to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs. If she gets the loan, she will use the profits to pay the fees required to write her final exams for secondary school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell, including handbags, shoes, and jeans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Kamae Gathirikari Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is David, a member of Kamae Gathirikari Self Help Group. He is forty-two years old and blessed with two children. 

David practices vegetable farming, growing cabbages, potatoes and carrots. He is happy to have received Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise management that equipped him with skills to manage his business.

David is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. He hopes this loan will help him improve his crop yields and thus bring him increased income. This will enable him to improve the living standards of his family, meaning they will have a quality education and better clothing. 

David is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Mahakaliyamman-1 Shg - Gangatharapuram Group

texts.en:
Amutha leads Mahakaliyamman-1, a group of 8 women residing in the Gangatharapuram village in the Tanjore district of Tamil Nadu. Amutha is the featured borrower. They are all hardworking married women, and to support their families' incomes and meet their monthly expenditures, they have to work. They are engaged in diverse occupations and either work as daily wage agricultural laborers,  as employees in small private firms, or they run their own small rural businesses. However, with their meager incomes, they still have some way to go in terms of improving their living conditions. For cooking, they mostly use the traditional chulhas, which are makeshift stoves that use firewood, which emits a lot of smoke. The smoke not only causes health problems among the family members, but also pollutes their surroundings.

This 8-member group is seeking a loan to purchase 8 Greenway cooking stoves. The benefits of the Greenway stoves are fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of harmful carbon components, fast and convenient cooking,  high durability, being maintenance free, and being smokeless. They intend to repay the loan amount in easy installments. This loan product will help them in preventing diseases, saving on firewood expenses, and promoting a clean environment.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless cooking stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding tools to expand his business and improve the standards of living for his family

loans.name: Mahakaliyamman Shg - Gangatharapuram Group

texts.en:
Amutha, who is 40 years old, is a leader of the Mahakaliyamman Self Help Group, which was formed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Gangatharapuram village, Tanjore District, Tamil Nadu. Amutha lives in her own house with her children and husband. Her husband is a farmer. Amutha has been taking loans from PAT and she is regular in her repayment of the loans on time.    

According to the 2011 census, 70% of India still cooks on timber, animal dung and crop residues. The largest quality issue is that rural India still cooks on the mud stove which is both inefficient and poses considerable health hazards due to the smoke and soot released. Amutha wants to buy a smokeless stove for her family. The stove is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. and costs 1400 India Rupees (INR). It is more efficient than the traditional mud stove. Traditional stoves consume more time and money. Burning of biomass fuels causes almost 500,000 deaths every year in India alone (Source: WHO 2009). Smokeless stoves prevent sickness and deaths from the indoor air pollution due to cooking activities.  

Amutha and the other members of the group are requesting a loan to each buy a smokeless stove and have a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger lives in a community in the city of Santa Barbara in Honduras. He is an individual trader and in addition is a coffee farmer. He is 36 years old; he is married and has three children. It is clear that Roger works hard to maintain his family, and with the opportunity to be a distributor of solar lamps,  he can grow his business and improve the living conditions of his family. In addition to helping people that buy these lamps to reduce costs of kerosene, candles and recharge of cell phones.
Roger is requesting a loan to purchase solar lamps from Soluz Honduras, that it will allow him to grow his business.

loans.use: To establish his own business and become a distributor of solar lamps, and thus, improve his living conditions and provide access to lighting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for postgraduate courses

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman who has six kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives at a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a fruits and vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces challenges of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan,  Mwanarusi  wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas, and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas, and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Yerevan with her husband and two little children (5-year-old and newborn sons). 

Anahit brings the clothes that she sells from Yerevan and sometimes from a neighboring country in a rented car. She has been in the trading business for about four years and she has a great deal of experience in this field. She greets customers with a smile, offers them clothes of various sizes and fashions, and offers prices that are as cheap as possible. As a result, Anahit has many regular customers and good income from her business. 

Anahit now asks for this loan in order to be able to purchase new stocks of clothing to sell to her customers. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: Pheap’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Pheap makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs she also does extra work as a farm laborer and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 32-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has two buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. 

Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She uses most of the income to pay for her children’s health and education. It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia, age 34, is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. 

Rafia needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Laika

texts.en:
Laika resides in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe where she has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the wellbeing of students by enhancing their learning environment. 

In addition, Laika rents a shop at the local market place where she sells flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil and soaps. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Laika will purchase flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soaps to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. With additional funds, she hopes to further her education.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soaps to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena is a 36-year-old married woman doing a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband for the past 10 years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. 

Haseena is in her third loan cycle and has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). She intends to utilize the loan amount to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been running a business of trading cloth for 7 years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Naseem requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation to purchase a new collection for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Taj

texts.en:
Taj is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. One of her sons, who is also shown in the photo, some time ago, started a van driving business. He owns one Toyota van and needs some financial help. He will use the amount to pay for repair and maintenance costs and to buy new tires for the van. 

Taj has requested a loan amount of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She is thankful, for previous loans, to Kashf. She is hopeful that her son’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs and to buy new tires.

loans.name: Lchun's Group

texts.en: Lchun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Lchun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Single Mothers Group

texts.en:
Juliet, aged 48, is a member of the Single Mothers group. She started buying and selling clothes in 2002. This was after she separated with her husband in 2001 and had to find means of taking care of her two school going children. Juliet has faced countless challenges in trying to make her business viable and successful. She had very little knowledge on how to save and have daily records of all her business transactions. Juliet was also constantly faced with the problems of not offering enough variety to her customers. This led to a decrease in number of her customers. She ended up being indebted as she mostly depended on borrowing from friends and family for school fees money for her children. 

However, as a result of the training she received at Thrive, Juliet is now able to make daily records of her business transactions and making regular savings. With the help of a loan from Thrive, Juliet looks forward to seeing her business growing to the extent of renting her own premises. A Kiva loan will go a long way in fronting Juliet’s fight against poverty.

loans.use: To increase the range of clothes she has for sale.

loans.name: Mehpare

texts.en:
Mehpare is a 39-year-old single woman. She is an IDP and she  lives with her parents  in the Bilasuvar region. She earns money for the family by raising and selling fruits. She has been working in this field for 14 years and gained good skills. Her monthly income is 200 AZN and it doesn’t cover her big family’s demands. 

She raises fruits in the garden of her house and her mother helps her to sell them at a local bazaar. She has a grocery for a rent at a local bazaar and pays money every month for it.  She knows everything about gardening and knows customers’ demands. She raises fruits carefully and properly in order to get a harvest of high quality. 

Mehpare loves her job  and her parents support her in everything and she wants to provide them good and happy lives. She applied for a 600 AZN loan in order to buy  garden tools. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy  garden tools.

loans.name: Jemmimah

texts.en:
Jemmimah has a clothes-selling business in Tala town. She is 25 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with three children. She has been in the clothes-selling business for four years, and right now, her monthly income is KES 20,000.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to start a retail shop.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she repaid her previous loan successfully. She hopes to expand her business and start up a retail shop business, make more income, and be able to live a better life with her family, in future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Cristita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
A dedicated mother of five who wants the best for her children, Naseem, 36 years old, has been selling milk for many years in her area with the help of her husband. With one buffalo for milking purposes, her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.

Naseem is now requesting her fourth loan for 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She will use it to purchase another buffalo for milking to expand her enterprise. Her goal is to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en: Rom’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Rom makes a living cultivating rice and raising the chicken with her family and her son also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a businesswoman living in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. She lives with her parents and is the last born in the family. She has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the wellbeing of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Prisca rents a shop at the local market where she sells products such as sugar, salt, soap, bread, sweets, and cooking oil. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Prisca will purchase sugar, salt, soap, bread, sweets, and cooking oil to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs. With the profits she wants to help the community, help orphans, and complete her secondary education.

loans.use: To  purchase sugar, salt, soap, bread, sweets, and cooking oil to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 46 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business, selling animals, for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out, near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business, with the support of Kashf Foundation. Most recently, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats. She is in her fifth loan cycle, with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old and married. She has three children. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for three years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

Gemma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María 
Alajuela

María tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos y su esposo, viven en una zona de Alajuela, donde existen condiciones de pobreza entre sus habitantes; para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia  hace 10 años y por iniciativa propia, comenzó en el comercio vendiendo ropa y otros artículos teniendo un desarrollo importante de su microempresa con 2 créditos otorgados por FM en el 2010 y el 2012, invirtiendo en electrodomésticos que compra en el depósito de Golfito y comercializa en la zona de Alajuela, inversión que realizó con los préstamos  anteriores. El lapso de los años y gracias al esfuerzo de ella su microempresa ha crecido. Ahora comercializa productos de catálogo (utensilios de plástico y ropa). 

Su principal prioridad es apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio; al mismo tiempo ella está llevando los cursos para obtener su título de  la secundaria a distancia. Esto le ha ayudado a mejorar en su negocio y espera en el corto plazo obtener el bachillerato. Ha demostrado una excelente conducta de pago y una buena gestión de sus créditos, atendiendo otras necesidades de sus clientes. 

Inicia con un préstamo familiar de 25000 colones para la compra de ropa interior, manteniendo su negocio, con este préstamo, se pretende  aprovechar las ofertas que se dan para la época de Noviembre. 

Este es su tercer  crédito y llegó a  Fundación Mujer por referencia de una amiga que escuchó la información  en un programa de radio. Mantiene  una cartera activa de 30 personas. Ha diversificado su oferta de productos a sus clientes, los cuales vende a pagos.Es una actividad que apoya los ingresos del hogar que se complementan con el trabajo de su esposo en la venta de mariscos, pero al mismo tiempo apoya sus gestiones de cobro y venta de mercadería, además la microempresa cuenta con un vehículo para el traslado de los productos y una motocicleta para el cobro de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old. She lives with her 3 children and her husband in an area of Alajuela where poverty is very common among the inhabitants. To improve her family's quality of life, she started a business on her own initiative 10 years ago, selling clothes and other items.

She has received 2 loans from FM for her small business, one in 2010 and one in 2012. She invested them in household appliances that she bought at the Golfito warehouse and then sold in the Alajuela area. With her efforts and the passing of time, her small business has grown. Now she sells products by catalog (clothes and plastic utensils).

Her main goal is to support her children's schooling. At the same time, she is enrolled in a distance secondary education program. This has helped her improve her business, and in the short term, she expects to receive her high school diploma. She has demonstrated excellent reliability on repayments and has managed her loans well, attending to the needs of her customers.

She started with a family loan of 25,000 CRC to buy underwear, and with this loan, she plans to maintain her business by taking advantage of the special prices offered in November.

This is her third loan. She came to Fundación Mujer [The Women's Foundation] through the recommendation of a friend, who heard about it on a radio program.

She has a list of 30 active clients. She has diversified her offerings for her customers, who pay her in installments. This job's income complements her husband's work selling seafood. It also supports her purchasing and re-selling of merchandise.

Her small business also relies on a vehicle to transport her products, and a motorcycle to collect payment from her customers.

loans.use: Compra de productos de catálogo artículos de plástico y ropa

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell, such as handbags, shoes, and jeans

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a 22-year-old businesswoman, living in the Mwenezi District in Zimbabwe. Melody has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools. Her teaching improves the well-being of students, by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Melody runs a shop where she sells groceries. She sells products such as sugar, rice, salt, matches, ball pens, and cooking oil. She started her business in December 2013, and it has enabled her to support her family.

With the Kiva loan, she intends to purchase her products in bulk and employ other people to assist her. She hopes to build her own shop, one day. With the profits she receives, she wishes to continue her education. She also intends to use the profits to purchase more products. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase her products in bulk and employ other people

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 41-year-old man married to Magaret, who adds additional to support their family welfare. They are blessed with six children.  Jackson has been operating a transportation business and a cereals stall as a secondary business for a period of five years, earning an income of KES 5,000 at the end of every month.

He was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 10,000. He intends to use this amount to purchase maize and beans to sell to his customers on a daily basis.

Jackson plans to use the anticipated income to buy his own plot and build a permanent house for his family.  He hopes to become a  successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To purchase maize and beans to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 55 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, shampoo, sugar, noodles, sanitary pads, biscuits, and soft drinks to sell.

Jesusa has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, shampoo, sugar, noodles, sanitary pads, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. 

Jesusa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, shampoo, sugar, noodles, sanitary pads, biscuits, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Meswaleh

texts.en:
Meswaleh has operated a clothes selling business, selling door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Janet has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jessecca

texts.en:
Jessecca is 34 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Jessecca works very hard to provide for them.

Jessecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock such as candies, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, snack foods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Jessecca has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, snack foods, soft-drinks, etc. 

In the future, Jessecca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like candies, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, snack foods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rubabu

texts.en:
Rubabu operates a retail shop, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

Rubabu is requesting KES 20,000 to boost her business, by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop, in the near future

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell, including wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 43-year-old married woman. About five years ago, she took a small loan from Kashf foundation to start a business of cloth trade. Over the years, her business has flourished. Today, she has a strong customer base and is famous around her locality for good quality cloth. 

In her fifth loan cycle, Rasheeda has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. With this loan amount, she wants to purchase more stock of cloth in different varieties and colors. She is thankful to Kashf foundation for its help which enabled her to have her own business today.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cloth in different varieties and colors.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar, age 44, is a married woman. 

She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them on in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 48-year-old, married woman. She is a very hard-working woman, doing the business of cattle sales and purchases for many years.
