She is working hard to run her home and to provide a better future to her children. She wanted to increase her household income. She has gradually improved her business, with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, Rasheeda has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more cattle. She is in her seventh loan cycle, with good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él es un joven trabajador que se desempeña como empleado de una tienda de pinturas, desde hace 2 años, y es gracias a ello que va saliendo adelante poco a poco. Tratando de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, Víctor desea terminar de construir el corredor de su vivienda y encementar su cuarto dormitorio por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lamina, y madera para construir el corredor de su vivienda y encementar su cuarto dormitorio.
texts.en:
Victor is 24 years old. He lives in his own house with his family.

He is a hard-working young man, who has been working as a clerk at a paint store for the last two years. It is thanks to this job that he is getting ahead little by little.
 
Trying to improve his living conditions, Victor wishes to finish building the corridor of his house and put down a layer of concrete in his bedroom. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI. He will use the loan to purchase cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, and timber to build the corridor of his house and put down a layer of concrete in his bedroom.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, and timber to build the corridor of his house and put down a layer of concrete in his bedroom.

loans.name: Gricelda Arely

texts.es: Gricelda de 39 años de edad vive junto a sus 2 hijas de 19 y 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que ha sabido ganarse la vida y sacar adelante a sus hijas con su pequeño negocio de venta de verduras y ropa la cual realiza desde hace 25 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una extensa cartera de clientes los cuales siempre la esperan para adquirir sus productos. La vivienda de Gricelda es muy humilde, y cuenta con un piso de tierra por lo que ella desea encementar su cuarto dormitorio por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su cuarto dormitorio.
texts.en:
Gricelda, 39 years old, lives with her two daughters, who are 19 and 14 years old. She is a tenacious woman who has known how to earn a living and help her two daughters get ahead. She has had a small business selling vegetables and clothing for 25 years and has a large group of customers who always look to her to buy their products.

Gricelda’s dwelling is very modest with a dirt floor and she wants to install a concrete floor in her bedroom. Consequently she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement sand and gravel in order to lay a concrete floor in her bedroom.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and gravel in order to install a concrete floor in her bedroom.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de agua de coco, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, Juan esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cocos por mayor para continuar con sus negocio y asi obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 47 years old. He lives with his wife and his two children in his own house. He earns a living selling coconut water. His business is located in his home and he has had it for various years. With the profits, he can cover some of the household expenses.

Juan asks for a loan in order to buy coconuts wholesale and by this, to continue with his business and to have a higher income.

loans.use: to buy coconuts wholesale to sell coconut water and increase his income.

loans.name: Carlos Romeo

texts.es: Carlos de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su hija de 4 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida vendiendo granos básicos como: maíz, arroz, frijoles y maicillo, además su compañera de vida le aporta a la economía familiar por medio de su negocio de venta de tortillas. En la vivienda de Carlos se ha empezado a construir una fosa séptica, para el servicio sanitario pero por falta de recursos económicos dicha fosa no se ha terminado de construir lo que está causando insalubridad en la vivienda de Carlos y sus alrededores por lo que decidió solicitar un crédito  a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillos y mano de obra necesaria para terminar de construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is 31 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and his 4-year-old daughter. He is a hard-working man who makes a living selling basic grains such as corn, rice, beans, and sorghum. Additionally, his wife contributes to the family income through her tortilla sale business. 

Construction of a septic pit has started in Carlos's home for sanitary purposes. However, due to a lack of economic resources, the construction of this pit has not been completed, which is causing unhealthiness in Carlos's home and its surroundings. For this reason, he decided to request a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, and brick and to pay the manual labor necessary to finish building the septic pit in his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and brick and to pay the manual labor necessary to finish building a septic pit in his home.

loans.name: Amada Soledad

texts.es: Amada de 57 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida con su elaboración y venta de pan francés y pan dulce ubicado en su casa de habitación, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años por lo que gracias a su experiencia sus productos son de excelente calidad y cada día son más los clientes que prefieren sus productos, la vivienda de Amada tiene el techo deteriorado por lo que ella desea repararlo pero al no contar con el dinero necesario solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lamina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Amada is 57 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She is a hard-working woman who earns a living making and selling French bread and pastries in her home. She has done this for 12 years, and thanks to her experience, her products are of excellent quality and every day there are more customers who prefer her goods.

The roof of Amada's home has deteriorated, therefore she wants to repair it. As she does not have the money she needs, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy: galvanized metal sheeting, beams, and fasteners in order to replace the roof of her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, beams, and fasteners to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 38-year-old man who is married to Waiu. His wife earns income to support their family's welfare. They have been blessed with three children. Daniel has been operating a transportation business and a cereals stall for a period of five years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Daniel was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a friend. Daniel is now servicing his first loan of KES 30,000, and he intends to use the entire amount to buy beans and maize. He will sell these to his customers, on a daily basis.

Daniel plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children. In addition, he hopes to open a new business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses; however, she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

With the KES 50,000 loan,  she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi operates a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vendor in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason, with the KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaws. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaws.

loans.name: Raika

texts.en: Raika resides in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Raika sells kapenta (dried sardines). She has been running this business for two years now and it has enabled her to support her family.  With the Kiva loan Raika will purchase more kapenta. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store one day. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing.

loans.name: Barkat

texts.en:
Barkat is a 50-year-old, married woman. For many years, she has been running a business of cattle sale and purchase, along with her husband. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding the animals, while her husband sells them in different markets in the city. Their business has been providing them with enough income to support their family. Barkat also sells milk, to generate an extra amount of income.

However, now they need to earn much more, to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health care, and clothing. In order to increase their earnings, Barkat has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She will use it to buy more goats, for resale purposes. She hopes that expanding the business will help to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is the age of 39, living in the rural area of Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri district. She is a married woman and blessed with three children (one son and two daughters). She is a very hardworking and gentle woman. Her husband Bhupen is a cycle-van puller by profession. His inconsistent income led illiterate Gita to choose animal breeding for a financial help to her family. Her children are students and she is determined to provide them educational supports at any cost.

She is a milkmaid by profession, and sells milk in her locality. She has been selling milk for many years and now she is very experienced in his profession. She is very expert at producing milk from a cow; she produces milk from her cows every day and delivers to her clients who mostly are her neighbors. Now she wants to give more financial sustenance and for that she wants to increase one more cow in her herd.

So Gita is asking for a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow to sell more milk and earn more profit. She hopes she will be successful in increasing her monthly income as well.

She thanks Kiva and field partner BJS for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy a cow in order to get more milk for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, son 8 hermanos, actualmente trabaja y también estudia, ya que es la única forma de poder salir adelante.
Está estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas.Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Maria is from the city of Paraguari, has 8 siblings, and works and studies, as this is the only way she can get ahead. She is studying Business Administration. She is asking for the loan in order to cover the costs of university, and in this way continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre mujeres unidas, son mujeres muy trabajadoras, que se unieron para poder salir adelante y crecer, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para que por medio de su trabajo vayan mejorando sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ana, quien es la presidenta del grupo, una persona muy trabajadora que quiere dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener, comenta que siendo la presidenta del grupo también trata de poder dar un apoyo a sus compañeras. 
La Sra. Ana solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para  su negocio , como ser harina, levadura, manteca, etc, ya que tiene una panadería con muchos clientes y quiere cumplir con todos ellos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer. El grupo tiene 19 miembros, pero en este ciclo solo 17 de ellas piden este préstamo, por lo que en la foto están 18 mujeres.
texts.en:
This group goes by the name “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women).  They are hardworking women who have joined together so that they can move forward and grow.  These women have taken the poverty elimination survey so that they will be able to improve their lives through their work.  
One of the members is Sra. Ana, who is the president of the group.  She is a hardworking person who wants to give her loved ones everything that she was not able to have.  Ana says that as the president of her group, she tries to provide support for the other members.  
Sra. Ana is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for her business such as flour, yeast, shortening, and other items.  She has a bakery with many customers, so she wants to satisfy all of them.  Ana appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can grow. The group normally has 19 members, but in this cycle only 17 women are taking out loans. That is why there is an additional group member in the photo.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, shortening, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years old,married and together with his spouse has been blessed with three children. He is a poultry farmer and has been in the farming business for one year now. 

He will use this loan to buy more stock of poultry for rearing and also buy poultry feeds. He will use the anticipated profits to buy dairy goats.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to become a large scale poultry farmer and supply chicken and eggs.

loans.use: To buy poultry and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis de 31 años de edad,  está casado desde hace 3 años, es agricultor y soldador, tiene 2 hijos de 3 años de edad y de 3 meses de edad.

Luis además de ser agricultor, trabajo que heredó de su padre, también se dedica a hacer  trabajos de soldaduras, tiene un equipo que compro cuando regreso del extranjero, tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en dicha actividad y tiene su propio taller en su casa.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar materiales de trabajo, electrodos para su equipo y también hierro que necesita para un trabajo que le solicitaron.

Luis espera mejorar la infraestructura de su taller para dar un mejor servicio en calidad, cantidad y tamaño, también espera sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Luis is 31 years old. He has been married for 3 years, he is a farmer and a welder. He has 2 children, who are 3 years old and 3 months old respectively.

Luis besides being a farmer, a job that he inherited from his father, also works doing welding jobs. He has the equipment that he acquired when he came back from living abroad. He has been working in that occupation for over 10 years, and he has his own shop at home.

He'll use the loan to buy working materials, electrodes for the equipment, and also to get the iron he needs for a job assignment.

Luis hopes to improve the infrastructure of the shop to offer a better service regarding quality, amount, and size. He also hopes his children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy iron and electrodes for his welding gun.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married with two children. She resides in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe, where she has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the wellbeing of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Anna rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, and washing soap. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.

With the Kiva loan, Anna will purchase cooking oil, sugar, salt, and washing soap to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, sugar, salt ,and washing soap to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 41 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Melly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income, to contribute to her family's income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. She will use the loan to purchase more stock, such as grains, biscuits, oil, beverages and flour. This will enable her to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store, such as grains, biscuits, and oil

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 53 years old and has five children. One of her children is still in school. Lorelie is married. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Lorelie requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other supplies. She has been farming vegetables for 12 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

In the future, Lorelie would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda tiene 66 años de edad, ella es viuda, vive con su hija en casa propia en el Sector Arequipa del dsitrito de Cayalti, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, donde la vida es muy tranquila y armoniosa.

Olinda se dedica a las actividad de cria y venta de animales, tales como cuyes, conejos, pollos, patos, entre otros, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, solicita préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno, dicha inversión le servirá para poder diversificar su stock de animales, y asi poder atender a todos los gustos de su publico consumidor y por ende aumentar sus ventas, sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olinda is 66 years old. She is a widow and lives with her daughter in her own home in the Arequipa sector of the Cayalti district, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. Her life there is very peaceful and harmonious.

Olinda works raising and selling animals such as guinea pigs, rabbits, chickens, ducks, and more. She has more than 5 years' experience in the business, which is located in the back of her house. She is asking for the loan to buy cattle. This investment will be used to diversify her animal stock so she can meet the demands of her customers and therefore increase her sales, her income and improve her sales and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to diversify her animal stock and be able to meet all of the demands of her consumers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase weights, bicycles and other  exercise equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel her school cafeteria.

loans.name: Ginda

texts.en:
Ginda is 33 years old and has two children who are in school. She is married. 

Ginda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

Ginda has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ginda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity resides in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. She has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well being of students by enhancing their learning environment. She was counselling school students at her school on how to improve life through education and how to behave well.

In addition, Purity rents a shop at the local market where she sells products such as cooking oil, milk, sugar, salt, rice, biscuits, and lotion. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.

With this Kiva loan, Purity will purchase cooking oil, milk, sugar, salt, rice, biscuits, and lotion to increase her inventory. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, milk, sugar, salt, rice, biscuits, and lotion to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 58-years-old and married with four children.  

Dolores is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Dolores has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Dolores would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susana is 47-years-old and has three children who are currently in school.

Susana has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her business.

Susana has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Susana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice works hard to support her family. Janice is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Janice requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Janice has been in this business for 4 years now.

Janice would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Concillia

texts.en:
Concilia is a 23-year-old young woman living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide helping to improve the wellbeing of students in local schools.  Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 45 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2013 because she wanted to be financially independent.  

She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent. With the profits she intends to further her education.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Ondari

texts.en:
Ondari is a youthful 69 year-old Mzee (old man), a wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. He farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kisii region of Kenya .Ondari is happily married and is a proud father of 4 lovely children that he really values and treasures. For the past 8 years he has been involved in mixed farming. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crop farming. He passionately loves dairy farming because of the constant income that he gets and has even nicknamed one of his cows "Gesanako”.  Ondari practices dairy farming with a difference.  He makes his own fodder by manually cutting and storing it for use during dry seasons. Dairy farming is a very profitable business venture in Ogembo Village and has seen an upsurge in growth, but the demand has been so high that the supply of milk cannot be met. Ondari is seeking a loan to buy an additional good breed of a dairy cow. Having understood the market requirements, he wants to take full advantage of the ready demand that is there. The dairy cow he wants to buy is a quality breed that can produce 10-20 liters of milk a day and this will boost his production level significantly. Increased milk production will translate to more profits; hence, improving his living conditions. The breed of cow he will buy has so many advantages. It has high resistance to diseases and its milk has high protein and moderate fats.

Through your loan he is going to make more profits and increase his income level. Profits from milk selling will be used to take care of his children and improve his livelihood financially. He intends to adopt a zero grazing approach which is recommended as the best practice for farmers with small plots like him.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 27-year-old woman married to Peter, who adds additional income to support their family, and they are blessed with one child.  Teresa operates a local money transfer business shop (M-PESA) as an agent for the past six years earning her an income of KES. 35,000 at the end of every month.

Teresa is now servicing her 3rd loan of KES 65,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy additional printing papers, pens, rulers, envelopes, rubbers and glue sticks to add to the current stock which seems to run out.

Teresa plans to use the anticipated income to open a stationery shop in a nearby town and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy additional printing papers, pens, rulers, envelopes, rubbers and glue sticks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia has a retail shop and has been running it for 4 years now. She is 27-years-old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 5 children. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of cooking oil, maize flour, detergents, sugar and rice. She will use the generated profits to educate her children. 

This is her third loan term with visionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Fiorella Patricia

texts.es:
Fiorella es una joven muy emprendedora con 23 años, madre soltera de un pequeño de 3 años quien es el motor de su vida para salir adelante. Con mucho esfuerzo estudió una carrera profesional y actualmente trabaja en una entidad financiera como Analista de Créditos, ella cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y al arduo trabajo que realiza día a día.
Fiorella está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar enseres para su casa, sobre todo para la comodidad de su hijo, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y así seguirá luchando porque más adelante quiere construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Fiorella, 23, is a very enterprising, young woman and a single mother of a three-year-old son who is the driving force to get ahead in her life.  With much effort, she studied for a professional career and nowadays she works in a financial firm as a credit analyst.  She believes things are going well because of her good performance and the hard work she puts in every day.
Fiorella is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support they have offered her, she will be able to buy goods for her house, especially all the things for the comfort of her son.  In this way, she will be improving the quality of her life and thus she will continue struggling because later on she wants to construct a second floor on her house.

loans.use: to buy goods to furnish her house.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Amalia has been in this business for 10 years. Amalia earns more income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Annastancia

texts.en:
Annastancia is a 23-year-old woman and a single parent with one child. Currently she lives in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe. Annastancia lives with her mother and her two sisters. She has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the wellbeing of students by enhancing their learning environment.

In addition, Annastancia rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.

With this Kiva loan, Annastancia will purchase more products to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more products to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Frelin

texts.en:
Frelin is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Frelin is 42-years-old and has two children who are in school.

Frelin has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Frelin requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Frelin has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Frelin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sara Lucia

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer de 23 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de 1 año.
 
Desde joven ha trabajado en la actividad comercial, inició laborando con un familiar en una distribuidora, pero por cuestiones de salud en su embarazo, tuvo que renunciar; hace 1 año comenzó a vender mercancía, ropa, calzado, accesorios y productos por catálogo, con esta actividad tiene la oportunidad de estar al frente de su hogar y cuidar a su hijo. 

Es una mujer emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante, por eso solicita un crédito con la Corporación, el cual desea invertir en la compra de mercancía y productos al por mayor (ropa, accesorios, perfumería, cosméticos, entre otros) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le ofrecen y así poder tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar las ventas. 

Sara sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, convertirlo en un almacén, que le genere mayores ingresos para brindar una mejor educación a su hijo y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Sara is a 23-year-old woman who is married and the mother of a one-year-old child. From a young age, Sara has worked in the retail sector. She started out working with a relative at a distribution center, but she had to quit due to health issues related to her pregnancy. One year ago, she began selling merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and accessories through catalogs. This business also gives her the opportunity to stay at home and take care of her child.

Sara is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Interactuar. She wants to invest in the purchase of merchandise and products in bulk such as clothing, accessories, perfumes, cosmetics, and other items. Sara hopes to take advantage of discounts that are being offered, which will give her a wider variety of products that she can offer to her customers, thus improving her sales.

Sara dreams of growing her business and converting it to a large store where she can generate more income. This would enable her to provide a better education for her child and improve the quality of life for her entire family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories, perfumes, cosmetics, and other items in bulk.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en: Ma. Theresa works hard to support her family. Ma. Theresa is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Ma. Theresa requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for  eight years now. Ma. Theresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more kapenta to sell.
